text: My friends and I were here in June and they were packed ~ the table wait time was 5 minutes.  Our server was friendly and knowledgable, food is good but it's the dessert that I enjoyed the most.  Price range is very affordable for the food and service that they deliver.  Must place to see!

I live in Las Vegas and I'd say I eat sushi all over the city about 5 times a month. I frickin love sushi! This place is pretty yummy. They have really good service. Very friendly. ABSOLUTELY LOVE their vibe the place gives off. Hawaiian music, very chill and gets pretty busy at night too.  As far as fish goes ORDER THE 808 TUNA SALAD! Really tasty.  If youre comming here for all you can eat, I dont really recommend here. I was turned off when I found out they give time limits and only cetain sushi for it. So I'd rather go to Sushi Factory on Eastern. DONT GO TO THE ONE ON TROPICANA, its gross there.   Also they have a conjointed hawaiian food place. Awesome malasadas!

Absolutely love this place.  We used to frequent when they were located downtown Vegas.  We were saddened to hear that they had moved.  On our last drive from CA to CO we decided to stop at the new location and we are sooooo glad we did.  The food here is amazing.  Everything was delicious - short ribs, Portuguese sausage, Teriyaki chicken and Garlic chicken.  And very reasonably priced.  Looking forward to visiting again soon.
The fried noodles and the garlic chicken are my favorites. Sometimes I hate to go in there because I know I am going to spend $60 plus on poke!

I recommended this restaurant to my friends, because I've had a good experience at this place. we sat down for dinner at 7:15 and the restaurant wasn't real busy for a Sunday night. We placed our original order (All You Can Eat) and  waited 20 minutes or so to receive it. Half of our order was brought out and watched as people came in after us starting receiving food we initially ordered. We asked the waiter but he didn't seem to care & never brought us the rest of our food. One person in our party received two items he ordered and that was it. We spoke to the Manager (Jesus) about the horrible service and he offered a 10% discount off ONE dinner, what an insult to us. I definitely wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone that is looking for good food and service. why would you insult your customer, instead of making it right and fixing the situation. There are many good restaurants to choose, why pick one that doesn't understand the value of customer service.

Looked like a "Deli" at the front door, but, went there for the FOOOOD...not the loooooks.!! The food was the "GREATEST" sevice was the best, and It was friendlier than being at Grandmas house !!!! The ; Dragon, the Tiger, can't be beat ! I've lived in this town for 45yrs and have eaten at most Gormet rooms , but the FOOOD here was over the TOP ... Enjoyed it very much, will for sure go again.
That is correct. That was the first time I personally had to wait, but once in... all was forgiven. My go to Sushi is always the Caterpillar roll.

Been coming here for 10 years and something has changed. Horrible service, ordered ribs 3 separate times and never got them, had to constantly chase down the waitress, never refilled drinks.  This place was great but now is a total dump.

Still waiting for the quality of the food, but this is based solely off of the extremely rude woman with the piercing on her cheek taking our order at the cash register. Ive never had a person taking my order literally ignore me while she continues a convo with her coworker. Then, rolled her eyes at my boyfriend, and as we tried to say, "Thank you" she ignored us and contunued talking to her coworker...what a horrible feeling. TIME TO LEARN CUSTOMER SERVICE SKILLS. We just left, we couldnt stand her or the other employees vibes.  The cooks however, need a rasie!!! Seriously though, the food was excellent. The katsu chicken and teriaki chicken fried noodles were to die for!
Fresh seafood, yummy sushi, bomb service!

This place is great. My favorite local Sushi place magically disappeared recently and I have been looking for a replacement for "All You Can Eat" sushi. I have been to a lot of different sushi places in town and find Island to be quite good.  The wait wasn't bad, the staff was great and the food selection/flavor was right where I needed it to be. I will definitely be frequenting this place in the future.

I've been here a few times over several years.  It's Hawaiian themed and some of the food has Hawaiian flare.  I go with a group of people and get the All You Can Eat Sushi.  The Ahi Poke is very good.  They have a good variety and the food is real good.  Desert is also included with the AYCE.  The wait can be long and the service is slow since they seem to be on Hawaiian time.

This place sucks after waiting to be seated which took 10 minutes standing there with the workers standing around. We left. I don't care if they have the best good on the planet. Making us stand there while the watched was B'S. I would never go back there and I would not recommend going there.
The Poke is very good! All you can eat sushi. Fish is very good. You can also get all you can drink saki for an extra $8.00. I recommend this place for good Poki and good all you can eat sushi menu.
Island sushi  is the best , great customer service , best place for eat all you can sushi

Island Sushi is my favorite sushi joint around... The food is excellent the atmosphere is fantastic and the sushi bar is a great place for fantastic food and a cheerful atmosphere... My favorite place to go and get down on some all-you-can-eat
We had an avocado cucumber roll, mochiko chicken and spicy tuna poke bowl. Topped off with a 6 pack of filled malassadas. So ono. Plus a free drink:) check in and take a photo.
Service  is soo slow food was mediocre at best! I don't know why this place has 4 stars.

This place is a great secret.  For all of you who want to experience the best "buffet" in Vegas of sorts, come here.  It's an ayce sushi menu out of this world.  The selection is amazing and the fish is super fresh, and will never have a fishy smell to it.   One suggestion is to try out the poke..good stuff..when we are in Vegas we will stop by again!

Wow, my favorite AYCE sushi in Vegas! I've been a bunch: Sushi Mon, Hikari, Oyshi and Island Sushi THEE BEST.  I love the AYCE menu. Had all the specialty rolls, nigiri, and all kinds of appetizers. I was pretty excited to see they had ahi poke, tako poke, raw crab poke, ahi belly even garlic chicken and mochiko chicken!! The nigiri had a big piece of raw fish over a small little nugget of rice (How sushi SHOULD be!)  Their plate lunches are winnahz too! I've gotten their saba and laulau plate before. They also have these bentos that come with choice of garlic or mochiko chicken and comes with garlic ahi, spam, rice and fried noodles!! All for $8. That beats Zippy's zip & surf pac anyday!! They also have a small bakery that has coco puffs and malasadas.  Definitely one of da best local places to eat in the valley!

Love this place!  Poke is so good here.  Really impressed with how fresh the fish is and perfect with the Maui onions.  Teriyaki chicken is delicious, nice flavor and the offer brown rice (and Mac salad!).

My kids and I have dined here for years but after today's experience i don't know if we'll be going back. I ordered food via Postmates (mochico chicken, chicken Katsu and fried noodles) and the mochiko chicken was so burnt and hard. So very disappointed. With other local options nearby it's a shame that the food wasn't of the greatest quality
I love sushi! We ordered "Salmon lovers" and "ahi poke". Taste was good on both orders:) I will come back for sure. Thanks to the yelp!
Always here for the Sunday brunch. Every Sunday they have AYCE brunch which also includes the AYCE lunch menu. The staff is always really cool and of course the food is soooo good !

Yelpers had many good things to say about this place, so I decided to give it a try.  The restaurant decor is simple and clean. I appreciated the digital frames at tables near wall that flashed photos of food and patrons.  Servers were friendly but we were neglected as soon as it got busy and they forgot a few things we ordered. This maybe a problem for people since there is a 90min limit on AYCE sushi.     Now for the food:  Ahi Poke, 5 Star Fresh tasting with good color.   Garlic Chicken, 5 Star Juicy and flavorful.   Macaroni Salad, 1 Star It was too salty and eggy for my taste.  Fried Oysters, 2.5 Star On the burnt side losing the taste of the oyster. See my pic.  Sushi (Variety), 2.5 Star The taste and fresh color of the fish was not there, the presentation looked slapped together, rushed and mushy. Blah.  808 Special, 2.5 Star Nothing too special about a fried banana, vanilla ice cream, whip cream. It was just bland.  Malasada Sundae, 2.5 Star The malasada tasted old and hard. Vanilla ice cream and whip cream didn't do anything for it, either. Bland.  The drinks were on the bigger side which does not merit stars but definitely appreciated.    I don't have a reason to come back.

Delicious! The all-you-can-eat is reasonably priced and the rolls are excellent. I highly recommend starting off with a spicy tuna hand roll or two; the spicy tuna is like no other. Alaska roll is also recommended, and of course try to save some room for dessert! The 808 special - fried bananas, ice cream, strawberry slices, whipped cream, chocolate syrup - the perfect end to the best (and biggest) meal you'll have for a week.

worst service ever! first time i was here they made us wait 20mins for 6pk malasadas while staff are just chatting at the counter, not rushing to make our order. second time tonight, made us wait for 1/2lbs ahi poke and malasadas only to get our orders wrong for a bowl of ahi and rice after 30mins! so frustrating! u badly need to improve your fucked up service!
Their crunch is AMAZING! And thei dragon roll is even better. I love this place for my Dojo and I. You have to go and you wont regret it!

I saw all the good reviews and decided to try this place out. I went for happy hour and thank God I did! Because this place is NOT WORTH paying full price for sushi. The sushi is okay...I've had wayyy better at other places.. i ordered the mt Charleston, lava lover, and the spider roll. All of it was ehh. The sushi is small and the spider roll that i order had a really strong fishy taste to it which is not normal. So that really brought it down another star.  Service was not good at all. There were only two sushi chefs and not alot of people, it took forever for the sushi to come out. The waitresses didn't even come by once to fill our water or anything.   If you want better sushi and don't mind paying a little more go to sushimon! Taste is ALOTT FRESHER! &&& Better service! =))

Best place ever for ahi poke and sushi among other things! Like the all you can eat for $25! Garlic chicken and beef teriyaki are the best ever! We take our fam and friends from out of town there always! Definitely give it 2 thumbs up for the food, desserts and definitely the best customer service! One thing I suggest is calling and making reservations cuz they are busy!

In town for Memorial Day weekend and had to drop in to Island Sushi for the Sunday Pupu brunch. Everything I had was well prepared and tasted delicious. Started with Cali roll, rainbow roll, miso soup and then got serious with Teri beef, loco moco, ahi poke bowl and wrapped it up with two mini banana pancakes with chocolate chips and guava syrup, mini creme brûlée, malassada breakfast sandwich and banana tempura. This was a great AYCE experience! I really was impressed by every dish...banana pancakes and the rainbow roll were my favorites. Can't wait to come back!

I saw all these reviews and decided to give this place a try. I just ordered $80 worth of sushi from them and couldn't be more disappointed. The sushi was so bland! To top it off, I had asked for spicy mayo (enough for 5 rolls) because we hate soy sauce. They gave us a small side enough for one roll. Pretty much my $80 went down the drain and the sushi went in the trash.

Great sushi items. I didnt have to wait long and the price was reasonable.  I like the location and prefer sitting by the belly up bar area.  Great staff and friendly service.  Good parking when we arrived but it was packed when we were leaving.    Ive been to other sushi places and I prefer this one over the others. Thumbs up
Great sushi and nice environment. Takes me back to the islands
Wow the loco moco was so yummy and perfect on a cold day. Best local eatery for island food.
Barely an upgrade from store bought sushi, the restaurant seemed dirty in general. I would never go again or recommend

We've been here for both their poke bowls and AYCE sushi. Their poke bowls are pretty yummy and healthy. AYCE option is great too. Lots of variety with fresh seafood. And the best part of AYCE?? You get TWO desserts!  service is awesome with friendly staff and prompt service. definitely one of our go to places when we're craving sushi.

Customer service to be completely taught from scratch 5 minutes to say hi after standing in front of the hosts,even though we were the only one to be seated waited another 10 just to have someone else come in and seated I believe hosts friend, no explanation total lack of care,I guess they are feeling to cool for that...walked out...waste of time...

Came here with a big group and we had a blast enjoying everything they had to offer from the all you can eat menu. I'm not a big sushi person but everything I had tasted great. I love that they have a nice Hawaiian selection also. Will definitely be back.

This place is great!!! Their chilli garlic enamame is delicious!!! Their rolls are fantastic. The Town and country roll is huge!, so be ready to pig out!! First time customer, and can't wait to come back!!
Great customer service, excellent food, I've been to many sushi restaurants but this one is something special. You won't be disappointed
Just ate thier agian they slacked for a minute but are back on top. Try the salmon lover and candy cane roll. Tell them RN Sent you. Great food.
I love their food , but their attitude kinda suck !!!!!!!

Best bang for your buck sushi I have found yet in Vegas. Happy hour Monday through Wednesday all day long. Most rolls are around 6 bucks.  We love the crunch roll, the 007 and the rainbow roll.  Friends tell me there poke bowls are super good too!  Sitting area is pretty small so it's frequently a short wait to get in.

After leaving there tonight,i gotta  say i am pretty content with the food prepared for me tonight from the poke express . Especially  with the server who helped me. I was having an uneasy day until i walked in,up to the poke case and was immediately greeted  with a big  smile and 100% kindness.  She did an awesome  job with the preparation of the poke i ordered as well letting me leave with a smile/laugh allowing me to definitely want to come back. She's  also the reason  why i rated you guy's  5's. Thank you "Poke lady" for your politeness and all around (Aloha spirit.) Keep smiling girl.

My husband and I decided to try this place after a great recommendation from an acquaintance. Although the sushi was good, the service was horrible.  We didn't have to wait to be seated but the waitress never brought us our appetizer, nothing hard to remember (it was just 2 orders of miso soup) and was not very welcoming.  We felt like she didn't want to be there and do her job. Also, although there were not that many people the wait for our sushi (all raw, no cooking required) took a long time. The only thing that came to the table fast was the check and the only thing that left the table fast was the money.  Don't think we are coming here again.
Quite disappointed, my green beans had worms in them. Customer service was bad, still charge me full price for everything. Nobody even apologized. It was just a plain horrible experience.

I'm really sad I have to come back and udate my review.  We visited Island again last Friday and had a pretty bad experience.  The service was AWFUL.  We went as a group of 6.... all ordered AYCE.  We had to wait almost 40 minutes between our first order and our second.  That's really unacceptable.  As far as we could see, there were only 2 guys actually making the sushi.  On a Friday night at 6:30?  That's crazy.  And that would probably explain what the hold up was.  Our waitress wouldn't even come near us or make eye contact with us during that 40 minutes, while we were trying to get her attention to find out what was going on.  When we finally flagged down a DIFFERENT server to ask what the problem was, he acted like he couldn't care less.  "Yeah, we know we're having problems.  You have 90 minutes, don't worry."  Lame.  There were still some very yummy rolls, but worth waiting an hour and a half for?  Not at all.    It was very disappointing.

I'm giving them zero stars (strictly for the reservation) because they somehow "lost" our reservation...how in the world does that happen??!!?! We were there this past weekend and had made reservations over a month in advance for a party of 40. We found out the day of our dinner that we did not have reservations, they told us that they lost it and apparently gave the spot to someone else...very disappointing. Isn't it as simple as entering a reservation into your book or system?

i usually eat at sushi mon but decided to try island sushi instead.  when i arrived the staff was really helpful and friendly.  the food was prepared fresh with no fishy taste.  i highly recommend island sushi.
Really great service and selection of foods. Don't forget to get some malasadas to go.

This is as close to Hawaii as I'm gonna get.  I hate to say it but it's even betta than Cali (and I live in an area that's Hawaiian friendly).  The Ahi poke bowl is just the right mix of spices and shoyu.  They also have a wide variety of flavors line wasabi ahi, furikake ahi poke, spicy avocado poke, salmon poke and even kimchee raw crab!    I also had the salmon skin bowl and that did not disappoint.  The salmon skin was crispy and just the right amount of saltiness.  Most salmon skin I've had were rubbery and hard to chew.    Lastly the malasadas are right on point.  I love haupia and they can fill the malasadas with vanilla chocolate and haupia filling.  Almost as good as Leonard's.    So if you have a craving for island eats, this won't disappoint!

Eggplants fries are the bomb!  Yes, it is also part of the AYCE sushi menu.  Typically, we would go to Goyemon for the AYCE, but Island Sushi is our next go to place if we don't want to trek to Goyemon.  The fish selection are great here too.  They are fresh and delicious.  What I like to order here are not just the egglants fries, but the crab tako.  I can chow down three order of these because the sauce and the raw crab goes so well together.    For dessert, we only get one order per person, so I typically chose wisely.  I would get the malasada if it was fresh, and not just a lump of stale dough.  If I asked and it has been sitting since earlier that day, I would default to the brownie and scoop of ice cream.  Overall, I am a fan and will return.  They also have a AYCE brunch menu that includes item like King's Hawaiian bread french toast, and other interesting items.  Check it out if you have not done so!
Great sushi and sushi chef's. So far the best AYCE sushi in Henderson that I've found(out of three nearby). It doesn't have a fancy dinning area but for good sushi, who cares?

I'm from Hawaii... Tried many island style restaurants out here on the "9th island" and this is my fav!! Always fresh poke! Quick service.. Once they forgot to make my order that I called in.. And they snuck in free malasadas. Totally worth the extra 6 or 7 minutes it took them to rush the order!! :)

Good flavor but too much rice. $1.50 for a sliver of jalapeños when I took out cucumbers from my roll.  It be courteous for u guys to mention before charging for stuff.  Saucy lots of rice, no substance. Place divided next door for the express looks pretty cool though. Hey, good tunes though.
I had the teishoku A with a choice of fried Saba and the Surf and Turf sushi roll. Both were good.

This place is awesome! It's like a piece of Hawai'i here in Vegas.  The local food and ono sushi is what keeps me coming back.  The fish here is fresh and with all you can eat dinner for $24 which includes all the sushi, appetizers and desserts, everyone is happy!  The owner is a cool guy from Hawai'i and he makes it a point to walk around and talk with you, always making you feel welcome!  I 100% recommend this place!

I made a take out order of the oxtail soup & a combination order of 1/2 chicken katsu & 1/2chicken teriyaki. The oxtail soup is $11.50 & it was a rip off. There was only two pieces of meat which were like small to medium pieces of meat & they did not include the shoyu with the Ginger & cilantro condiments.  They also did not include my chicken katsu sauce. When I called I spoke to the manager named Angie & she was helpful but she said she had to talk to the kitchen manager.  The kitchen manager told her that I would have to bring the items back for her to look at it and determine if it was made up to standard or not. Are they seriously crazy that I would drive back just for them to look at the order!!! Is she really that insane to think that I would lie about something like that?!?  Unacceptable!!!  Obviously this kitchen manager was not in the business for a long time because this is unacceptable to treat your customers this way!!  They're just lucky that Angie, the manager has a good head on her shoulder and understood where I was coming from.

I always overdo it at this place and it's worth it every time.  If you love good Hawaii-style sushi and eats, this is the place to go. The specialty rolls are big enough to share, but you won't want to because they are THAT GOOD!!!  Come during happy hour and eat your weight in deliciousness.....

I've eaten here twice now... Wow! Good food at a great price. Not only all you can eat sushi but Asian/Hawaiian influenced appetizers and sides.   Favorites  Chicken katsu Baked muscles   I love sushi but not all sushi restaurants are created equal.... Island sushi is close to the top of my long list of sushi places that are in the affordable range.  Happy hour is good if you want a quick snack and don't want to be paying so much.   All you can eat prices (approx.) Lunch---$22 Dinner---$26

Always a delicious treat when we eat here. Came here with a few friends that were missing "local food" so what better place than Island Sushi & Grill. Very accommodating with the 10 friends we had, started with a couple appetizers for everybody: spicy tuna with pickled daikon, ahi poke, baked mussels, garlic chicken, Kim chii fried rice, yaki soba, spicy raw crab (yummy), hamachi Kama, sashimi salad and that's just appetizers.   On to the Nigri sushi all fresh and perfectly made: hamachi, yellowtail, Cajun albacore, ebi, amaebi, salmon skin hand roll.....whole lotta goodness in just two entrees. For the grand sushi rolls we ordered the maKaha, big island, kahuku and more than we can't seem to remember due to being comatose.   Oh let me mind you that they do offer an AYCD on sake!!!  What?!?!?!  Yes all you can drink sake!!!!  Great food and get drunk, how can you complain. Let's not forget the dessert: 808 special!!!  So yum yum and you can even take some cocoa puffs.   Hard to find great sushi spots and we've grown to love this place.  Will definitely keep going back especially with the start of their punch cards. Auryte!!!!!
Il give three star! Definitely coming back here... $21.95 buffet sushi and etc..staff friendly great food...

Had dinner here with family tonight.  Food was average. Service was slow.  Garlic albacore and garlic tuna were super salty.  Had trouble finding chicken in the Chinese chicken salad. Garlic chicken was super tasty, though.  We had trouble getting waters refilled. We requested it twice and were forgotten.  Granted it was busy but there was plenty of help.  I ordered malasada for dessert which was delicious.  I ordered a second.  It never came. Another server came by and asked if we wanted more dessert. I told him I was waiting for a malasada. He apologized about the wait and said he'd look into it.  Ten minutes later no malasada so we just left. Boo.

Boyfriend got Bento B (garlic chicken, ahi, spam, rice, and fried noodles). For spam, that was the most flavorful slice he's had. The garlic chicken wasn't overpowering with garlic, but still had great flavor.  I had regular saimin with a spicy tuna roll on the side. The saimin was normal; I liked that the noodles weren't overcooked. The spicy tuna roll was good, with a good chunk of tuna in each piece and the right amount of spice.  Lastly, we shared butter mochi. Which oddly is like biting into a stick of butter, except it's delicious.  The service was friendly and helpful, gleaming with aloha spirit! We want to try malasadas and creme puffs next time.

You bet your ass I gave this place five stars! Whoo hoo! "QOQ" will be the main focus of this review. You know, quality over quantity or vice versa? Well, this place can go either way. All-You-Can-Eat Sushi for $24.95 along with $2 Sake Bombs, ALLLLLL DAYYYYY, sounds like a win-win situation in my case!   A few warnings before we get down to the nitty gritty part of my review: -A 90 minute time limit to the AYCE goodness (NOOOOOO!) -A surcharge for wasting food -Only one order of Uni and Sweet Shrimp per person  So, the food:  - The Uni: My first time having it, but I'm sure they did it right because the sweetness of the Sea Urchin and the gooey goodness made me want more than just two rolls. Yummy! - Garlic Chicken: flavor overload in my mouth! Couldn't get enough of this. - Ahi Poki: FRESH FRESH FRESH TUNA! It almost felt as if the fish were swimming in my mouth. - Tempura Philly Roll: Fried. Cream Cheese. Fresh Salmon. I can't ask for a better combination.  All their sushi is extremely fresh and they do sushi right. Make sure you order accordingly because they will charge your ass for leftovers. For dessert, make sure you get the "808 Special", tempura-battered bananas and strawberries topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream with a dallop of whipped cream. *drools.   With a party of 14, the service was exceptional. Our waitress kept us happy with our Sake Bombs and kept up with our nonstop demands for food.  They, also, have a pretty decent "Happy Hour", which consists of $1.50 Small Beers and $3.00 Big Beers. So, order a Big Beer and a round of Sake and you've got yourself set for about 10 Sake Bombs! Yes!  So, we walked into this place starving and left this place with our bellies full. We didn't even wanna walk the Strip, we just wanted go back to our hotel rooms and pass out. I toast Island Sushi with their $2 Sake Bombs! Yay! Island Sushi, you have got me hooked for life!

My wife and I went there for dinner and had the AYCE sushi. The service was great. The waiters and waitresses were friendly. The sushi chefs were easy going. We sat at the counter on a night with not a lot of customers and the food came out promptly.   Now the bad news. The sushi quality was not good... but i guess you can't complain if it's ayce? The cooked food was good but it was very filling so I don't recommend it if you are on the AYCE plan.  Another problem was that they used the "ajitsuke" nori (the sweet and spicy flavored nori) for the Uni sushi. I don't know if this is "hawaiian style" or they were just plain lazy, but this is the only sushi restaurant that I have been to that uses ajitsuke nori for their "gunkan" sushi. And because of the flavor in the nori, it killed the flavor in the uni.   The presentation of the sushi was not like other sushi places too, in a bad way... Even I could probably cut the fish the way the chefs did. It didn't affect the taste, but come on!, they should've taken better sushi-making lessons before they started working behind the counter.  If you want to have AYCE sushi, I would recommend Makino, which is cheaper, or Sushi Mon, which tastes better.

Haven't been here since Poke express moved. The spicy ahi with avocado was awesome!! Fish was fresh and flavors right on. Kimchi mussels, limu tako and lomi salmon also very good. Chicken Katsu was good and crunchy, no complaints. However, the oxtail soup had only two pieces of meat, a few pieces of cabbage or bok Choy very small and the rest was broth which was very oily. Disappointing.  Excited to have laulau since it's been a long time but very dry with no taste. All in all would go back for the poke but cooked food needs improvement.

It's a really good deal for the sushi, appetizers, and dessert if you get the AYCE. The happy hour deal for 50% off sushi also seems pretty good too. Everything we ordered was tasty but the rolls had way too much sauce on them. I'm not sure what the name of the sauce is but it was the sweet sauce that's usually on unagi. I would have given this place 4 starsif they would just go easy on the sauce. A lot of the rolls seems very similar so I wish that they had more variety.

I have been going to this location ever since it opened, food and prices are great until yesterday!! My family and I went to island sushi for lunch as always the food was delicious but our server was horrible,  she had an attitude with us from the start no customer service what so ever... As we were done with our lunch she came back with our check which was on the same bill, we asked her before we even started if we could have separate checks which she said ok.. we asked her again for separate checks so she went to the back to separate them.. my sister in-law overheared our server and the manager talking in the back about our checks, the manager which then said in a very loud and rude way "well they should have sat on separate tables if they wanted separate checks"... With that being said the manager which was a Japanese female came out towards our table and said "before you start talking let me say what I have to say first"... really?!! My sister-inlaw told her finally that she just wanted to pay her bill and leave then the manager said all the way across the restaurant "yes you will pay your bill and never come back" this was in front on everyone that was in the restaurant!! The bill was separated into 4 checks there was 6 of us, gratuity was places on all checks which was 10.00 so our bad server would have gotten 40.00 from us.. yeah right!! I would suggest to upper management that they train this particular servers and so called manager how to do their job right!! Again I have been going here for years and love the food but this experience has turned me away for a very long time.... gonna try island flavor heared they have better food and great customer service. ....

Went to Island Sushi last night.  The grill part is still good, especially if you order ahead for a to-go order.  Poke Express has moved on to another sight and Island Sushi now operates that area fully.  I honestly can't tell you how good the poke is, as after waiting 35 minutes for our order (2 orders of 1/4lb poke), we left without the food.  The orders were not brought out in the order that it was taken.  4 or 5 people who had ordered after us received their orders well before we did and it's not like we had a huge order.  The woman in front of us had ordered some sort of crab dish and it was incorrect so they had to redo the order, because her dish was cheaper.  Why not just eat the cost and give her the order?  They were slow, unorganized and looked extremely lost.  I may continue to go there for the grill section but if you want great poke in a quick and efficient manner, I'd go to the original poke express as the service at the new poke section is ridiculously bad.

Love this Place.  It has to be our "Go To" Sushi place for a couple of years now.  I agree with Bethany's review - you need to sit at the bar, especially when Jason is working.  Whatever you order, believe me, it will be wonderful. Please note - WHEN you go, and IF Jason is working, make sure to make your "LAST ROLL" is a "Jason Surprise".  Believe me - it will be worth it and you will LOVE IT, but you have to request a "Jason Surprise".  ENJOY!!!!!!

Kinda confusing...which island cuisine are they trying to represent? Everything was mediocre...so either fine tune the sushi dishes or Hawaiian items! The male waiters were nice but we ran into one Asian female who was very rude  and unappreciative of our business. First and last time coming here and def not recommending to anyone!

The food was absolutely amazing but what takes it over the top is the outstanding service. We had a party of 10, but our server, who was one of the best I've ever had, gave us his complete attention and smilies. Our kids weren't the most quietest however the help from the other servers to assist and keep us off of the pressure was none short of awesome. I only wish they were bigger! The great aloha spirit was definitely felt here and I will definitely be back and recommend to everybody. Thanks Island Sushi!

This is the 3rd time I have dined at Island sushi and after my 2nd time I was impressed and excited to bring my mom with me to dinner to enjoy some sushi. Today I brought my mother and we each got a combination dinner. We were quickly forgotten about as soon as other tables ordered all you can eat, we had to remind our server that we hadn't gotten our soup when our dinner was brought out. My mom ordered the garlic chicken (DO NOT ORDER IT!) as her choice in the combination, and it was greasy and unappetizing, she didn't even eat it. The salad was dry with no dressing like it had each time I had been before. And the desert portioning tonight was laughable. I won't even get into the service...... Very disappointed. Wondering if there was a new cook or the boss was just out for the evening.
Wonderful food and great aloha atmosphere.  Second time at this sushi bar (counter) and experienced thoughtful service by the chef.  The owner's son also provided a warm and courteous service.

Found this place on Yelp while vacationing in Vegas (yay Vegas!) I'm really glad we drove out of our way for this one because it's worth the 30 mins drive and some!  Our faves include the spicy Mexican roll, big island roll, fried oysters and the garlic tuna.
Really bad service. Doesn't see like anyone was trained or knew what was going on. Food was decent. Need a manager badly.

I love this place! 'All you can eat 'sushi includes delicious appetizers like mochiko chicken, poke, shrimp tempura, lomi salmon, the list goes on. Nothing like the regular sushi spots. And the sunday brunch is even better with even more to choose from. Its about a 30 minute drive for me. But so worth it.

This was our first visit and my family absolutely loved it! We ordered from the ayce menu and it included appetizers (such as small portions of garlic and Mochiko chicken) as well as two desserts per person. Our favorite rolls were the island special, tiger roll, and black widow. For dessert, the tempura ice cream (ice cream covered in white cake and then  dipped in tempura and deep fried) was SO good! We'll definitely be back!

Island Sushi is one of my favorite go to restaurants. Both sides have a wide range of options and I mostly love the poke bar. Great prices for the best and freshest poke in my area. I've tried a large portion of the menu and never have been let down. Lunch and dinner time gets pretty busy, so sometimes there is a wait. The service is always good though.

We have been going to this place since they have been open. However tonight was the smallest portions worst service we have experienced from the side services. Very sad!!!!!. The sushi bar service was still great!!  DONT THINK WE WILL EVER GO BACK!!!!!
Good sushi, will return. Service alittle slow.  All you can eat menu could have been larger. We went in wanting all u can eat. Picked Island due to reviews on yelp.

A little piece of Hawai'i in Vegas.  I know, SHOCKING, right?!  LOL!  Came here to get a bento and some grindz before heading out to shoot some guns in Boulder City.    There is a poke / seafood counter in here as well.  If you plan to order both food and poke you can tell the counter person and they will send it over to the "food" section and you will get rung up once.  There were authentic local Hawai'i people behind the counters at this place (I could tell) so you know they know what they're doing.  There is a place to sit inside very casually or you can go to the restaurant next door and dine in there - looks like a resto/sports bar atmosphere.    I got the Bento B, which comes with Garlic Ahi, (1) Chicken Option, Noodles, Takuwan, Furikake Rice, and 1 piece Spam.  I chose the Mochiko Chicken as my chicken option.  Lots of food in this bento and very filling.  Great taste, which reminds me of home, so it's a winner in my book.  Haven't tried the sushi, so I can't comment on that.
YUMMMMMMY! My fave are the tiger, big island, and crunch roll. Happy hour is the best! I'm obsessed with this place.

Fresh fish and good service, what more can you ask for.  Revised on 02/7/08: Updated the rating from four stars to five.  This places continues to impress me.  The fish is always fresh and the lunch special is amazing.   I tried the two item combo and it was so much food, I had leftovers for dinner.  The mochiko chicken is sooooo goood!  I highly recommend trying it!

OMG when I was introduced to this place I was so excited to see that the had bentos!! Totally reminds me of the island life and how as a young child I would get bentos after school or before we went to the park!! This is an awesome place to go to and their poke is just as good as back at home!! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone!!

It's been awhile since I've been here... I Went last week, I remember it being better. Fish quality was so-so. Spicy Tuna was dry with no flavor. The environment has changed since the re-model. One this one trip, I went from LOVING this place to, Not going to go out of my way to eat here again.

It was our first time here so asked the girl what she recommends.  she said garlic chicken was their popular dish.  So we had the garlic chicken, kalbi and malasadas.  All were delicious!  Can't wait to come back!
I really wanted to like this. Service was excellent but sushi was mediocre. It was almost gross. Makes me sad!
Affordable all you can eat lunch! Hamachi Nigiri, Spider Roll, Crunch Roll, 007 Roll, Spicy Tuna and Chicken Katasu, Gyozas.  Makes me, my wife and friends smile!
Ordered a mini chicken Katsu to go and what a disappointment.  It was a mini of a mini plate.  not worth the exuberant price you charge your customers.  better places around town that gives more.

My boyfriend and I came here an hour before they closed and we were glad to hear it was happy hour.  Pluses - $2 Asahi Drafts for happy hour and sushi rolls were delicious.  Downer- service wasn't that great. It took us 10 mins to get our bill after asking our server and 15 more minutes for her to give us the bill. It was a little busy but tables she went to, she was returning for water refills, food orders, or checking up on them.

We always come here every time we go to Vegas and even stop here before leaving Vegas.  Husband and I grew up on Maui and miss eating local Hawaiian food.  We tried their AYCE sushi deal for lunch.  The sushi, poke, Kama, and dessert was ono-licious.  I even took home boxes of malassadas to share with friends.  They just have everything to make an island girl happy...and for just a little while I feel like I'm home in the islands.

Excellent customer service!!! Yassssssss came to get a custard and plain malassada. While ordering I was asked how my day is going and all that!! Ummmmmmm I'm great thank you, for asking!! Love it!! On to the next   Xoxo

AWESOME. AMAZING. BEST experience I've ever had. I recently went to Island Sushi after sifting through dozens of sugg's on Yelp. I was in town with family for a tradeshow and NONE of us were disappointed. In fact, we all agreed we'd Yelp about how amazing this place was. The server was awesome. My cousin asked if they had a roll with strawberries and they didnt, but about 10 minutes later the owner and sushi chef cam and asked what she was looking for. He custom made a roll for her.  We were all doing the all you can eat (I highly recc it), so to go out of his way to make a special roll even though we weren't paying more for us--was way too generous and was the icing on the cake.  If you are in town, live in town and want AMAZING, fresh quality sushi, check this place out.

Except your food on island time...  My sister ordered sushi (all u can eat), ended up getting her first roll halfway through our meal. My eggs were cold and her sushi was warm. I'm thinking they cater to some people and leave others in the cold.

Visited twice but I think that's that.   During my last visit, the service was dreadful.  They were very understaffed (so, not really the waitstaff's problem) which translated into an annoying ordeal just to get our order taken, water refilled, or our food.  C+  Unfortunately, the food did not make up for the service.  We ordered the salmon sashimi with orgasm sauce ($8).  The salmon was drenched in the mayonnaise-based dressing and, even then, under all that crap, I could tell it wasn't the freshest fish.  Pass.  We also ordered the Joe's Special and Maui Wowie rolls.  I enjoyed the Maui Wowie (shrimp tempura, eel, avocado) but the Joe's Special was pretty underwhelming.  Also, once again, I wasn't impressed with the quality of the fish.  Maybe I was there on a bad day?  The only redeeming quality of our meal was the malasada sundae.  I really enjoyed the fresh malasada (portugese donut), vanilla ice cream, and guava sauce. However, I would not endure another dining experience here just for this dessert.  Which, is a shame, because it's delicious.  Overall: If I ever returned, I'd go to the take-out window and skip the restaurant.

I feel that this place is going a bit downhill for me. The service can be hit or miss and some of the grill items are inconsistent. My mom loves visiting and getting a bento. The last two have not been as good as the two we got before. I keep going hoping that the next visit will be better, but the last three were no good for me. Will wait a little before trying again.

I love Poke Express here, and also the grill for takeout has excellent service.  But, we received such poor service in the restaurant, we won't be going there again.  We were seated quickly and our drink orders were taken immediately by a very friendly gentleman.  We gave our order to the waitress.  We didn't want AYCE, so maybe we weren't worth her time.  Half our order came within 5 minutes.  The other half came 45 mins later.  A couple was seated 15 minutes AFTER us, got their food, ate, paid their bill and left before we received the rest of our order.  It was mochiko chicken, and other than being a little overcooked, it was delicious.  We then waited another 20 min after completely finishing our meal for our waitress to come back and get our order for dessert (which was included in the price of the meal I ordered) There were only 4 other tables occupied at this point....and at least 2 other wait staff.  This was a very insulting experience.  I can understand mistakes when a waitress is very busy, but being obviously ignored when she only had one other table was just too much.  I skipped dessert and just got the check.  To his credit, the man who took our drink orders ran to get us malasadas to go, which is the only reason I'm giving 2 stars.  Our waitress was nowhere to be seen and didn't apologize for the poor service once.  We spent nearly 2 hours there, and she spoke to us a total of 4 times.  I'll stick to the grill and Poke Express after this.  Unless we decide on AYCE, since that seems to be the only way to get service in the restaurant.
My wife and I went for lunch on 10/6/09.  Poke is very good.  Wait until 4pm for dinner and you can order Uni, Ama Ebi, and Hamachi Kama!!

This is one of the better AYCE sushi places that we have visited.  Great service, and friendly and helpful sushi chefs.  I tried AYCE once here,but  I feel like I am being gluttonous so I prefer to order by the piece and get sashimi as well.  However my friend gets it all the AYCE every time and loves it. Good service, good food, good ambiance (they play Bob Marley!)

Island Sushi is our go-to place for AYCE. Everyone here is Island friendly, the service is great, and they keep bringing the sushi. It has a real locals feel, and we will be there at least once a week. The poke is good and we love the malasadas too.

A large group of friends went there on Tuesday (1/2 $ off rolls). This place offers a Hawaiian take on Sushi.  The wait staff seemed to be preoccupied.  The place was not packed but they had a a good amount of people. However, the orders came out slow. One person received their food and 10 minutes later another person received theirs.   Does the staff not know that we need small dishes for soy sauce? Do they need to be asked to bring some ginger and wasabi? Hello, it is a sushi place and we are all ordering sushi.  So, the sushi was ok. Its not great and not bad.  Because we had a large group, we were charged 18% gratuity. The charge was on the pre-discounted amount plus tax. So, we really paid 29%. This might be the new norm but I think it is wrong.  The service was sub-par at best. It was hard to get the wait persons attention. I know they have a hard job and I am sure they are nice people.
HORRIBLE service. Staff not very friendly and do not look happy at all. Do not go right after lunch. Maybe the dinner staff will be better. Great food though.

I should first admit that I did not try the AYCE sushi. That said, if you like Hawaiian comfort food, you have to come here. They have solid  Portuguese sausage, spam, malassadas, mac salad, and saimin. And, of course, Poke Express with +10 kinds of poke. Just imagine that the desert is the ocean and you're practically on Oahu.

The all you can eat lunch is a great deal and the food was bomb!  Some of my co-patrons in my party were not impressed when we first entered, but were believers once they tasted the food.  Got two men to admit they were wrong!  That's how good this place is!

Dined at Island Sushi this past Sunday.  I don't know any of the sushi chefs so I sat at the table.  Great team work in servicing, which included a helping hand from the boss.  Sushi rice was perfect and fish quality was nice.  Unlike a few other AYCE places that serve only mochi ice cream for dessert, this place has a handful of delightful sweets to choose from.   Look out for the Pocho, he's nice but can be abrasive.

My go-to for Hawaiian plate lunches! I'm from Hawaii and this place reminds me of zippy's back home. Our faves are the kalbi, chicken katsu and garlic chicken plates. We also love the fried noodle deluxe, CRISPY salmon skin sushi bowl and bentos. I haven't had a bad meal here! Oh and don't forget the malasadas, chantilly cake and their poke is ONO too!

Visiting in Las Vegas is always fun! One of the funnest things to do in Vegas, besides wasting your $ on the slots and in the shops, is EATING. Vegas has some amazing restaurants.  Island sushi is one of those amazing places. I went with a large group of friends and we tried several  rolls. All of them were amazing.   Every Monday and Thursday they have 50% your bill and that knocked our $300 bill to $150. We were pretty damn pleased.  I walked out feeling great, not stuffed. Everything was Fresh and just yum.  I'd describe this place as orgasm-in-mouth. Yum! I will be back.

Use to come here frequently because we loved the service and especially the sushi and AYCE. Will NEVER go back again because the management is awful!! Very disappointed in the way they have been treating customers lately. They can't handle volume and they put customers down when they get busy because there is not enough staff to accommodate the customers. Only 2 sushi chefs and it sometimes takes over an hour to get food on the table. Employees look overworked and the service shows it. Sorry but this place sucks!

Service sucks, old fish, rude workers. Ghetto sushi rolls. Fish is mushy. All you can eat is a joke. The old ratings were true. But staff there is not the best. Don't eat here save your money and time yuck no stars if I had a opportunity
Fast service, good sushi. Not the best in Vegas, but great AYCE sushi menu for only $25 & that includes appetizers, other entrees, & desserts as well. Nice, friendly staff.

My wife and I were visiting Las Vegas during Christmas Vacation and were looking for a Sushi place on Yelp.  Island Sushi is by far one of the best sushi bars we've ever been too. Not only do they have super sushi rolls, but the service is exceptional and friendly.  Chuy was our sushi chef and he really made sure to take care of my wife as she is with child and she can't have any fish that is not already cooked.  Chuy made what we call a Chuy Special it had Cream Cheese, Cooked Tempura Shrimp, Sesame, eel sauce and a bunch of other stuff that was so yummy & very tasty!!  Also our sever really went out of her way to hook us up with appetizers and gave us several recommendations of things to try and our water cups were full without asking the whole time.  What an exceptional value and service........next time you go don't forget to ask Chuy for the Chuy Special what a treat you will not be disappointed! Don't forget to pick-up some Hawaiian Custard Doughnuts on the way out...WOW!!

I tried other AYCE sushi places, and i'm not really a sushi snob, as long as its pretty fresh and they make it, in front of you and as  long as it tastes good -that good for me. I've been here a few times, what I like about Island Sushi is that you get your sushi fix (if you are hungry) as well as Local Hawaiian specialtys like Poke, Mochiko and Garlic chicken, malasada, miso yaki fish, etc. Food is tasty and you will eat plenty. Try there special sushi like Candy Cane, Mauna Loa, Surf and Turf etc. Food is comes pretty quick and servers are pretty cool.

Hands down one of the best AYCE sushi spots in town. It's been really packed lately but that's because of how great it is. I can never have enough of the island special roll. The best. Everything is great at this spot!
Poke is always Ono and fresh. Always a must go destination when in Vegas. Always great to come to a restaurant where aloha is not only served in food but atmosphere

Delicious! My favorites were the cajun albacore nigiri sushi & for dessert the malassada sundae! If you're hungry, the all you can eat specials are more than worth it! Not as full because mainly ordered lighter entrees, but you can definitely fill up if you order plenty! Lovely relaxed atmosphere & friendly staff! It would be nice to have more of a waiting area since we were all packed up front and standing during our wait on a busy evening, but definitely a place worth a trip.

One of my favorite sushi places, but new management is different, disappointed because there was a hair in my sushi and all she offered to do was give me a beer.  I don't drink beer, but a discount on the bill would make sense.  Business owner 101
Poor service and they charge 18% gratuity for a party of 5 not family friendly. You can get better quality sushi at other places.

They have everything here. They have a lot of desserts here like the Chocolate Dobash and Guava Chiffon cakes and more. They also have a Poke Express in there. They cook all of the local favorites and they're pretty quick in giving you your food. Tasty, tasty, tasty. They also have an all-you-can-eat sushi bar/restaurant.

i went here a while back and tried the mochiko chicken, spam musubi and garlic chicken. all are good items to order. however, i must admit, the spam musubi was a bit dry. i like my musubis with some kind of sauce on it - teriyaki or shoyu/sugar.   my bf and i went here today. he ordered the garlic chicken (mind that he's tried it before and absolutely LOVED it) and was utterly disappointed by the look and taste of it. it was not at all how he remembered it. not crispy and not very garlicy.   my conclusion:  they make good food, but not consistently. and like a good golf swing, consistency is key!   side note:  they have sushi, all-you-can-eat, bakery goods and most impressive, poke express!
food is always good here but the service is lacking. they are usually slow

I really like this place. Coming from a place where japanese hawaiian food is super common movin to vegas and not seeing many of these types of restaurants is hard. I cant normally come during the day when theyre open and i usually do take out.   I have tried the poke bar in the back and the gentlemen was super helpful. He let us sample a fee things before we decided, which made it even harder because everything was marinated so well. The seaweed salad was delicious and had just the right amount of seasoning.   When i order take out i usually get the take out bento box a with garlic chicken. Sessa i think her name is, simply awesome. Super friendly and has great customer service. This place really gives the aloha spirit.   I love the desserts that they have too. The butter mochi i had ordered last time was superb and tastes just like my aunties. Thats how you know its homemade and fresh.

Sat in sushi section , the fish was and various other meats were still fresh and tasted delicious , the sushi maker was very helpful and made great convo , I had the all I can eat , great value bring ur A game to the counter  the more the better , recommend the fried California roll .

I came here for AYCE sushi and this place has pretty good sushi, and this is the only place where I was able to find soft shell crab poke. Yes, it was yummy.   Another trip for the malasadas and coco puffs. Dang this place has the best malasadas in town so far. Perfectly sugared, fried to perfection on the outside with a slight crispyness and then you hit that warm and luscious dough on the inside which gives a light but chewy goodness. Next time I'm ordering a dozen for myself. Coco puffs were quite tasty too. Chocolate pudding was good, the puff was nice and light, and the macadamia nut frosting on top was the closest I've had to Liliha bakery's mac nut butter.

The sushi might be good here but the customer service is awful. They will let you stand for 15 minutes and pretend not to see you. You have to wait to be seated, so despite having open seats at the bar you're stuck looking like a fool. It isn't worth it. I'll gladly drive 30 minutes across town for a better place.

Was looking for an AYCE sushi place with a group of friends in the area and found this. Did not disappoint!    At first walking in and you see the counter for all their poke and other hawaiian food, and we were led to go to the sushi area for AYCE. Candy cane roll and Kilauea were the def favorites. A lot of various rolls that are unique to their spot and the service was good and the servers were very nice and attentive to us. We went in the middle of the week so it wasn't crazy busy. Would def go again.

Good food, friendly atmosphere. You get a choice of sushi on one side or hawaiian style bbq on the other. For the price, it's worth the AYCE here. There are TVs to catch the sports games and I've brought the whole family to dine here.

Food was amazing. Did the ayce for dinner today. Everything was tasty and fresh love the island flavors. The one thing I would complain about is the servers. They don't seem happy or helpful that your there. Opened the door and there's two rooms one for sushi and the other for Hawaiian food? We stood there waiting cause there was a wait to be seated sign didn't wait long but anything more then a min. Makes no sense you just feel like your being ignored its Monday at 530 maybe two tables were sat in the whole place. We finally sat got waters and waited for our delicious food to arrive. Must say everything we tried was the best very happy about that. Again just the overall friendliness with the staff and we had like three or four people help us? Wasn't sure who to ask for what but all helped us. Get the poke any roll and defiantly the creme' brula it's small but oh so good.

Went here on a recent trip to LV with the inlaws and my family.  One suggested Island Sushi.  "Sushi", I'm in!  Even though I already went on two other occassions earlier in the week, but it's all good.  For an AYCE, this is one of the better ones I've experienced.  Very extended menu for AYCE.  Included a wide array of appetizers, sushi, rolls, and desserts.  Only thing is that there are a few item which allowed 1 per person.  This was Uni, Amaebi, seared Ahi Toro, Hamachi Kama (large size, not small), Tako kim-chee, couple of rolls, and some other items. This place is where you ordefrfrom a menu , not a buffett line. Food is freshly made upon order.  Over all, it wasn't bad.  The uni was surprisingly fresh.  Amaebi...tolerable.  Other fish items, not bad...not the best quality, but again, this is AYCE.  It also included some dessert, 808 special...good. So was the malsadas and creme brulee.  Best to order one of each to share.  Of the 5 of us who ordered AYCE, we definitely got our moneys worth.  Better than the AYCE places here in LA (Joe's Sushi, todai).  Would I go back here if I return, yes if with a larger group who's not into paying $100 pp for omakase.  This place will do to get your fix for sushi...and then some.
Ordered poke. Quality of fish has went waaay down.  Lacked flavor. Not good. Not even close to what it used to be.

I gave it two stars due to the shitty plate lunches they serve. The first I had to send back which was a simple Mochiko chicken (burnt and flavorless) I changed my order to the BBQ mixed plate which was the special and that too wasn't good at all. The meat was so salty I almost choked! If I wasn't starving from a long hike and drove 30 min to try it, I would have sent it back. The manager never bothered to come out and say anything to me personally but instead just stood behind the counter giving me dirty looks. The reason this place gets two stars is because the Poke I ordered in the back was fairly good.  The cook should get dirty lickens or maybe the owner should for allowing them to serve the plate lunches as Hawaiian food. It may be good for Vegas but living in the islands for most of my life I wouldn't go here again.

THIS IS A REVIEW FOR THE GRILL SIDE, NOT THE SUSHI SIDE...  I've been to Island Sushi many times and think that it's the best AYCE sushi spot in vegas but I had never tried the grill side.  Tried it once and will never be back.  I got the bento with garlic ahi and mochiko chicken.  The ahi was over cooked beyond belief...dry as a cardboard and no garlic taste at all.  The mochiko chicken was soggy and tasted old.  The fried noodles that came with the bento was just that...fried noodles.  Not one green onion, onion, kamaboko, char siu...nothing.  The best thing in that bento was the spam.  The wife got the lau lau.  Horrible...dry and no taste at all.  It was like they didnt add any salt and the leaves were not moist at all either.  Came with lomi lomi salmon but no mac salad?! Blasphemy!   I'll be back to the sushi side but never again to the grill side.  Its sad cause I hear so many local peeps raving about this place.  If this is what theyre raving about, I need to open up my own plate lunch / bento spot and show these guys how its done! If this is the best plate lunch / bento place in vegas, thats sad....
Food is very good. I have only had delivery so I don't know how the restaurant is but the sushi is very yummy. My only complaint is that delivery is so much! It was about $15 for a delivery charge.

Came to get some poke. Whoever the poke server was shouldnt be in there. Rude as fuck, and I fucking mean it why would you slam the containers and the fridge and giving people that mad look. I didnt appreciate that at all. Food here is great but if you have people just like him/her (I couldnt tell) its not worth going back to.
I love this place and I love the happy hours. The service is great and friendly. The most I love is the desserts. I tried the deserts here when I was on my date and I love it.

My first time here with the family.  Oxtail soup, poke, garlic chicken, and malasadas filled with custard.  Try the various pokes.  All excellent.  Price was reasonable and food was fantastic.  Will definite be back whenever in town.

Oh Yeah, you guys, Oh yeah.  Went for the AYCE a few days ago. Freaking spactacular as always. This time I ventured out a little more, going with my usual nigiri (Oh that hamachi) and rolls (black widow everytime baby) and some new treats, including the strawberry and goat cheese salad, the grilled hamachi collar with ponzu and the teri beef and teri chicken.  Beautiful.  Sarie had a few rolls, loving every bite. She did the classic Sarie rolls (California, Spicy Tuna). What can I say, she knows what she likes... The service is always crazy good. This time we were laughing at our girl's description of the size of the mochi balls. God bless! ('I've had bigger balls' she tells me) Oh! And they have an AYCE punch card you guys! She brought one out for me at the end of my feast. Buy 10 AYCE, the 11th is a freebie.  I was grateful, but somewhat perturbed that I had been 3 times so far and never knew about the punchie. But hey, this is ISLAND SUSHI we're talking about. My beautiful server went back in time for me and gave me credit for those times too. Oh yeah, you guys, oh yeah.  By the way, The Bear and I will be working on punchhole #4 on Sunday night, so you better have that beautiful sushi man warmed up and ready to roll on my Black Widow baby!

Worst customer service I have ever experienced in my entire life. I never write reviews but after this experience, I thought it my duty to warn future patrons. Never will I ever come back...not even if the food was free.

This is my FAVORITE sushi place here in town! The rolls are amazing and they have awesome deals! They have happy hour where they serve half-price rolls for an hour before close. They also have an AYCE deal for $26 per person that not only includes sushi, but 2 desserts and I believe a drink as well. I always enjoy my experience here, the chefs are friendly and fast and the wait staff is awesome as well. Great presentation, great flavor, every time!

The concept of AYCE Sushi is new to me moving here to Vegas.  At first it sounds too good to be true, followed by a sneaking suspicition of poor quality and limited selection.  Not at Island Sushi! For $20.99 at lunch ($24.95 for dinner), you get a large selection of rolls, nigiri, appetizers, and even desserts.  I mostly avoided the apps (ordered a miso soup and edamame), and stuck with the nigiri.  The fish was fresh and tasty, and the quality was just as good for the most part of some of the fancier sushi joints I have tried around the country.  If you come hungry, you definitely get you money's worth without sacrificing quality.  The atmosphere leaves a bit to be desired, as its in a strip mall and seating area is just cheap tables and chairs.  If you want a fancy dining experience, this is not the place.  I was by myself for lunch and the sushi bar has a small flatscreen TV to watch while I stuffed myself.  They also do quite a few happy hour type specials on rolls and sake bombs throughout the week if you aren't in the AYCE mood.  For your non-raw fish eating friends, the other half of the restrauant has a pretty extensive cooked Hawaiian menu.  However, I don't forsee myself trying that anytime soon.  The sushi deal here is just too good!  Just remember to save some room for that 808 Special dessert!

We had a party of 30 last night and Terence and Stefani planned our dinner perfectly! The quality, presentation and preparation of the food was amazing - seriously the best rolls and bento dishes I've had in a long time! Book your party here - you won't be disappointed.

This is one of my favorite sushi places to eat at.  Can't beat the all-you-can-eat special for about $20 per person.  Great atmosphere as well as great servers.  Coming from Hawaii myself, you absolutely feel the aloha as soon as you walk in.  Great plate lunches & pastries too! My favs... the croc, dragon roll, ahi poke, & the 808 special (dessert). Sooo ONO!! A must to try out!!

Their chicken plate was really good very fresh. The cashier was my too friendly . When we asked for siracha sauce we were told they did not have any but we could buy some from poke express. Seems like we were bugging her when asking her anything. But the food was decent, Macaroni salad tasted more like potato salad then anything .

Wanted to eat some 'hwn' breakfast. Instead got Teri beef plate lunch.  The meat was very chewie, border of being tough. I also ask to get it well done. But didn't. For some reason this was not a very good visit. The cashier she had no 'aloha'. No greeting. I had to tell her good morning. Over all, diapointing visit.

Great sushi restaurant, service was excellent, staff was very friendly "chewy" and "Jose", and the food was very fresh. Drink never went empty, and the variety of food is great. Will be going back for sure!

My husband and I stopped by this place last Saturday around 11 am to pick up some food at Poke Express (which is inside Island Sushi & Grill). And since we were already here, we also decided to pick up Bento A (Teri beef and teri chicken ($8.25 prior to tax) for us to share to go. The teriyaki chicken was good and the amount of rice you get with this order was plenty. But the teriyaki beef was just okay. Honestly, we both agreed that we would have been happy ordering Bento C (choice of chicken, $5 prior to tax).   Anyways, the people taking our order were friendly. The wait for our food took a while though since it is cooked to order. There are limited tables in this little place.   Just also wanted to mention that there is a nice sit down restaurant area right next door that you can get their all you can eat special ($21.95 for lunch, $26.95 for dinner... both prices are prior to tax), which we may be interested in trying the next time we find our way here. I would also like to try their malassadas next time as well.   By the way, this place is located in a small plaza, located next to a Mediterranean/ Persian restaurant with plenty of parking.

ordered some nigiri.  it tasted funny.  I threw it up a few minutes later.  not a pleasant experience.  the fish is definitely not as fresh as other sushi places in vegas.    before I threw up I told my waitress that there was something wrong with the fish and she told me I was going to have to pay extra for uneaten food even though I was paying for all you can eat in the first place.  this only put pressure on me to keep eating the rancid fish.  I felt like I was dealing with a crazy person.   the menu is pretty lackluster too.  once you order all you can eat, about 1/3rd the menu becomes off limits (not included in all you can eat) .

This place is SO good! Make sure to try the malasadas, macaroni salad and spam and eggs! It's a little taste of Hawaii in Vegas! It's a little harder to get to now that they moved to Henderson, but it's worth the cab ride!

I moved from Southern California so of course I have high standards when it comes to Sushi! By far this is the BEST place I have been to in Las Vegas for Sushi! I left highly satisfied! They have very good customer service, they are on top of everything and very polite! I sat at the bar where you can watch them make the sushi rolls before your eyes! I tried Saki for the first time & I have to say it was AMAZING! Definitly coming back to this place often! Only thing I did not like is how small and crowded it feels in there! Overall though I don't mind it because their Sushi is certainly worth every second!
Highly recommend the bento boxes! The mochiko chicken is bomb!!! Spicy tuna bowl is delicious too!! And if you are a fan of natto you can get that here too!!!

This is my favorite sushi and Hawaiian food restaurant in Vegas! Everyone that works here is always so nice and the food is delicious and reasonably priced. Especially love the All You Can Eat Sushi & Sake option! Great for when friends come and visit us from out of town! My favorites on the grill side are the Garlic Chicken, Avo Ahi Bowl, & the Coconut Mochi. But you can't go wrong!

The food was amazing. We ordered 4 different kinds of poke, 3 different sushi rolls, kalbi, shrimp tempura. Even had malasada sundae, mochi ice cream, and tempura ice cream. I can't complain about anything. Everything was perfectly cooked, seasoned, and just ono. Straight up broke da mouth

There is an Island Girl somewhere deep inside me and I think I found it. Well, it has always been there with food so yes, it is there.   I stopped by after getting my lashes and brows done because personal maintenance makes me hungry apparently. I did not know what to expect when I walked in, maybe some Hawaiian food, sushi, Island food? Trust me, I am not that familiar with Island food although people think I am fully literate on this cuisine because I look Hawaiian or something like that. I do know what I like when it comes to certain Island cuisine and that is when the Island girl makes a guest appearance.  So on my visit, I decided to order the Spam Misubi which I never had until I moved to Vegas. I am not a connoisseur but I have eaten great ones and ones that I felt like saying "I will never eat this again!".  The Spam Misubi at Island Sushi was one of the great ones. It was warm and tightly wrapped and so yummy-yummy. I do love spam and rice, I am Fil-Am so I know it is in the DNA.  I also ordered the Specialty fried noodles with Spam and BAM, so spot on!! It tasted like the pansit my mother used to make once or twice a year for special occasions. It truly tasted like something from an Island Mother's kitchen or at least a Fil-Am mother who threw down Grilled Cheese sandwiches in front of me and Fil-food on some annual occasion.   Too bad this place isn't on my side of town as I have been looking for a Hawaiian/ Island like restaurant but that will not stop me from stopping in after getting my lashes glued on.   Mahalo!!

Overall, not bad - a B. It's Hawaiian-style sushi, so lots pf avocado in everything, and lots of fried foods. I wasn't expecting a lot for sushi in Nevada - anyone see an ocean nearby? But being used to good sushi in San Francisco, San Diego, and Seattle, it was a disappointment. Good if you just want some cheap-o sushi.

Shushi well done. Fresh with less rice. Most of sushi restaurants will prepare the rolls and te nigiri with a lot of rice and you get full wire barely eating any fish. At island sushi you will eat more fish than rice. Order all you can eat sushi for about $25 bucks. The special includes a lot of thier appetizers.

The restaurant has slow service...The waiter told us our table was ready...after almost a 2 hour wait.  Mind you we stayed because it was someones bday that really wanted to try it so i was hoping it would be worth it for her. Room temperature sushi. Nothing exciting nothing new nothing to wait for.  May i add they gave us a complimentary sushi dish... Would have been a pleasant apology if all of us werent having theyre ALL YOU CAN EAT...theyre poke selection outside the restaurant is good...idk if that counts

2.10.17: Sometimes going with a local Hawaiian to a Hawaiian restaurant really has perks. We came at a really odd hour so there were only one other party there. Once we walked in it was like hello, hello, welcome, welcome..There were so many workers there greeting us. I think that's normal though. They're a friendly bunch.  I wasn't too hungry so I didn't order anything but did try a few things from others. The poke bowl looks so good. The Tuna was on point and delicious and abundance. The plain ahi poke was also good but a bit too much soy sauce for me. Tasted salty.   The service was good and the food came fast. The main thing I liked was the malasadas. They did it right. It was fresh and hot and fluffy. We got the plain ones without filling and dang it was the best thing I ate all day. So good.   Side note: We came on our last day in Vegas and got some Malasadas to go. It was not the same at all. Was pretty disappointed. So when you do go get it ask for the fresh out of the fryer ones. =)

YESSSSSSS...... Came here for AYCE while visiting a friend from Henderson. It was amazing! The fish was so fresh and that was one of my concerns. Coming from Cali, I always worry about the freshness of fish when I'm less than an hour from the ocean :p So, we stuffed ourselves full. The rolls came out quick and were pretty creative. Best part, my son was 1/2 price because he was under 10 but he ate 20 pieces of salmon sushi :p
This place is amazing. My husband and I go at least once a week. The poke express, AYCE & breakfast is out of this world. We've been coming for years and have literally never had an issue!

First time eating there with my wife and son. Waited 15 minutes until we got called up. Once we stood up to get seated, the hostess apologized and stated that we had to wait just a bit longer because they accommodated a couple before us who wanted to occupy a 4-seat table so they can sit next to each other rather than face to face.  A total of 45 minutes passes by since we first arrive and I get the attention of a gentleman who seemed to be the manager. I asked how much longer and he states another 10 minutes. After nearly an hour of waiting, we finally get seated. The worst part, my son fell asleep during the wait time and did not get to eat while we were there. To top it off, the manager who was also our server, apparently left for the night but failed to notify another server to take over his duties of serving our table as we were left unattended for nearly 20 minutes. That was the last straw that caused us to ask for the check after only making two rounds of orders of All You Can Eat Sushi.

Went to eat last night with family. Got in right away great service. Mac is always very professional, very accommodating, and very down to earth. Which is great because it's not someone just bringing your food and leaving. He is one of the reasons I like to come to this sushi restaurant. He is a great ambassador and loves his job. He recommended we try the hamachi with lemon and ponzu. This was amazing! Our experience was great. Food was very fresh!

Friendly girls working the cash register and took our order.  My mother in law had visited this place since moving to LV.  She enjoyed the food and taken many other relatives there.    I ordered the kimchee saimin and regular saimin for my daughter and I. My daughter had the mini Teri beef. She LOVED IT!!   We normally go to Aloha Specialities @California Hotel in dwtwn, but they also have a location in Downtown.... We may have found a NEW place to eat!!

well we are always on the hunt for Ono local food. someone recommended us to try island sushi. it's a little drive from our house but hey, it's Friday lol.   was glad it wasn't busy there. my wife ordered the fried noodles with kalbi, my boys ate the mochiko chicken and I ordered the garlic chicken.   unfortunately we didn't have a chance to take a picture because it was so delicious lol!   prices aren't that bad, and portions are good.   saw the menu of the sushi and we are definitely going back to check out that side of the restaurant.

Wrong order was given so I called letting them order was wrong went back on a lunch break waited a while before I was helped only to be told they needed to refund me  before they could juSt correct my order. Had to head back to work grab my debit card then head back . Needless to say at that point I just wanted a refund no food. Waited again to just get a refund.  Which they declined even tho I had spoken to some one in regards to refund . Not only did I pay for something I didn't get but also declined refund . Definitely last time I go there
The service need some improvement be more friendly the sushi are alright I give a 3 star overal

I was born and raised in Hawaii and grew up eating poke-EVERYTHING. Then I moved to California and had been living for 4 years with out it.   Now I'm living in Vegas and stumbled upon island sushi for some sushi, great sushi btw also, BUT then I saw the menu and they had Poke! After 4 years I've been reunited and I must say taste just like home!!!!   LOVE LOVE LOVE the spicy combo with my brown rice, SO ONO!!!   Feelin back to my roots!

This is hands down the best Sushi restaurant in the Henderson/Vegas area.  We are soooo lucky to have moved into the area and discover this jewel. They have great service, awesomely talented sushi chefs and kitchen chefs, fresh seafood, and an innovative menu that is constantly evolving. They put a lot of thought and care into keeping their customers happy. We enjoy the "all you can eat" regularly because it is totally worth it.  The menu is huge so there is always something for everyone. We are also part of the rewards program that rocks!  Oh and the garlic tuna is the best :)

Been meaning to try this place for such a long time now & I can't believe I waited this long. I do live on the Westside though so it's a bit of a travel but it was worth it!   Boyfriend & I did AYCE around lunchtime. All the sushi were fresh, huge and delicious! I suggest getting the Chili Garlic Edemame as well! Service was terrific, loved the interior. Just a quaint little place with various Hawaiian decor.  Really appreciated the warm ALOOOOHA spirit, since my boyfriend & I are from Hawaii. Oh, and if you're looking for poke, look no further. Poke Express is next door!  You're welcome. :)

We actually came for Poke Express but they were closed and Island was still open.  I cannot comment on the service since we were on the self serve side but the cashier was friendly and gave us her recommendations.    Good: Avocado/Poke Bowl - your standard poke bowl which really hits the spot when you're hungry. Puahana Roll  Decent: Ox tail soup - the ox tail itself was good well and the meat just fell off the bones.  The soup itself though tasted like soy sauce and water.
Love this place have been there many times and never disappointed. The all you can eat a long with the bottomless Japanese beer is a great deal.

We found this place from some of our friends who took pictures of the food and posted it on their FB. We are happy they did! The Poke Express was def. different for me. Never ordered ahi poke to go like that.  We ordered a quarter lb of the poke furikake, hawaiian, and the spicy poke. Decent priced.   We also ordered to go... the teriyaki beef with noodle combo & the garlic chicken combo. I kinda felt like i should have asked, "can i have some beef with my noodles?" Don't get me wrong, the noodles were good, but I felt like there was just not enough beef.... or chicken.  The staff at the Poke Express area was very very nice. But the rest of the staff behind the grill and register are kinda rude and snoody. And from reading other reviews, it seems like these people have good days and bad days.
