Word of advice for those moody people.... please leave your bad attitude at home. Its a good thing that the food and the Poke Express person was nice, or i would give this place two stars.
Not going to buy poke there again. Poke has a lot of filler, onions. It's like onion poke. Go to Hawaiian style poke in Mountain Spring road in Chinatown.

HOLD UP, HOLD UP. I'm actually eating their food right now as I write this review. It's THAT good.   I ordered my food for delivery and I'm so stoked to be enjoying this from my house but I cannot wait to dine in!   I ordered the oxtail soup because I saw it being raved about in the comments and trust me, the comments are REAL about this dish!! Even though I had it delivered, when I got it it was still nice and hot. They even wrapped the containers in Saran Wrap to make sure nothing spills!! I opened my container and holy, it smelled delicious. I saw 2-3 big and fatty pieces of oxtail. The cilantro and ginger came separately which I appreciated because I don't eat cilantro aha. It comes with 2 scoops of rice which tastes delicious with the soup.   I also got a side of kalbi. It's around 5 individual bone pieces. A little bit pricey imo but the flavor is really good. I'm addicted to rice so I can eat one piece with one bowl lol.  The malasada w custard is freaking BOMB. I only got one since I've never tried. But the custard is like the ones they put in asian bread and it was soft and chewy and came in it's own box.   Honestly from presentation to taste, everything was perfect! Definitely coming back really soon!

Called for take out. Was on hold for 3 minutes  before calling back. Was told that order would be ready in 15-20. Drove there. Guess what. Not only was my order not done. I'm still waiting for order. Person at counter keeps telling me order will be up soon. Any way. 10 minutes and counting later....still waiting for takeout order. Thank goodness I'm not in a rush today. I hope the food is good.
Great authentic Hawaiian style food. Service brings this place down. Employees tend to be snippy, to downright rude. Orders frequently come out incorrect. Great food though.
Got an avocado poke bowl from here and it was fantastic!!! It just took a long time to get my food.

This review is based on purchasing poke in the back.  ***THIS PLACE IS NO LONGER POKE EXPRESS*** First off, shame on you guys for taking down the sign that Poke Express moved to a different location.  A lot of old customers does not know (including myself) that Poke Express is no longer there.  Walked in thinking it was still Poke Express.  Quality and Service was horrible.  I order some poke along with a side of rice.  My order was just sitting there while the lady behind the counter catered to new customers.  My order came out after my friends order (he ordered a poke bowl), which he had placed after me.  How hard is it to scoop some poke and rice then have a customer pay for the damn thing instead of just having it sit there? It took 20 minutes for me to get my order.  The lady (sorry), which looked and sound like a man had some major attitude.  No smile what so ever.  We're from LA and we always order a ton of poke to bring back home.  We ordered a ton of Poke to bring back home and felt robbed.    I found it "fishy" after tasting the quality of the poke and also the amount of time it took to get our order, that this was no longer Poke Express.  I had to yelp to find out they had moved.  Eventually went to the new location in which they had advise us Island Sushi took down their sign that they moved.  Basically taking over their business making it seem like it was still Poke Express without anyone knowing.  Shameful.  Please be aware and stay away!!!

12/27/2015  Can't wait to go to Hawaii for Hawaii's beauty and now, their sushi!   Simply our favorite sushi place in the coun-tray! We had the lunch for two all you can eat. I do really appreciate and respect all the rules laid out for the all you can eat. The owners want you to value and respect all food and not throw any of it away. So, if you are going to eat. You better eat it all and within an acceptable time. All the sushi we ordered was just delicious. Picture will speak a thousand words. I will soon load one up of this great experience.

I pretty much like everything they have to offer...we're always doing AYCE sushi there and start off with their appetizers. My favorites are usually the ahi poke, deep fried geso, garlic chicken and shrimp tempura. My usual rolls are the Island special and my husband tries a variety of rolls. We really like the spicy tuna hand roll too and salmon skin roll. I've eaten at the grill side of the restaurant before and we love it all. Bento boxes are great for when my kids don't want to eat anything else...always top off the night with the 808 special dessert too!

Disclaimer: I am from Hawaii and love "local" (read: non-traditional) sushi!  I have only been in Las Vegas for about three months now, but Island Sushi is my ABSOLUTE FAVORITE restaurant so far!    I always go for dinner and have never waited longer than ten minutes for two people to be seated without reservations!  However, with a bigger group, reservations are recommended.  I always opt for all-you-can-eat sushi, which is $26.95 for dinner.  It's worth it for me because after you eat a couple of rolls, you end up saving money.  However, I know not everyone has my appetite...  What's great about this restaurant is that the sushi is not overloaded with rice, HOWEVER, most orders come with about eight large pieces of sushi.  The value is there because there is a fair amount of filling and toppings, but you may be surprised with the size/amount that comes in one order!  This is the only downside.  I typically order: California Deep Fried Roll, Island Special Roll, Poke Roll, Spam Roll, and the Town & Country Roll.  Yes, all at one time.  Yes, I get my money's worth.  Yes, I gain ten pounds immediately and roll myself home.  All of them are fresh, delicious, and feature a wonderful array of flavors that complement each other perfectly (e.g. sweet, spicy, salty - yum).  Beware that they do charge $2 per piece that you do not finish.  The strategy I found to have worked best is to order everything you think you want to eat at once.  If you wait to think about it, there could be a delay in your order, and once that food begins to settle... defeat is inevitable.  If I order the aforementioned all at once (read: 40 large pieces of sushi), I am able to finish it once I get on a roll (pun intended).  Also, remember to follow-up on your rolls!  Once they didn't bring a roll that I forgot about until the end, and I was so overwhelmed.  As for dessert, I always have the 808 Special!   I just love tempura banana - something I have never had before!  My friend had the tempura ice cream, but we both agreed it wasn't as flavorful.  If you're looking for a Hawaii-feel, the ambiance is great! I believe they play KWXX radio (read: Hawaiian/local music), and everyone is extremely friendly.  I know there's a take-out portion of this restaurant as well with plate lunches, poke bowls, and the like, but I have not tried that yet.  YOU NEED TO GO HERE!

Not bad. Over ordered for lunch but have some snacks for later. Good flavor, but not as refined as some other local sushi places. Definite Island style. Especially liked Mickey's rice, a genuine Da Kine comfort food. AYCE prices for dinner are pretty competitive. Will try again. Service could be just a little more responsive. Not really too bad, but the wait staff could be a little more tuned in the customers' needs. Only thing that kept me from grading 4 stars. So 3.5 stars would be a more accurate rating.   There are two parts to Island Sushi. One side of the business is a sit down sushi and grill joint with well spaced tables and a sushi bar. The other side is primarily a take out "Poke Express" that serves up different varieties of poke and other goodies, think Island Style small plates. We only tried the lunch time a la carte sushi side. Definitely will try the Island Style take out on a different occasion. If we can find some taro chips to go with the poke, it will be like the Princeville grocery on the north coast of Kauai. Looking forward to checking out Poke Express.   One tip if you plan to go. Parking is not good. Island Sushi is in an Eastern Ave strip mall with inadequate parking. Quite a few of the spaces are marked "30 mins only" and "15 mins only". We just had to ignore that and parked in a 30 minute spot. Another parking anomaly is that the handicapped parking was at the back of the parking lot. Never saw that before. Regardless, solving the parking dilemma is worth the trip.

I've said it before and I'll say it again, Island Sushi is AMAZING!!! My husband and I go here on a regular basis and we have never received bad service or mediocre food.  With both Sushi and Hawaiian food we don't need to look elsewhere.  Give it a try and you won't be sorry.  The only thing I will recommend is that you make reservations even if you don't think you'll need them.  This place is always busy and if you even hope to try their amazing Sunday Brunch you need to reserve a spot.
Awesome sushi, the "all you can eat" is a pretty good deal!

Hubby and I been longing for malasadas since we visited Leonard's in Honolulu in 2015 and glad to find out that island sushi sells malasadas! We made it a point to check this place out while in Vegas. Called and placed the order in and picked 1/2 dozen up in 20 minutes. We couldn't wait and ate them right outside of the restaurant. They were hot and fluffy.  May not be as original as leonard's but they were very very good!!! Definitely will visit again when in Vegas again!!!!

The first time I called in to order, the girl working there suggested I try the Katsu Spam Musubi in addition to the regular spam musubi. She said it was really popular...so I did. It was yummy. The spam is fried like chicken katsu before it is rolled in the seaweed. It's more heavy than the regular spam...so I'm going to stick with the basics but I appreciated the suggestion! Prices seem low, which is an added bonus!   The people working here have always been friendly. I also noticed it's busy, so that's a good sign! One night I went in for sushi and there was a 45 minute wait. The sushi side of the restaurant is extremely small and it was packed! The other side of the restaurant (when you first walk in) is for non sushi items and it was busy as well. I think this is always a good sign, especially in this random little strip mall. The sushi was decent, not great. I will stick to the other menu items.  My favorites are the spam musubi, which is usually why I go here! Most times, I place a to go order for just this. I have also tried to kalbi ribs and teriyaki chicken, they are pretty good. I would def recommend calling ahead because even the line to place an order can be kind of ridiculous!
Need to offer daily!!! So excited to find a place that has oxtail soup! Complete w/ginger, green onions & rice. A hearty meal in itself. Definitely coming back!

Honestly wouldn't even rate this restaurant after tonight. My husband and I have been coming for years and usually sit at the sushi bar which has always been great. This time we sat at the tables and not 1 employee out of probably 6 didn't even acknowledge us. We stood there for a solid 8 mins with no word from any employee!   After we got seated, took another 10 mins for our waitress to come to the table. She finally came over took our orders for all you can eat. My husband only likes California rolls and is from Maryland and loves crab! The crab was so filled with mayo it was terrible! We ended up eating everything cause we were starved besides maybe 3 pieces of one of my rolls that had imitation crab in it. I picked around it.   Server came back and said she would charge us $2 each piece because everything needs to be consumed not just parts of it. Listen I get it, but when it's full of mayo and doesn't taste good (which I told the server) you should prob just take the $6 off the bill as a gesture and not try and argue with us. The female "manager" came back with our check (which had the $6 charge on it) and said there's nothing she can do because it's the owners who implement that rule. My husband and I both work in hospitality and thinks it's crazy that not only wouldn't she take off the charge she laugh at us! At that point I couldn't even talk I had to walk out and left my husband to just pay the check and leave.  It was definitely our fault for not saying something about the taste of the crab in the first place.. But everything that happened tonight I will never go back and I will make sure to tell my friends about what poor "laughing" customer service they provide. Well you got your $6 bucks! Hope it was worth it versus having repeat customers. I will be taking my business elsewhere. I advice...hire new staff.

My sister was craving sushi so my cousin from Hawaii brought us here. We entered through the Grill side and they asked us if we wanted to order from the grill or have sushi. We stood there debating for probably 5 minutes.  I wanted both! So we sat for sushi and ordered from both kitchens. They definitely have good Hawaiian comfort food and their sushi was fresh.  They're desserts are ono too! I had a guava cake.  The prices were fair and the menu extensive.The service was very friendly and quick.  All your favorite Hawaiian dishes and sushi. If you're in the Silverado Ranch/Eastern area this is a good spot to bring the family.
This is my go-to sushi joint in Vegas. All rolls are half price at 8pm on Sunday! You can taste and see the care and passion they put into their rolls here.

We eat here once a week for their Happy Hour & it never disappoints! I especially love that their HH is extended to the weekends! We have our "usual" & it's consistently good every time!   My boyfriend gets: - Salmon Sashimi w/ Orgasm Sauce - Salmon Lovers Roll - sometimes he'll order something different!   I ALWAYS get the Crunch Roll. I find myself craving it throughout the week. I'm not a sashimi fan, so I do stick with what I'm comfortable with.   As far as service goes, everyone is always friendly & smiling. They make you feel comfortable. Sandy will usually come to our table & say what's up; it's nice when the staff recognizes you!   I love this place. You have to try it! Oh, & the desserts...to die for. 808 Special & the Tempura Fried Ice Cream. Oh myyyy.

Delicious sushi in a modest setting. AYCE option is great for those who love nigiri and handrolls. They have happy hour for the rolls too (50% off) which is great for people who love roles. Service can be slow since they're always busy but the wait is worth it.

Dined in with a few friends. Food was normal sushi but since its more on the island side vs japanese side they didnt have the sauces I normally have with my sushi. Also, I ordered teryaki chicken to go for my fiance. It took about an 45 min- hour to receive it. Our original waitress never checked  back with me about it. Finally a waiter came by so I could ask him why my togo order was taking so long. Finally a 3rd waitress brought it, no apology. My fiance thought the chicken was good but not teryaki sauce with it. If service was better, id consider going back.

Stopped by before going to the airport to fly back home.  We ordered some Poke from Poke Express, who are located in the rear of Island Sushi.  Ordered a mini Kalua and Cabbage, spam musubi and some Malasadas for dessert.  I was a bit disappointed with the potato/mac salad, since it was a bit bland.  The kalua and cabbabe was good as was the spam musubi.  Filled the malasadas with custard and chocolate, which are always a great way to cap-off a meal.    Service was friendly and quick.  I'll have to try some other dishes upon my next trip to Vegas.
The food is good but there is a big problem for me when it comes to the poke....they do not use aloha shoyu in their poke...reeaally! And when you ask them to they have stink face.

ISG is one of several sushi and hawaiian eats options along Eastern, but as far as I know, it's the only one with a happy hour that includes half-off cut rolls. Came by recently to check it out and recognized the interior, vaguely recalling a previous takeout order. Menu is large, with AYCE and a la carte options that include the usual apps, nigiri, and rolls plus poke and various hawaiian specialties.   Food was fresh across the board- eggplant fries were freshly fried, fish in my rolls was fresh, and everything came out quickly. The rolls themselves, though ordered from the specialty section, were not as impressive as elsewhere (presentation, size) but it was a decent meal. What did impress me was that the service was among the best I've received at an AYCE spot, with nearly every server in the dining room checking on me at least once even though I was sitting at the bar, where I am used to being forgotten elsewhere.

The food really good here, the service is great and they're from Hawaii.  Nothing I like more is to support Hawaii residents spreading the Aloha and our culture.  The mochiko chicken, garlic chicken, shrimp tempura  and sushi is all good!  The green tea ice cream and the 808 Special is good for dessert.  I think after 7 or 8 it's 50% off sushi.

Ate here with a group of people back in October & we all ordered the All You Can Eat Menu. Service was good. Food was great. The restaurant always seems busy & that brought out an awkward moment as this big brute guy started yelling at another customer that apparently had jumped in front of him in the waiting line. The management didn't seem to try to do anything to stop the yelling as the big brute yelled at multiple customers for over 5 minutes. It caused a serious uncomfortable setting for everyone in the venue.

Regret #1-forgot to take pictures of the beautifully red ahi poke bowl accompanied with sesame seasoned cucumber and topped with taro chips! Deliciousness! Children enjoyed the oversized loco moco and won ton min. Such a wonderful treat for Hawaii locals in Vegas.  Even ran into some friends from Hawaii!

When not partying on the strip I enjoy eating around town. I found Island Sushi through yelp and decided to make a late night stop for some ahi poke salad.   FOOD:  The quality and freshness of the to-go AHI POKE SALAD was very good, but I prefer poke with no suji or at least less pieces than I got in my serving. There's just something about ruining quality poke with pieces of suji to chew on. It was late so maybe that's all they had left to serve.   The next time I return to Island Sushi I will definitely give the ahi poke another try, definitely do the AYCE option, and order the highly spoken of garlic chicken. I would of never guessed that was a highlighted item there!   A-OK for now but for sure an update to four stars....soon!

Superb Sushi!  It's pretty ridiculous how much I enjoyed their sushi.  We decided to try them for lunch since it was recommended by friends. The right side of the restaurant opens at 11:30.  We chose to sit at the sushi counter in front of chef Jason.  He was friendly and quick in preparation.  We had a great lunch thanks to him!   Since they have AYCE, it worked best for us to try several different creations.  Jason suggested the Hamachi which is yellowtail.  In the first bite there was a unique flavor.  We asked him what it was.  They combine orange and lemon into the yellowtail for this distinct flavor.  We immediately loved it.    The 007 was our second choice.  Crab and cucumber topped with shrimp, avocado and eel sauce certainly made this a winner.    The Island Special with soft shell crab topped with spicy tuna, spicy aioli and eel sauce did not disappoint.  Incredible flavors from each roll this far!   The cherry on top was our final order of the Baked Salmon.  This is a California roll topped with cream cheese, salmon and dynamite.  It just melted in your mouth.    I cannot wait to come back and try some of their other choices.  I have a feeling I'm going to enjoy every bite.

5 star for the best ahi poki!! Loved the spicy masago and the lumi seaweed ahi poki! Tasted so fresh and not slimy or fishy at all! The loco moco was a tad bland and green tea mocbi was meh. The bento box was awesome - sprinkled rice, fried noodle, chicken teriyaki, oxtail spring roll, yellow cucumber, shrimp and vegetable tempura and a slice of spam and mac salad! They do have sushi bar next room and all you can eat sushi.

Love both sides, the grill and the sit down restaurant. The food is great along with the service. I love having a place close to home that reminds me of growing up in Hawai'i where I can pick up a plate lunch.   My mom raves about the Teri beef because it reminds her of my late grandpa's secret recipe. Anytime we have out of town guests, we always bring them here.

First time visit, AYCE for two.  Server was very friendly & food was pretty good.  Atmosphere was ok, but not date-worthy (down home, mom and pop vibe).  All around excellent value, with excellent service.  Will be back!

Seriously the most delicious rolls I have ever had. The fish is fresh, the people are really sweet. I love the atmosphere. Its like fusion Sushi/Hawaiian food. Everytime I visit Vegas this is one of my top places to stop and eat at.   The food is super affordable because they have happy hour, like every day. I believe Tuesday is Happy Hour all day, so half off their rolls.   My favorites are the Island Special Roll and Spicy Mexican. Their garlic edemame is super delicious. Also they have these amazing noodles when you order from the Hawaiian part of the menu, they are so yummy.   If you are in the area, stop in and enjoy!

3 star service but I actually like this place!  I've eaten next door multiple times for the Hawaiian food and came with friends to get poke but never got around trying the AYCE here..  Looks run down and outdated which had me iffy about the place before .. But it was the closes sushi joint from the gym so I gave them a chance.  We ordered.. Puhi Maki Roll (daily special) - spicy soft shell crab, assorted fish on top with garlic ponzu sauce (Very Tasty!) Salmon Skin Handrolls - crispy salmon skin, just enough sauce and not too much rice wrapped in seaweed (DELICIOUS!) Raw Crab Poke - fiancé got this, looked appetizing and plentiful but I wasn't daring enough to try it.. Eggplant Fries - crispy, sliced, battered eggplant came with Spicy Miso Sauce, which I think didn't really compliment it, but I'm one who doesn't really care for dipping sauces. Baked Salmon Roll - it was good but nothing special about it, loved that it didn't have so much rice nor cheese on top!  Tofu Poke - so simple, yet sooo good! Fried tofu in their poke sauce with onions! (SOOO GOOD! Lol) Malasada Sundae - the malasada (aka Hawaiian donut) tasted like cardboard, was dry and seemed like it's been sitting there for days.. Strawberries were sweet and the vanilla ice cream.. Was just ice cream.. Not a fan.  Sushi chefs were attentive but the waiters/waitresses were not.. Service was slow from the waiters, i.e. took almost an hour to get my eggplant fries.. Bit of a turn off..  Overall satisfied with my meal and will def come back for the salmon skin handroll and tofu poke!

I haven't left the restaurant yet but I'm so compelled to write this review.  This place is the BOMB!! Food is fresh and delicious and the service is even better. Our server Mac was super efficient, timely, and attentive. I am SO GLAD we came here. We will definitely be back. Everyone needs to give this place a try if you're in the area. Mahalo!!!!

This review is for the sushi portion of dinner. The restaurant is located on Eastern past Serene, but before Richmar. If you get up to BJs, you've gone too far. Inside of the restaurant is sectioned off in to two areas. Entrance area seems to be designated for traditional Hawaiian grilled dishes, and the area thru the door on the right is the sit down sushi area. We came here on a Friday night and it was packed. They do have a wide selection of AYCE sushi and many sides to choose from (although the sides appear to be half of what you'd get if you were ordering a la carte).  The AYCE menu has two symbols that denote different things. Chopsticks next to the item indicate it is a dinner only item, while the sushi icon indicates it is one order per person.  The rolls were fine and fish relatively fresh. One thing to note is their speciality rolls were in fact not drenched in Yum sauce or mayo concoctions of any sort. A lot of what we ordered had their garlic sauce on the roll itself, and I wasn't a fan. It tasted like gin ...I know strange.    We sample several rolls: Joe's Special, Black Widow, Spicy Mexican, Lava Lover, Lasagna, Surf and Turf. I also had their scallop mayo and salmon nigiri. The salmon was fresh, the scallop mayo was very bland and forgettable. My favorite roll of the group was Spicy Mexican, the rest were decent, but nothing I would rush to eat again.  The service was fine, minus the initial hiccup. It took a little over 20 minutes to get our first three rolls to the table. I know that it wasn't our servers fault, and it was pretty packed in there. They didn't bring it out roll by roll so we had food coming throughout, instead they waited for all rolls to be made before they brought them out. I guess it makes more sense that way, especially with being so packed.  So although, famished by the time we got the food, I won't hold it against them.  I would recommend this place is you want more simple, non yum sauce heavy rolls with fresh fish and friendly service.

Pretty decent to get your AYCE sushi fix. My fiance and I ate by the sushi bar and based off the random rolls and nigiri pieces we picked out, I thought this place was "ok" as I judge my sushi by quality over quantity. (Though, I will say, it is expected that quality does go slightly down in an AYCE sushi place compared on one that isn't AYCE so my opinion might not be too fair.)  Finishing off my meal with the 808 dessert was quite a treat. The service didn't stand out to me and the inside of the restaurant doesn't appear to be anything special either.   On one last note, I do order breakfast with Island Sushi more frequently than I do sushi and love their menu. I usually order a two egg plate and malasadas. Their malasadas are made to order. I thought their malasadas are "ok" as well; it tastes too dense for me and the custard filled one kinda tastes like instant jello pudding mix.

The best place in Las Vegas for great Hawaiian food. You can either grab something to go in the take out section which offers amazing traditional Hawaiian dishes or you can dine in at the restaurant side. My suggestion is to sit at the sushi bar and do the all you can eat for $26. You honestly can't beat the price for what items you can get. I recommend the ahi poke, joe's special roll and some Teri beef! Make sure not to skip out on dessert. Get the 808 special with tempura bananas! Staff is also amazing. I've never had anything short of a perfect visit and I hope it remains that way.

If you're going to go to an all-you-can-eat Japanese place, then this is definitely it. This restaurant is not buffet style but continuously ordering food from the menu style. The sushi here is really fresh, the food is great, and the service is awesome too. When I came here, the waiter even gave me a discount too because the sushi was taking a bit longer than usual to come out from the kitchen since the place was packed and the kitchen was a bit backed up. They even have my favorite chuka seaweed salad here too which you can order as much as you want.  Keep in mind there is a time limit on how long you can eat. I think it was 1.5 hours but I'm not sure if they will enforce it or not. Also, you can only have 1 order per person for the sweet shrimp and uni sushi.  Excellent food, excellent service, and not overpriced. Make sure to check this place out.

I have been coming here for years thinking the back of the restaurant is "Poke Express." Today I went here thinking I would get fresh poke just like the north location and just like every other time I came here. Unfortunately there was a big change and I didn't realize Poke Express was no longer there. It looks exactly like Poke Express same setup and all,  but according to Yelp they moved? I got a poke bowl. The employee helping me was already wearing a glove when he came up to me to ask what I would like to order. I noticed him sweating, which always grosses me out because that means sweat has to be wiped and it is usually with a hand or arm. Gross. I ordered by bowl and he used the hand with the glove to make the poke bowl packing in the lettuce multiple times with that gloved hand. Later he took my cash with that same hand with the glove. I sat down and saw he still had on the glove and began to wipe down the area where food was being served. Then he proceeded to take a woman's order after me using that same glove that touched money, a dirty rag, and who knows what else! So disgusting! I am highly disappointed because Poke Express was my go to poke spot when I wanted poke that reminded me of Hawaii. It appears this poke spot is in the same location but the owner is the same for the whole store. I asked someone at the front and they confirmed it is not a different business. I called and spoke to a manager after and he said he would talk to the guy and that he is new but honestly there is no excuse. People can get really sick and I won't be coming back here.

Went to eat here with my family which is a big group.  We decided to get separate checks to keep it easier for both the staff and us.   The food came out relatively quickly but we had no way of remembering who ordered what (as is common with big sushi orders).  My end of the table continually received tons of sushi to the point where we asked if it was a mistake.  The server kept saying that this was what we ordered even after suggesting several times that perhaps it was for the other end of our large party who hadn't received most of the sushi they had ordered.  Since there is a time limit and a per piece charge for uneaten sushi we cancelled the remaining order for our end of the table.   Meanwhile, the other end of the table had only received one of the rolls out of the 5-6 they had ordered.  When it was brought to the servers attention, she said that it was coming.....but still didn't put it together that our end of the table had gotten way more than we ordered.   So, long story short, the owner came out and pretty much said "too bad" and that they could order more since it was all you can eat...  We were already past the 90 minute limit and most of the party was done eating.  Reality is that they were just unaccommodating.  The sushi was fine and the price was right...but I felt bad that some of our party left hungry and they still paid the same amount as the rest of us who were full of sushi.

I knew about Island Sushi and Grill because I order from their Poke Express every time I am in Vegas.  In addition to the poke I would order, I would sometimes order from the grill:   - Katsu musubi:  the spam is breaded with the same breading they use for chicken katsu.  Adds a yummy crunch to the block of delicious goodness that is spam, rice and sauce.   -  Goteburg musubi - The portuguese sausage also with rice. Yum! -  Malasadas - like a creme filled donut.    Ive recently also had them cater my sister's bachelorette party which was held at the Vdara.  Their catering menu is available online.  I ordered a small tray (feeds about 10-15 people) each of the:    -  kalbi ($70):  good quality beef perfectly grilled. No sogginess or rubberiness. -  chicken katsu ($36):  Still even crunchy after it was delivered.  -  garlic chicken ($36) :  So simple yet so flavorful -  mac salad ($24) and rice ($17): must haves when ordering Hawaiian food.  I also ordered 6 pounds of the amazing poke.  My order was delivered to the hotel at the time I had requested and without any issues.  I received a call when they were on their way and when the food arrived at the hotel.  The poke was delivered on ice.  Everything was delicious - as expected - and a big hit with the ladies.  I was a bit nervous that it would be too much food for 14 girls, but the small trays turned out to be the perfect amount.  We had enough for dinner, for a late night meal after hitting the club, and even for breakfast!    Needless to say, I highly recommend Island Sushi for a nice meal and/or for catered events.

First time there. Have been working our way through this part of Henderson looking for the 'right' sushi place. As it is now, that place is I Love Sushi, and after tonight, still remains. Island is a hard to describe place. Seems to be two or three joints in one. But, we were there for sushi. The atmosphere/decor is pretty basic. We saw tonight , which I now see is true of a couple of nights, all cut rolls were half price. So, we ordered away. All in all, did not find it that compelling. Mostly everything seemed pretty bland. Even spicy tuna, which should be good for a little pizazz, was tasteless. For us, it was OK, but no better, and not in the cards for a second visit.

This place is amazing! I went with a friend to AYCE and we both loved it! We live in Anthem and we usually go to I love Sushi (which is expensive and not AYCE) Or Yama but it will change now, since this place is so close. All the sushi we got was fresh and you can taste and feel the freshness. The vibe was really nice, with smooth reggae playing around. The staff was really nice. Our waitress was so nice we talked and asked questions and she was great all around. After stuffing our faces with sushi we got the 808 special. And usually when you get all you can eat they give you a piece of mochi cut in half or a sad excuse of a scoop of ice cream but the 808 special was a satisfying scoop of ice cream, tempura bananas, fresh strawberries, heap of whipped cream, and chocolate drizzle and it was perfection. The perfect end to a perfect dinner. with my drink my total was $28 which is completely reasonable. PS, when you buy 2 AYCE you get free sake. I don't know if it was everyday but it was nice.

I would give this place a 5  but because we got bad service from our waiter I have to go with 4  We walked in and the place is split into two parts, dinning in and dine out. We stood for 10 mins looking confused because no one talked to us. I walk into the dine in part and stood in the middle and was finally  noticed to be seated.  I asked a lot of questions and the waiter did help explan but that was it. He didnt tell us specials which the other waitress did. We never saw him again. He never once came to ask if everything was OK and if he did come over, I had to wave him down. All the other waitress were nice and kind to check on us but I was disappointed our own waiter did not care. He checked  all other tables but never came to ours.  I will come back for the food because it was amazing but if we get him again, I will request for someone else. It's a small thing but he ruined my mood and that is something a waiter should never do if they want customers to come back.

Love this place!   Poke from Poke Express tasted really fresh and lots of variety to choose from.   I also ordered the Loco Moco and it was HUGE. Such large portions and great price as well!  The only disappointment was the spam musubi. We ordered the regular and that spam katsu musubi, and felt that there was lacking flavor. It was overpacked with rice, the slice of spam was tiny, and there wasn't any sauce on the inside. We ended up dipping our musubi with our loco moco gravy just to get some more flavor. There was so much rice in one of my musubi's that the seaweed didn't even wrap all the way around :(

I wasn't happy with my experience. I ordered Portuguese sausage loco moco- waited about 15 minutes just to get spam loco moco. Ordered garlic shrimp plate and there was no taste to it. The macaroni salad was so bland- also no taste. I left still hungry :( I won't be eating here again, but I will come back for the poke though every once in a while cuz it's $16 per pound- wwooww, but it's onolicious. I would give it a 1 star but the poke is delicious so 2 stars it is.

Sushi is ok. i prefer not to go to AYCE places, because the fish is not the freshest. Also, sometimes the service sucks really bad, if you are not sitting at the bar. Prices are about average for AYCE joint.   If you want better sushi then go to Momo Sushi.
Simply very good fresh sushi, the 50% off helps a lot as it makes a great price point ! Very fresh and amazing MISO soup.
All I can say is that if you miss Hawaii, just come here. Plate lunches, poke, AYCE sushi and tons of locals. Always busy, always fresh. Like I never left home...
Horrible !!!! This time my roll of sushi was half the size of the last time I ordered. Just because they were busy doesn't mean you had to cut the size of the roll. I felt like I got ripped off!!

I think this is my favorite sushi place in the Las Vegas area. Had done different items like the spam n eggs roll, holy crap it was good! The beef sliders was great, hell it was all good. I will definitely be back...T

This review is based on their Grill Section of the restaurant.  Been coming here and having lunch with the girls often since it's closer to their work.Their prices are pretty reasonable.  This last trip there, I had their bento box combo with Teri beef and mochiko chicken. Both the teri beef and mochiko chicken was a tad on a sweeter side. I did enjoyed it and my son enjoyed the noodles that come with it.  I had their saimin (previous trip) and it's not the greatest saimin I've had...  Overall, the food, I give it a 3 1/2 stars. Service is more of a 4 stars.

I had a very bad experience at this location. I go to this place only when I'm near the area. So this time I had a 9 stamps on my card and it was my wife and I, we were suppose to get a free all you can eat. But all of the sudden they no longer honor the stamp card I had. The waitress was nice about it when she saw mi reaction, she offer to call me back the next day after she talked to the owner. But guess what? there was never a call back. There is no expiration on that card or anything that said that is only good for Certain time.

I'm not the type to leave a Yelp review typically, but I was so dissatisfied with their service that I felt the need to voice my opinion. I walked in at 9:30 (30 minutes before they are supposed to stop seating people). The hostess told me that all you can eat has ended already but told me I can still order sushi rolls for half price. We ended up sitting down anyways and I order 2 rolls... But then I try to order more and they refused to serve me. They said that they already put the food away and they are done making food for the night, yet there was still 20 minutes left to order food. They didn't even warn me that they were closing the sushi bar or offer to make me anything else before closing down. The sushi wasn't bad but I was extremely disappointed with the customer service. They lied to us and were too lazy to even serve me when they were supposed to be open. Worst service I have ever had. Next time I'm hungry for sushi I'll make sure Island Sushi is my last resort.

I've been going here for years and they keep me coming back every time. The owner is around often and I've seen him build the business. The food is amazing. The price is perfect. The chefs are great at creating dishes for those who are picky and recently they've added a weekly specials menu to their all you can eat. If you're looking for a great environment it's the place for you. Make sure you stop by between 1130 and 3 on Sundays and do their brunch. You're missing out if you don't.

This place is just amazing. It was a Friday night and really busy but we were still seated almost immediately and proceeded to get astounding service throughout the entire meal. The sushi itself is delectable. The chef is phenomenal and incredibly personable. Everything was great here. I highly recommend for lunch or dinner any day.

First off, I love Island Sushi. The women in my office order nearly every Saturday from the Eastern location. The food is always fresh & delicious. BUT, it seems like every time we order there is some new rule about items included with your meal. 1st order of Teishoku Combo B, no dessert was provided or even mentioned. 2nd order of Teishoku Combo B, any dessert was an option. 3rd order of Teishoku Combo B, was told we did not have a choice of the type of dessert & was provided Plain Malasadas. There just does not seem to be much consistency. Most of the staff members are wonderful to deal with but others seem to believe they're doing you a favor by taking your order. If the food was not so great, I would definitely be going somewhere else.

I was really excited to try the poke here because I had heard such great things about the place. Unfortunately, today the service was REEEEAAAALLLY slow... Even though I called ahead to order pick up 20 minutes before. My food was still not ready after an additional 10 minutes of waiting. Poke was not that great, but it could have been that the steam from the rice started to cook it as I was driving to my destination.

I would like to give a big thank you to Terry the owner & his team for making my son's birthday a wonderful celebration at your restaurant. The food was delicious and prompt, and the drinks just kept flowing. Everyone had a great time and loved the food and service.   This place is awesome and recommend to all who are looking to eating some Ono sushi and great service!!!   Kudos to the Island Sushi Grill Team!!!

Maybe our mistake was going on a Saturday night, or having the high expectation of cleanliness when consuming raw fish. We were here for five minutes. The hostess offered to seat us at the sushi bar because that was the only seating available. We said sure. Upon seating down my sense went into overdrive.   First: My chair was rocking back and forth and felt like it could collapse at any moment.  Second: The fish in front of us, the fish being used to make sushi, was not looking so hot.  Third: The smell coming from the fish made me sick to my tummy.  Fourth: The view we had of the kitchen, the one preparing raw fish, was dirty, dirty, dirty.  That was all it took. My husband looked at me, we both said "okay", got up and walked out.

I don't want to be a "sushi snob", buuuut.... This place was definitely subpar compared to some spots I have been. I actually picked this place to have lunch because of the other good Yelp ratings-- I don't see what all the hype is about. Sat at the bar, chef & servers were really nice & helpful, but felt like the rolls were made very sloppy (if that makes sense). Atmosphere is really BLAH. Barely any differences between the rolls. Absolutely nothing special, about the rolls or this place; in general...

We live nearby and always get the garlic chicken plate, kal bi plate, kim chee fried rice, Da Hawaiian breakfast plate, or the breakfast sandwich w/portuguese sausage.  DA BEST ONO KINE GRINDS :)  Can't wait to try their AYCE sushi one of these days!
Tried the sit down location.  Food is good value - you get alot for your money.  The service was super slow, however.  Friendly vibe.  Decent tasting food.

I come here for lunch usually..  Roast pork with Gravy Spicy Tuna Bowl Salmon Skin Bowl  Bento Box with Garlic Chicken  ...are my go-tos.   The minus one star is that it usually takes a good 15 minutes for things and there is only one cashier running the spot on its own. Other than that never had a bad experience.
Unfortunately they do not know how to properly prepare spam musubi. The Nori is not supposed to have a paper like consistency when served. It's really not that hard.

This place is really good. There's two sides, the Hawaiian food side and the sushi side. The Hawaiian food side also has two counters, one for just poke and one for all other menu items. They've got plate lunches, saiman, loco moco, bento boxes, chicken katsu, garlic chicken, kalbi, all the usual dishes you'd expect. The poke counter has a lot of choices, even if they run out in the evening they can make you some if you ask.  The poke is good and fresh and very similar to what we would get in Oahu. The sushi side is good as well, they do AYCE and also have a good brunch. You should also check out the desserts, they got pretty good malasadas and mochi. Definitely worth a try.

Just moved to vegas and we have been trying all the Hawaii flavor eateries.  They have 2 sides to the restaurant the sushi side and then the plate lunch side we did not know that but we were able to order from borh sides in the dining sushi side.  Food was great service great and you can order poi 9 dollars delivery on thursday. Will be back

First time here and I wasn't impressed at all.  The food was just normal and plain.  The seaweed salad looked sloppy on the plate the salmon lover roll tasted like lemon more then anything and fish was not fresh.. This will be my last time here.  The servers were aright but overall I'll take my business else were

Used to be one of my favorite all you can eat sushi places. We order a special roll which had scallops in it. My friend took one bite and had to spit it out. It was super fishy and stale. When it came to the bill the manager informed us we had to pay for the uneaten scallop roll. We told him it was inedible, he informed us that they charge $2 a piece for the uneaten roll even if it is inedible. WTF. Will never go there again!

Omg this place is "The bombdotcom." Everytime we come to visit Las Vegas, this is a MUST STOP!!! Everything you eat and order is so amazing. The freshest of desserts too. It's a perfect eatery away from home... Thank you island sushi for always taking care of us with your beautiful Aloha and Hawaiian hospitality!

Food was okay. Staff was super friendly and provided fast service. I ordered the oyako don which didn't have a whole lot if flavor and was overcooked. My son had katsu which was pretty good. Price was reasonable but again, food was just okay.
GREAT POKI! Love this place to get your sushi fix quick.

Currently, our favorite go-to restaurant. Both sides of the restaurant are satisfactory. Then why four instead of five stars? Because it's not a "knock your socks off" experience. Four stars for us is still a lot of love  though. We will probably continue going here on an almost weekly basis. I highly recommend making a reservation for the sushi side of the restaurant.

Absolutely love this place! I love sushi and even though I'm not an expert with it the wait staff is always willing to explain and give pointers.  My husband is a huge fan of the Loco mocha and orders it almost every time. So glad we found this place!

I absolutely love the food here! The sushi is amazing! I'm definitely going to be a returning patron :)  the only reason i'm giving four stars and not five is because when i ate lunch there me and my mom were excited about the lunch special where all rolls were HALF off. wow! however, after ordering several rolls and stuffing ourselves to the brim..we asked for a box to take the rest home. here's the catch: it's half off, but if you don't finish, sorry. you can't take it home. it's considered a "dine-in only" special..this makes sense from a monetary stance i guess. however, it would've been more polite for the waitress to have informed us of that PRIOR to ordering about this little rule.
So yummy! Great upbeat staff which you can understand when they speak to you. The poke is great. The big  island roll is fab. Must try the spicy mexican if you like spicy rolls.

This place is awesome! They have a great happy hour, amazing service & excellent food. Our server is always Mac and he deserves some recognition. He is always beyond sweet & attentive. Even when they are busy he makes sure to keep checking up on us. He's the best!

Great spot for fresh authentic Hawaiian poke! (When entering, their fresh poke is straight ahead).  This restaurant actually consists of 3 different venders sharing a space. Into the separate room is the actually island sushi sit down restaurant. They offer AYCE sushi, which is good, not my favorite, but still yummy. I do love that they have many Hawaiian dishes and styled sushi!
Decent sushi, Hawiian food as authentic as it gets, and really fresh poke for when you're on the run. The staff is really sweet, and service is quick. My favorite Hawaiian restaurant for sure.

this place is split in two.. you can have a sit down hawaiian style meal and walk into the other side for some sushi..   Hawaiian Side: LOVE LOVE LOVE the ahi poke.. and u can get a pound for like 12.00.  the food is very good!!!  when i order to go i usually order the kalbi short ribs and katsu which comes with yummy macaroni salad. it's always good and fresh off the grill..  and we always have left overs.  malasadas and desserts = primo!  it's really small when dining in on the sushi side, but the sushi is good so it's worth it.   i've only been here once, but i can say that the fish is very very fresh and the service was friendly.

My family always tries to come here when we're in Vegas. $26.95 for AYCE sushi dinner?! TOTALLY WORTH ITTTT. They don't have just sushi, they have other side dishes like mochiko chicken, kalbi, udon, edamame, etc. They pretty much have EVERYTHING :)  I recommend the Hamachi Kama (grilled hamachi collar). It's limited one per person during dinner time, so you definitely have to order it! I love getting the Salmon, Tuna, and Hamachi nigiri. For dessert, get the 808 Special (Tempura Banana) or the Malasada Sundae. Soooo bomb  Honestly everything here is SOOO GOOD. One of my favorite AYCE's in Vegas. It's a sit down sushi restaurant and you don't have to get the AYCE option but I highly recommend it. They also have a grill side of the restaurant where they have other choices of foods. Also check out Poke Express!

Alright as a newbie here in the LV my friend Jenn brought me here with a bunch of her friends to eat. Def. a warm welcome to Vegas as i just moved here 2 days prior to this dinner. I must say the food is definitely awesome and reminds me of home but then of course the owners are from Hawaii!!! Huge fan of the place and the owners are great as well. The food selection is huge and the prices cant be beat especially if you do buffet style for 20 some what dollar's. The service is also on point here and the staff is definitely super friendly and i would totally tell my friends to come here for there sushi cravings!  I do wish this place was closer to me then i would go a little more often haha but no matter, its still worth the drive!!!
If you craving Hawaiian food this is the place to come..plus you can grab poke too! Cheeeee!

I've heard nothing but great things about this sushi place. I've been dying to try if for myself. I called to make sure happy hour was still going on. I was told yes, until 10pm. I show up at 9:35pm party of 4 for happy hour and was told last called was at 9:30pm. At this point I was highly upset as I was lied to over the phone. I was told happy hour is until 10pm show up at 9:35pm and was told last call was at 9:30pm. NOT COOL. The guy at the front didn't even care and just laughed at us. We decided to leave and headed to I LOVE SUSHI instead.

Picked this place from the array of recommended sushi buffets because it sounded excellent  and there was a longer time limit on eating. I don't eat more, just slower.  I must have been there about the 90 minute limit but they were still encouraging me to eat more. Great choice! Divine ahi poke salad, one of my favorites.  Don't miss the garlic chicken. The fish was really fresh and the portions generous.

Terrible communication and customer service! I called to place a phone order for pick up later today. Then I called a second time to add to my order. Neither time did the person who took my order (two different people) mention that I needed to provide a credit card number, nor ask me for a credit card, nor tell me payment was needed before the food would be prepared. Only when my husband went to pick up the order, did they start cooking the order. Yes, I realize this makes absolutely no sense. Why would someone call in an order if the restaurant only started cooking the order once you've arrived and paid? Why waste your time even calling ahead?  I left my phone number so they could've called me to ask for a credit card, if one was needed. I would've happily left a credit card number to save the 15-20 minutes waiting there for my order to be prepared, if only they asked for one.  I will never be ordering catering or take out from them again.

The food was absolutely amazing and so full of flavor!! Our server Shayne was very helpful and professional. Food came out in a timely manner and the whole experience was lovely. Thank you Shayne for fast, efficient and friendly service

Food was gross. The fish tasted sour and the rice tasted like it's been sitting out for a couple days. When I told the wait staff he said let me get her (her being Roxanne). Roxanne came over and asked "is everything okay"? My husband and I both said no everything is not okay. She then asked what was wrong and we stated that the fish tasted sour and the rice tasted like it has been sitting out for a couple of days. Instead of being apologetic she said "well the rice was made this morning, I know I was here and I'm not going to charge you for the extra for the leftovers" with an attitude I might add. We asked for our bill and I told her we are not coming back and I did not give her a tip. You would think with our complaint they would have given us a discount or something. So I will not be coming back and I don't recommend this place at all.

Despite my anticipation going in, I was underwhelmed.   This is an unassuming little place tucked in a strip mall on Eastern. When you walk in, you enter the grill side (order at counter). To the right, is the sushi side. Both sides have a sort of dive feel. And not that "isn't this so neat" dive feel. More of the "where's the posted letter grade" dive feel.  The servers were definitely friendly and the service was perfectly fine.   The menu is fairly lengthy with a good variety of different types of rolls. I tried 4 different sushi rolls and the edamame. All were just "eh". Everything was too squishy and nothing tasted particularly fresh. And I wasn't impressed by any of the flavor combinations (despite them sounding good).  Maybe I just ordered the wrong items? Neither the food nor the atmosphere made the mark for me. There are definitely far better strip mall sushi joints out there.

**Grill side** Island sushi & grill has to be my favorite place for Hawaiian local food. Anytime you walk into a hawaiian local spot you will always feel the warmth and aloha. They are so welcoming it feels like i'm home! Garlic chicken is so awesome. I always get the bento with the teriyaki beef and choice of chicken which would always be the garlic chicken. I share with my son all the time and he absolutely loves it. He never leaves me any noodles though :(  Now that they have poke express, I'm totally in love! Spicy ago combo is my ultimate fave poke! Their limu is good too. I'm just sad it's far from my house. Malasadas are yummy with the fillings. There are other desserts too. So good! A good 15 mins but it's so worth going there.  *sushi side* All you can eat is great, i always have the scallop mayo, i can't find it anywhere else and that really reminds me of back home. they also have really good sides!  service is always good

Awesome deal for half off rolls! My boyfriend and I came here last night and had 6 rolls + miso soup + 4 sake bombs, for $54 total. Each roll has 8 pieces so...it's plenty of food! It's great quality and I know my sushi!  Half off rolls is 3-5pm and 9-11pm; and half-off all-day Monday and Tuesdays. Don't get flavored sake though (it's sickeningly sweet). just stick with the $2 sake bombs for a good time.

I've been eating here for the past 3 years now. It's definitely a piece of Hawaii that makes you feel like you're back on the island. Food is good and I always get Poke in the back of the restaurant from Poke Express. (Side Note: I first started coming here because my uncle and the owner of Poke Express went to the same church in Oahu. The owner of Poke Express was a well known chef back in Food Land.) The one thing I always come back for is the Garlic Chicken plate and the malasadas. They just upgraded the restaurant so it seems like business is doing well!!

My husband and I have to go to Island Sushi at least once for the AYCE sushi and side dishes when we are in Las Vegas.  Everything is always fresh and made well.  We are from Oahu and travel to LV at least two or three times a year.  What has been keeping us from flying there is the ridiculous fares with Hawaiian Airlines.  We really need another airline that flies non-stop to Las Vegas.  We recommend that anyone who has not been there you won't regret it. There staff is also very friendly and always there to help if you have questions.  They are the BEST!!!!  The price that they charge for the AYCE is more than reasonable.  Love it, love it, love it!!!!

Sushi was just ok. Service was horrible. So slow!! They took my order to a wrong table and didn't apologize. Took them 25 min from they say we will take your dessert order until we can flag them (they don't even bother to check on us again). Don't want to go here again.

Eh... Ok. The rolls I got was a little on the small side for the price. Back home I pay two dollars less and get bigger rolls, here im paying two dollars more and get half the size. I don't know if that's the normal size of their rolls or if it was because I order it to go.

I like that this place has sushi, as well as a full Hawaiian menu, AND Poke Express all under the same roof. The bf doesn't like sushi, but I could bring him here and even he could find something he likes.   Items ordered: Salmon poke with special sauce-From Poke Express  Maui roll Big Island roll Lychee Saketini Kahuku Roll Japanese Lasagna Edamame White Peach Saketini  A few friends and I met here for dinner one night around 6pm. It wasn't super busy and our server was attentive. I usually always get AYCE, but since not all of us wanted that, it was better just to order ala carte. The more expensive option, but probably saved us hassle in the long run. I enjoyed everything, but nothing really stood out to me. They do have some interesting rolls, like teriyaki chicken, that are different than what you usually find on a sushi menu, but they didn't really peak my interest.The saketini's were good, they are served cold with interesting flavors like white peach and lychee. I stopped by the dessert case on my way out and regret not getting anything. They had guava and chantilly cakes that looked pretty delicious. I feel like this is a place to try, but not somewhere I could see myself running back to.

Pretty awesome place! I was in the area and, based off my friend's recommendation, we dropped by during Happy Hour (50% off rolls). I was in a bit of a hurry and just ordered 3 rolls between us:  -Ahi Fever Roll -Caterpillar Roll -Spider Roll   All were excellent! They tasted more authentic than most sushi restaurants. So delicious. There are two separate sections and we sat in the self-service area (Poke Express?), however the staff was still friendly. I look forward to trying the AYCE here. It's somewhat in my area so I will definitely be back!

This rating is strictly for their Guava cake. I ordered a 8" guava cake for my baby shower the day of. I called around 1:00 and the person who answered said they had just sold their last Guava cake. I asked if they would be able to bake another one. They said they would and it would be ready for pick up in two hours. the cake looked appealing with the shredded dry coconut flakes around the rim of the cake. The cake was the highlight of my entire dessert table and all my guests would not stop raving over how delicious it was. It was fairly priced at $20. Overall, I give my overall experience with this restaurant a 10/10 for their customer service and delicious bake goods! I will definitely be going back to try their Chantilly cake.

I have been coming here for years, but as of recent, their service is horrible.  The waiters are not the same and the current ones are slow and it seems like they don't know what they are doing.  It's disappointing how bad their service has become.  They used to be so good.. I have been waiting to get seated 30 minutes.  UNREAL!!   And to top things off they have NO ginger!! Who the hells has sushi and no ginger!! Very disappointed in this place   Terry, you were completely out of ginger that day which is ridiculous considering you serve sushi..  You had 3 huge open tables that were empty.. 30 to 45 minute wait is ridiculous.

Sushi rolls are very delicious and they have a good all you can eat deal. Try the croc roll. They even give a free dessert at the end. I always leave feeling stuffed. Good customer service. This place is a must when you're in town.

I try to swing by this place whenever I am in Las Vegas. Expect to make reservations if you bring a group. The location and the interiors are comfortable, read... not fancy however the sushi is on point.   The variety, quality and service for an all you can eat sushi restaurant is what makes this a great find. The $28 for all you can eat is about what you would spend for a buffet but the variety of food including Kalbi, mochiko chicken and sushi makes this a great sushi experience. I do confess to having a sushi coma recently after visiting here.   Go and enjoy.

Wasn't really expecting much out of this place but this place was really good. It was a little busy so it did take little to get our food. But our waiter and the busier were really kool and helped us choose some rolls and desert.
nothing over the top about this place besides the $8 all u can drink asahi drafts. food was average and so was the service.

I live in LA and I literally crave their poke that it makes me want to drive 4 hours just to have some!  Only con is that parking can be difficult at times and there's not enough seats to accommodate a lot of people. Other than that, the food is unforgettable!

This place is the freshest! Went there for dinner and Mac was one of our servers, he is always amazing! They are all amazing, I wish I could recall all their names. We also like to sit at the bar sometimes with Juan, he's very entertaining. We have become regulars not only on the sushi side but also on the grill side. Sistahz always on it with our orders.

What is not to love here! They have all sorts of stuff going on. AYCE sushi, poke shack and island grill. They have a variety of desserts to choose from. We've checked this place out twice and have only been to the poke shack. First time we just got bought some ono poke by the pound to go and the second time we got delicious poke bowls. Both times the fish was great. Did not disappoint.  I see that the grill and the poke shack share space which is no problem at all. We had plenty space to sit while we dined there. We definitely are checking out the brunch special they have in the near future as well as the AYCE sushi. I've heard nothing but great things. Til then I'm a fan of this place and will continue to be a loyal customer.

This place is very good! Their all you can eat is very good with a lot of choices. They had one order of uni (sea urchin), amaebe shrimp, and a few other good choices. The rolls are good as well. I would definitely go back to this place!   Every Vegas stop from now on will include a trip to Island Sushi.

Went here for lunch....sat at the bar with my husband and ordered sushi for me and Hawaiian breakfast for him.  From a very rude service,  we felt unwelcome and almost as if we were bothering the waitress, to very very chewy seaweed,  (low quality ingredients and supplies) and semi-dirty place. Would not recommend!

Visited here originally three years ago with coworkers and have been returning ever since.  I live in Summerlin and it has been worth the drive to this location every time.  The sushi is presented with a hawaiin/polynesian accent and is very delicious.  The service is very friendly (the Ohana spirit is alive and well here).  Please try the crunch roll and oh yeah for dessert try the 808 ice cream.
Breakfast is good here if your craving for Hawaiian local food. The kimchee fried rice, local moco with kimchee fried rice and bacon; eggs and rice is a good portion.

Been here several times with family and friends, and generally have a great experience.  I am a sucker for Dragon Rolls, and the ones here certainly deliver.  Their eel is always top-notch.  Their ahi poke is good, and it's nice that it comes with AYCE (one dish).  I'm extremely picky with it comes to poke (my Hawaiian pop makes some that is out of this world), but I would recommend it to others.  What gets me right in my sweet spot is their tempura ice cream.  Oh man, is it delicious.  The batter is just the right amount of sweetness, density and melt-in-your-mouth flavor that can make you want to eat 6 bowls of it.  Service can be hit or miss, sometimes slow and sometimes not.  Food is consistently tasty though, so I'll lean towards a 4/5 on this one.
Very good sushi and atmosphere. A nice Hawaiian feel, very busy, and yummy food. If I'm ever back out this way I'd come back.

It was our first time here today and we've heard that it's one of the best --   service was below average - our server is not friendly at all and is not very attentive. we had AYCE and ordered 6 long rolls and some nigirl.  ordered hot tea and took our server 10 minutes each time she had to refill our tea. she passed back and forth and once checked if we wanted to order more and if there's anything else we wanted.  sushi was room temperature and is not the freshest.  at almost $30/head for dinner sushi -- we were expecting more both from the service given to us to the quality of food being served.  unfortunately, this will be the first and last visit we'll have at this joint,

Best Hawaiian food ever!! We love everything on the menu. We always go here every time we are in Vegas. Poke is fresh and so yummy! Best Teri beef and garlic chicken- you have to try it! The all you can eat sushi is also a great deal!!

Slow service if you sit at a table (because it's ALWAYS packed) but the food more then makes up for the wait. Happy Hour is all day Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday and it's 1/2 price rolls. Yum!! It's delicious and fresh and awesome. Just saying.

One of the best AYCE sushi in the valley.  They're quick with the orders not like the other ones.  They switched management so the rules for kids has changed.  They used to let us share with our 3 year old since they barely eat but not we would have to pay half of an adult price.  Quality went down a little bit but is still good.  These are the reasons why I only gave it a 4 star instead of 5.

AYCE lunch here was mediocre. The nigiri was not fresh enough for me and the sushi was put together without care. I like that it's close to my part of Henderson but I have not gone back from the last time I've been there. I would have enjoyed this spot if I came for non sushi items~~
Love it! Reminds me of home.  Can't beat the portions or the price!

Hands down best sushi in town.  Their local Hawaiian food is also amazing.  And don't get me started on desserts.  The butter mochi and chocolate malasadas are to DIE for.    The AYCE sushi is the way that most people go but I never have enough of an appetite so on Mon-Wed I come for the 50% off rolls deal that they offer to locals.  It's a steal and is usually a better deal for someone like me who only gets 2-3 rolls max.  Only beef is that they don't do half rolls, which a lot of AYCE places will do to allow you to try more options.  I highly recommend the kahuku roll (topped with orgasm sauce) and the town and country roll (cali roll with garlic chicken on top).  I also love the lava lover for something spicy.  What I like most is that they don't skimp on fish quality and they don't pile on the rice, even when we do the AYCE.  Plus they have the most extensive AYCE menu out there to include all of their amazing side items--poke, cucumber salad, teri chicken, etc.  If you happen to be in the area on a Sunday and want a great brunch, head to Island Sushi.  They have all you can eat AND all you can drink mimosas.  Just get there early, there's almost always a wait from the time they open until the end of brunch.

I have been too the other restaurant in downtown but first time at this location. I was in the area. So figure try the original location plus hungry nothing better for lunch then plate lunch. I should have tried something new but enjoyed the chicken and eggplant last time so got it again. Most part it same menu as the other location although in this one Poke Express in the store too and have lot more desserts lot of them individual pieces packed too go containers take home. The selection is pretty huge but like Poke (I love! So need make stop again just too try it) and dessert only had room for lunch.   It interesting way store set up with one half being sit down restaurant style and other side local style find place sit down eat. Thankfully went late lunch because less then twenty seats. Side you seat yourself.   Sure if ever in need for some good local food and sushi. It offers the best of both worlds.

I hate to do this on Christmas Day. Unbelievable placed a pick up order and came home to the worst food ever. I can't believe this was once our favorite spot to go to. We have been going here less and less since the quality and service just keeps going down.   I spoke to the manager who asked that we bring our food back so they can remake it. It's Christmas Day I don't want to drive back there to bring our food back to wait again to remake it.   This place was amazing at one point please do what you where doing before and get it back up there!!!

What can I say!  A-lo-ha!!!  An absolute favorite of mine and my family!  They've got choke (lots of), food and dish items for choice!  Their Garlic Chicken broke da'mout!  So deeeelicious and they have Butter Mochi!!!!  We literally take AND treat our family and friends coming to town for a visit to Island Sushi & Grill!  Mahalo nui for your awesome customer service and all of your Ono grinds!!!

Great sushi..everything is always so good. The sushi chefs, juan and chuy are so nice and friendly and always make us laugh when we sit at the bar. Only thing is that i don't like is some of the staff isn't as friendly. It also takes them forever to refill your drinks or to come to you if you need anything.

Went with my boyfriend once, though we tried a second time and they happened to be closed. The AYCE includes the awesomely delicious ahi poki, which to me alone is worth the trip (it's a bit far from our side of town). The baby tako were very yummy, too! The rolls were tasty and we ordered a LOT- to the point that I think our chef got frustrated, as we saw him walk off with a sour expression & another chef meekly replaced him. The rainbow roll was disappointing as others have said, but overall the food was tasty & the drink specials were great. Worth trying, and I'd like to go back soon~

I had Island Sushi delivered via Postmates over the weekend, and was very disappointed in the quality of my Tiger roll.   Keep in mind, I considered delivery time and potential wait time which would lessen the quality of the food - however I my order was delivered to me within 20 mins of ordering. 5 stars for Postmates!   Back to the Tiger roll... the seaweed was chewy & the prawn was soggy. TMI, but I had a bad stomach ache after, if you catch my drift.   won't be returning here.

If your into AYCE Sushi and Island food , this is where it's at. Great Variety,  Great Selection and weekly additions . I went for the 1/2 off rolls on Monday special and couldn't resist and got the AYCE. Best sushi spot in the VEGAS Area

This place has some really good all you can eat sushi-fresh and a good variety to chose from as well! After ordering a few things we told the sushi chef what we liked and he gave us a few things to try, he was right on with that and it was very much appreciated!   Now this was about a week and a half ago and we wanted to try it again!!! I had to be at work in 45 minutes so me and my husband decided to met there for a quick bite to eat... My only complaint is that the sushi bar is way to small, there were only about 3 seats left at the bar, 2 were together and one alone. Its very close in there and so there was not enough room for us to squeeze in there cause it would not have been comfortable. (not to mention my husband has a huge aversion to sitting next to other tables or people at restaurants, if they try to sit us next to another table and there is an open restaurant he freaks out!) and we didnt have time to sit at a table and be served so we had to leave!   We will defiantly be back again, this place is good and the dessert is good too and included (808 dessert was amazing).  We ended up rushing over to The Ka for a quick bite, always a good place either as a 1st choice (which it usually is for us, but we wanted something new) or as a backup!

Tough one. The sushi is good, the sushi chefs great, but the table staff and service, mostly fair. It used to not always be this way and I find it harder and harder to recommend Island Sushi remembering the years past. I guess not all things improve with age and Island Sushi is such a place at this time. My kids, that have been coming to Island Sushi since age two, now six years later recently asked to start going elsewhere. Kids are honest, is there more that needs to be said.

Disappointed that many say this is the best 'Hawaiian' food in the Vegas area. I would say those who feel such way have never been to Hawaii or haven't been back in 20 plus years. The garlic shrimp disappointed all around, it was the type of shrimp you'd find in a lower end Chinese buffet. The spam was dry, yet the rice was perfect. I do commend the staff for showing true Aloha to the customers this gives a great vibe. All in all the dishes are hit or miss but a great poke selection is what will keep me returning. I will never again eat what had this trip.

Sooooo Good. I come here every time I visit Las Vegas. My absolute favorite for POKE and Mochiko Chicken. After eating poke in Hawaii this is the next best place for it. We ordered the limu poke, spicy poke with avocado and the Kimchi tako. Also the mochiko chicken dinner large and one al carte mochiko chicken. It was enough for three big eaters. Oh I forgot to include 3 spam musubi. Again sooo good. Try it the next trip to Vegas.

First time here. Great all you can eat option. Don't even think about it! Mila was one of our servers and was such a pleasant and fun lady. Tikae was our sushi server at the bar and did a terrific job. Ricardo was awesome as well and had lots of suggestions.

I'm not big on giving 5 stars but I think this place deserves it. I have been searching for THE sushi place in Vegas and now I have found it! This is clear across town from where I live, but worth the drive every once in a while. I have been reading the reviews for the place and it had me so excited! Finally, for my bf's birthday, who is a sushi fanatic, we tried Island Sushi.  I like the idea of hawaiian fusion mix. We got here, a small sushi restaurant connected to Poke Express, and sat at the bar. We arrived around 4:15p, so it was still early and there weren't many people here at all. I think our sushi chef, Terrence, seemed like an owner or something. Not sure, but he was awesome! I told him it was our first time there and we had heard about it from Yelp, and he explained everything to us and gave us a special treat in the end.  So first off, we are Uni fans. HAD TO try the uni. It was fresh! Also had the hamachi and salmon. And some other stuff, don't remember. But everything was fresh. They also had a good variety of appetizers to choose from, different types of poke, some traditional sushi apps, and some hawaiian type apps. We ordered... hamachi kama (not a big fan but it wasn't bad), eggplant fries (YUM!!), crab poke (didn't know how to eat it!), little fried octopus (like calamari and it was super yummy! it looked cute too), also.. a couple other things. Can't remember it all, but nothing disappointed me at all. Some went far above expectations.  For the rolls, they had a decent variety and we couldn't decide what to try. They don't really do half orders (only on your last roll you can do a half). So Terrence asked us what we liked and just made some rolls for us. One had hamachi inside and outside and it was great. Also had the Big Island Roll. Did a half order of one the soft shell crab rolls (don't remember the name) and then there was another roll, but don't remember.  And then the desserts! We were limited to one dessert each which was a bummer. Yama Sushi is unlimited but they don't have the variety like Island Sushi! I got the 808 rolls after seeing all the pictures of it. Its deep fried banana with ice cream and whipped cream with fresh strawberries and chocolate syrup. My bf got malasadas (deep fried dough) with ice cream and whipped cream and strawberry sauce. Delicious! Not to mention they gave us mini puffs because we are yelpers! (well at least I am).  Overall, great experience. Their prices are decent. And they gave my bf half off since it was his birthday (we didn't even ask for it). Terrence is great! And the food was fresh and delicious. The servers were nice and the food came out quickly. If only they had a location closer to me, but you can't have everything right? I would go back to this place weekly if I could, but my waistline would not be happy with that. But I definitely recommend this place to everyone.  ALSO!! Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday they have 1/2 off rolls all day. Other days they have half off rolls certain hours for happy hour. Check their website for specials. And they have a full bakery attached to Poke Express (same place). Yum.

This place may not be for everyone, but I love it!  I've been here eight jillion times for AYCE sushi- the service is great, friendly, the sushi chefs are fast, smiling, ready to be of service no matter how busy they are, and I've been there when they've be REALLY busy~!  When you order from the servers the food comes out hot, or cold as the case may be, and quick- never had to remind a server "we're waiting on,..." ever.  The AYCE rules are reasonable, and, best of all, never get the feeling they're slowing down because you are doing AYCE -- Rolls are good, a good variety of everything- I developed a shrimp allergy, so even with that, the variety is outstanding, and they will make accommodations.  Not fancy, so don't get your hopes up that you're going to a place that's getting Michelin Stars- if you want a place that you can go, eat good food, relax and have a nice visit with friends and family, there ya go!
Great experience. Service was great and the sushi was awesome! $21 for unlimited sushi!? Sign me up. Will definitely be coming back! YUM!
Spicy tuna bowl is really good! Also love the poki options, staff was really nice as well..been the past 2 days now! Also love the ocean salad!
