This was 4th time here and obviously if we come back we like it! But this time... The service was terrible! And everyone knows you go out to eat expecting at least decent service but tonight it was just the opposite. We sat 10 min after we walked in (which is really fast) ordered right away but our rolls took an outrageous amount of time (only 2 rolls) I'm not even going to talk about the waitress and her lack of customer service. I won't include the entire staff in this review the bussers were amazing as always!!! The food was amazing as always, 3 rolls 4 beers and a sake for $50 and the only way they went wrong was the waitress....

I love this place!! This is my first time and all I can say is BAM!! We had great service from Shane and the food is out of this world amazing!! I love the sushi infused with an amazing Japanese Hawaiian twist! If you haven't been here you haven't lived!!

I was craving Asian food after being in Utah for 4 days, and Hawaiian Japanese food sounded delicious! We ate the Sunday brunch buffet for $21/person. The buffet included your choice of appetizers, sushi, and a choice of dessert. The food was pretty good for the price. We ordered lots of nigiri, different styles of poke, and 2 rolls - a total of 35 dishes. I loved the unagi, while my hubby enjoyed the uni. We had the ahi, fried tofu, kimchee tako, and raw crab poke. I liked the fried tofu and ahi poke the best. The desserts weren't very good. We had tempura ice cream and 808 special. The tempura batter fell off the ice cream.   Service was great! Our waitress kept on coming back to our table to see if we wanted to order more food. I'm glad that we weren't ignored.   One minor grip was that this restaurant charged for green tea - $1.50 per person. I'm not used to paying for green tea.   You need a car to get to this place since it is really far from the Strip. I would come back here again.

I was craving Hawaiian Oxtail soup so I decided to stop in. I didn't realize that Poke Express was also inside this location so that was a Plus! The Customer Service is excellent, everyone was so nice and greeted me and made sure I was helped. The Oxtail soup came out with 2 scoops of rice, green onions and ginger. Upon taking that first taste, I felt like I was on the Island. The flavors were all there and then I got to the oxtail, it fell off the bone and just melted in my mouth. This is the Oxtail soup I remembered when I was in Hawaii and I can't wait to have it again! It was a large portion so I had to pack half of it to-go. To top that off, I had 2 malasadas: Plain and Haupia. Both were amazing, very close to Leonard's Bakery. If you are having Island withdrawals and want some delicious food, this is the place to be.

Always a must when we go to Vegas. Everything on the menu is ono and the people working always bring the aloha Had the Kim cheese fried rice and the Portuguese sausage, eggs, rice w/ side of corn beef hash. Took home banana bread, malasadas and chocolate mochi. Everything is homemade, fresh and always huge portions. We do eat a lot of local food, and this place ranks at the top for mainland venues. Oh, and can't forget to mention the fresh poke bar! Local heaven!! Mahalo I.S. Be back soon!!!

Love this place.  Best AYCE sushi joint in town.  Everyone one is friendly, with great service.   There is always someone asking you if you need something.   The sushi chefs are way friendly and will make whatever roll you can create in your mind.  The poke is so good and the desserts are freaking great.  I try to make them lose money when I eat here, gluttony at it's best!

Went here for a family dinner and got the AYCE for around $27 per person. This is probably the first resto with 3 different spots: plate lunches, poke, and sushi (a sushi resto to be exact). Think L & L , Tanioka's, and Sushi Twister all combined into one. Was the AYCE worth it? I think so. You can order anything on the menu with a limit of 2 for desserts. The poke was great and had that melt in your mouth texture. My dad ordered around 3-4 small bowls of poke alone. The sushi was pretty good but I think still not as good as Yama Sushi. The only thing that I would say negative about this place is that the male waiters in the sushi resto were not really "waiters." They were pretty much  there to take your order and give you your food. I would expect a waiter or waitress to be at least a little engaging and I don't think once did the guy ask "How was the food?". But the food is good and I'll come back to try their plate lunches.  Note: You know when you are next to Hawaiian locals when you hear the table across from you say, "Uncle, sooooo....how was California Hotel?" LOL

a hole in the wall to be sure but the poke bowl was super delicious! lots of poke for $10. we also had the bento with mochiko (sweet rice flour) battered fried chicken and the ahi, with rice and noodles. the ahi was so-so but the chicken was good. the sweetness was unique but i'd probably try garlic next time. a lot of food for $8 and change. definitely stays on my list to try again.

We came here because someone recommended the malasadas. Boy, they weren't kidding. The malasadas were good! They were fresh, soft and had a crunchy outer layer.  We order the plain, guava custard, and original custard. Loved the Guava custard filled malasadas.   I ordered through Grub hub on my way to Island Sushi and my order was ready when I got there. However, I still waited in a long line to get them.

The poke bowls are really tasty and flavorful. The only reason I'm giving it only 3 stars is because it is overpriced. I had to pay when I wanted extra spicy mayo and when I wanted to substitute normal rice for sushi rice. Poke bowls taste much better with sushi rice. It used to come with that but then now they give regular white rice. I don't eat there as often anymore because it's overpriced.

Sorry a late post. Decided to try their all you can eat about 2 weeks ago. The good, they have a great selection for all you can eat (for both sushi lovers & for non sushi lovers), got seated fairly quickly & all food came out in a timely manner. The bad, 1st server introduced herself as "Angie" & were barely waited on by her. Servers don't wear a name badge. Got seated by "Bronson" (I asked his name) & became the table server, who rarely came by the table. Recently went back to eat sushi, again the all you can eat. Better service & all food came out in a timely manner. Able to use the "loyalty card". If you don't have a loyalty card, then get 1.

Coming in here was a bit confusing. At first it threw me off that there is different sections for different restaurants. It looked like one big place to me. Poke express is inside island sushi and I was strictly coming here for poke but decided to eat at island sushi also. This place is pretty good. Good customer service and good food. The lady that had helped me was nice. She explained all the questions I had and was very nice about it. I liked the Hawaiian food mix that they had going on.   I had the "grilled" side of island sushi.  I ordered the loco moco with Portuguese sausage. It was pretty good. I had tried stuff my group had gotten also. No complaints really.  I would recommend coming here just for the poke express but this place is a added bonus. Although it only says ISLAND SUSHI outside and a small poke express on the door when coming in. My food at poke express probably overshadowed how good the food is here so I will probably come back here and give an update if this place is even more awesome or not.

I love this place!!! Stopped by during my Vegas trip and was very impressed with the authentic Hawaiian menu and taste!!! I ordered the bento box c, which was only $5 but comes in a very generous portion. I had it with mochiko chicken, my friend had the garlic chicken; both were excellent. I will be back for the loco moco. I'm pretty sure the staff are from the islands because they were just so nice and friendly. I grew up on Guam and also lived in Maui, so it was great to eat spam again!

Came here for lunch with my Co worker to try the sushi. We ordered off the menu and did not do all you can eat.  We ended up ordering 4 normal rolls, two speciality rolls, one baked roll, and an order or sashimi.  A the food was bad. Probably the worst sushi I've had in Vegas/Henderson area! The quality of fish wasn't good, and the sashimi was still a bit frozen.  The service was awkward. I would ask for something then the sever would ask me 10 questions back!

This place is amazing!!!! Food deserves an A+ !!! And the service is even better! Thank you to our server Mac for making our experience a memorable one. We make the 3 hour drive just to come out and eat here!

Ono food for reasonable prices. Their poke tends to be smaller pieces but has always been fresh every time we get it. There are two sides to the restaurant: a sushi side and what they call the "grill" side. I haven't been over to the sushi side yet, but can say that the grill side's food is great. Won ton min, poke bowl, loco moco, mix plate...all grindz. I'll also usually pick up a half dozen of their malasadas to take home; not quite Leonard's, but they're warm and hit the spot. However, I didn't care for the guava or chantilly cake when I got them.   We live in Summerlin but drive all the way to Henderson to eat here, because it's a little piece of the islands on the 9th island.

Our family had the AYCE deal. We ordered the 3 year old SPAM, eggs and rice since she's not big into sushi...yet. Our older kids on the other hand LOVE sushi so this was a special dinner for us. Here's what we ordered:  Edamame Gyoza Baked Mussels Mochiko Chicken Shrimp Tempura Vegetable Tempura Black Widow Big Island Island Special (Family Fave) Katsu Roll Surf & Turf Roll Rainbow Roll Mauna Kea (Family Fave) Crunch Roll Joe Special Dragon Roll *And we reordered a couple of these.  Overall, it was a good experience - I felt like I was eating at one of the local joints in Hawaii. They were pretty fast at bringing out our food too. Bonus points for having a dessert included in the AYCE price. We'd definitely come back!
best hawaiian food in vegas! mochiko chicken & teri beef bento! mmmmmmm....

Great service. I expressed interest in the Poke Express next door and they offered to bring my order over to eat with my Island Sushi food. But once I looked at the menu I decided there was plenty there for me to enjoy. My husband thought the pieces were small, but I was content with the portions. We ordered: Hamachi Kama- generous meaty yummy, Rainbow Roll- lots of fish on top, Mackerel Nigiri. The sushi has no frills. David S said something about the fish being warm. Mine was very room temperature, but nothing happened to me. The atmosphere is casual relative to other places. It's connected to Poke Express. On my way out I got dessert over there. All in all it was an a-ok lunch experience.

Ahhhh our favorite go to when we just want islander food and sushi,  we are so lucky to have this place in Vegas!!!  We discovered it years ago through friends from Hawaii and still drive all the way across town to come here regularly!! We love the island special,  the mauna kea,  Maui wowie,  the croc is awesome.  We always get the poke,  garlic chicken,  seaweed salad and save room for dessert. We usually come for the Sunday brunch,  they have a special menu in addition to their regular ayce menu and it's only $21.95!!!! I always treat myself to the tempura ice cream,  it's so Ono!!! Love you guys,  don't ever change!!!!!

Ok, so perhaps I have a sushi addiction! We went to island sushi the other night. There was a wait, which wasn't that cool, but the food was great! I don't think I've ever had a fresher rainbow roll. Do it
Our first time here on vacation and the selection of all you can eat rolls and side dishes were endless! Great desserts too. Everything was delicious! Definitely coming back.

Not bad sushi. We did the all you can eat. Wish that they did half rolls. Wanted to try a lot of stuff on the menu. No problem though.  4 full rolls, ahi poke appetizer and an 808 dessert later...very satisfied!!! Would recommend you give this place a shot. Do the all you can eat cause a couple rolls and appetizer are same or more than the 21.95 price of AYCE

My only experience comes from the non sushi side, where they serve the bentos, dessert, and poke etc.  Their food is pretty good,  it reminds me of local food in Hawaii and the service is pretty quick.. They have a pretty good variety of poke but I reserve that for weekends since I work on the west side of town and can't get there on weekdays before they sell out!  It's quite a popular place as I see a lot of local people from Hawaii, so  hey, you know it's good.  One of my favorite dishes is just a plain ole bento (the one without the mahi mahi...nooooooo).  Try to make it there as a treat for dinner every pay period.  I'm never a let down.

I come here for both, the sushi and grill side   I typically order Poke, the Crunch Roll and a Mini Garlic Chicken when I stop by. Their poke is excellent, always fresh. I had their Malasadas for the first time today, super light and fluffy. Not too sweet. They are tasty except there was a slight odd aftertaste to them, can't quite explain it.   The prices are very reasonable.   The establishment could be in a better lot location, since parking space is a little tight if you have a large vehicle/truck.  Most of the staff members are helpful and friendly. There is seating for the sushi diners and grill diners. You can dine in, take it to-go, or order and pick up! Whenever I come here, there's always a considerable amount of customers and a wait time which is a good sign - people like it, hence they go here.   If you're around the Silverado Ranch area and want some good Sushi or Hawaiian food, go here!

I don't normally like sushi but this place is delicious! They have a huge variety of sushi with great prices. All you can eat and happy hour are definitely worth the money. Good prices and great service!
best ahi poke in town , service is always 5 star. best AYCE sushi place in henderson. best of it you can make reservation  for a AYCE place.
First time eating here today, poke was fascistic a long with the other Hawaiian treats. Highly recommend.
This place is great.  You can either order off a full Hawaiian food selection or choose from a variety of great tasting poke towards the back of the restaurant. A very nice cozy place.

Tried the poke express for lunch today.  The woman helping me let me sample as many different items as I liked - in fact, she encouraged it.  I ended up with a 1/3lb of the spicy ahi poke and 1/3lb of the "ocean" (seaweed) salad.  My total was just over $7.  I was very pleased with the service at the poke express bar, and the food. Can't say anthing about wait staff, since I took my food to go.

Dined here on Friday night 3/2/12.  I was a little skeptical at first being that this place was in a shadier part of downtown Vegas.  My hubby and I had a number of sushi rolls which were all very good and fresh too.    What sticks out in my mind the most about this place however, were not the sushi rolls we ate, but the malasadas we ordered after dinner.  OMFG!  They were soooo insanely delicious!!!  My hubby ordered the plain malasada and I ordered the custard filled malasada.  So freaking good!  It was worth going to a shady area just to eat.  Best foodie find in a while.  They were fresh, soft and warm.  The custard was perfect, not too sweet or overpowering and very creamy.  It was so good, it made it worth while cheating on my diet!  The plain malasada was very tasty too, but the custard filled one was over the top.  A little piece of heaven in your mouth I tell you!  They also have chocolate and haupia filled malasadas too!  I would definitely dine here again as they have a pretty large Hawaiian food menu too.  They have very good prices for breakfast and lunch that I will for sure have to try the next time I am in Vegas.   VERDICT:  GO FOR THE CUSTARD FILLED MALASADAS!  Your taste buds will thank me! :)

My boys are a BIG fan of this place and so am I. When I'm in competitive eating mode I do the all you can eat sushi. I love the Surf and Turf roll, Town and Country roll, and Big Island Roll, HOLY MAMA! The all you can eat menu is fabulous. The only thing is it's really hard to get a table. Once the big Hawaiians show up they ain't leaving until there times up. They sushi guys are awesome and Erin the waitress is super cool. When I'm not in the mood to be a cow, fried noodles are yummy, avocado poke bowl with taro chips are healthy good, garlic chicken plate is delicious and flavorful, the teri burger broke da mouth, and the custard pie hits the spot. I love this place! An absolute gem :)
Nice restaurant, offering a variety of specialty sushi rolls, and Hawaiian flare food. This place is good, but often ridiculously packed during dinner hours.

Love love love this place!!!! So good and the service is awesome, very reasonable prices too! Also a huge bonus is that you can even get real Hawaiian treats here! Also hard to find things like Lomi salmon. Wow!

I am from Orange County/Los Angeles area and was recommended to come here for AYCE sushi from a friend.  I have NEVER tasted sushi that was so delicious!  I am not a sushi expert, however, this sushi was so ono (good) that I didn't need any soy sauce!  Little rice, they focused on the fish.  Fresh wasabi is offered but is $2 each (totally worth it).  Poke was very soft and perfectly flavored.  I will make an effort to always come here for sushi when I'm in Vegas.  Nice service too.

Worst service ever!!!! I waited 25 minutes to be seated for all you can eat. Not to add they weren't very busy. Then another party comes and is seated before me. When I'm finally seated, the waiter comes to my table 15 minutes later asking how is everything. Well considering he hasn't even taken my order. I would say Everything is horrible! I get my first round of sushi. Then I sit and wait 30 more minutes without any service . I would not recommend this place to anyone. When I order all you can eat sushi that's what I expect to receive. Not two rolls and over and an hour of waiting. Save your money and not to mention I was so irritated I didn't even get dessert. This place is a joke. I will never waste my time again.

I've been here several times. I phoned my order in today the girl taking the order had an attitude. She didn't even give me a total over the phone like most place should give you a total. When I walked in to pick up my order shyra looked like she didn't even care and looked like she didn't want to be there. You need better customer service don't think I'll be back again. Kalbi wasn't a hit for me for $9.95 I could of went to L &L and got more ribs and it taste better too.

I love Island sushi, I've been coming here for years, but last night was probably the worst experience ever. The service was absolutely terrible, it does get busy, but the server at least will acknowledge you. We sat for 10 minutes before anyone came over to get our drink order, and another 10 after that for the server to come take our orders. The combination that my niece ordered came out with only half the items, and we seemed to inconvenience our server when we asked for the rest of her items. The first roll that we ordered which is my husband's favorite ended up coming out at the very end of our visit we had to ask twice about it, and when it finally came out it was, burnt, dried out and inedible. Thankfully the busser was good with filling our drinks because ordering was impossible all night. The service has really gone down. They used to be so friendly and fast even when it's busy.

We come here for their AYCE because the kids all have their own favorites, and this way, they are able to have more options.   Love their malasadas. I order for pick up sometimes and they get so busy, you'll get frustrated waiting longer than what you're told over the phone when you get there. I don't know the girl's name, but she's always the one ringing me up at the take out register. She's always giving me a weird bitchy vibe.   Poké is hit or miss as far as the fishy taste. When it's not pungently fishy, I enjoy my occasional Shoyu Poké which I blend with some seaweed salad over a bed of warm white rice.
Malasadas in the States? cool! not as good as leonard's down in hawaii, but not too bad at all.  I recommend getting the pan-fried noodle combo....pretty outstanding tasty noodles for a quick lunch.

I swear this place is not the same. Customer service is so so/jus ok.  I got the ISG reward card after paying and the chick act like it would've taken too much time from her to give me my points SMH  Oh and the cakes, yea the cakes suck. Who da hell puts coconut flakes on a guava cake. Also I'm curious to know why was the guava cake $20.00 and the rest was $25.00.  I bOught it on Saturday and now it's Monday I transferred the cake to a plate and what do u know there is frickin mold on the bottom. Like fo real ISG-how old was this cake? That's jus nasty. I inserted some pictures, I trimmed the edges cause it was junk and than to notice mold.....oops there goes the cake in da trash. NO BUY DA CAKES FROM HERE-GO TO WORLD OF CAKES(they make da best cakes and island flavor get um too)

Why no negative stars??  Horrible, just horrible.  This place should be reported to the health department and shut down.  I've never had an overall bad experience at a sushi place as there is usually something positive to focus on but this place is a clear exception.  1) Service was horrible from the start. The host was confused with the difference between per piece and all you can eat pricing. Once we were finally seated, it took over 10 mins for someone to come over and when the waitress finally did, just asked what we wanted and walked away. We asked for spicy mayo literally five times and when they finally brought it, only brought two even though we asked for individual ones.  2) I had the baked Tempura Roll and it made me deathly sick. It didn't taste bad but after I finished it, I had to rush to the rest room and still felt sick long after.  3) The place seemed run down and very low end. I like to give places the benefit of the doubt as some great places can be dives but this place takes the cake.  Horrible, horrible experience. Buyer beware!!

SERVICE- HORRIBLE -went up to the counter after 25 minutes of waiting for my food, I was waiting in front of the cash register for 2 minutes and staffed walked by me multiple times, didn't pay any attention to me finally after 3-4 min the lady in the front told me "she'll be right with me" waiting ANOTHER 3-4 minutes, she finally asked "how can I help you" (at this point I was pissed) I told her I've been waiting for 30 minutes and the 2 parties of 4 people that ordered after me had gotten their food.... She asked another worker if they had my food (they obviously forgot) they gave me a mochiko chicken on the back counter that was obviously for a call in/ take out order... she gave it to me AND DIDNT EVEN APOLOGIZE!!!!    FOOD QUALITY-- DECENT  POKE-- GOOD FOR VEGAS

loved the eat all you can for  $24.95! I could only eat so much, any leftovers are subject to penalty. So order only what you can finish. Service is fast,efficient and friendly. I would go back again and again.

One of the better AYCE sushi places I have tried. I came here for my daughter's 13th birthday because she wanted sushi.  I was thinking feeding a bunch of teenage girls, this could be expensive so I knew I wanted an AYCE option. I also wanted a place that served more than just sushi because let's face it, not everyone can get down on raw fish. I really think I chose the perfect place! Other than the shitty parking lot, and a few service hiccups, I would say we did pretty well.  There ended up being 10 of us. I only made a reservation for 8, and they accommodated us. It was a small squished area, and there was a bigger table they could have put us at, but whatever. It was my fault so I was not going to complain. Three of the girls went with a teriyaki chicken plate that was served with rice and mac salad. It was good. But I was there for the unlimited supply of garlic edamame, gyoza, tempura, tiger rolls, and oh my new favorite, the black widow roll. I did not even realized I like soft shell crab until this roll. They also had great dessert options like brownie sundaes, green tea ice cream, and creme brulee.  There were certain items you could only have one of, but AT LEAST they offer these items unlike other sushi places. (certain sashimis and desserts) And a few certain items that were only available for dinner. Which is a couple bucks more, but still a great price at $27 p/p.  The restaurant is small with a mix of Hawaiian and Japanese decor. The service was not bad. It was not amazing. They forgot a coke, and served us a roll 25 minutes after ordering it. They did not charge us for the 6 uneaten pieces of sushi which I was grateful for. Our total bill including 18% tip came to $300. For sure a decent price for 10 at a sushi spot.  I can't wait to return without the kids, and indulge in their half price happy hour.

My Island Sushi cherry has officially been popped! My cousins have been telling me to try this place out for months, and finally we all got together to feast!! (I was the only newbie).  WHERE: Located on Eastern & Serene.  WHAT: As a first-timer, I had to do AYCE!! Wouldn't it be a waste if I didn't eat all I could?!! Ok so back to my experience.  I am in love with baked rolls, and the only downside to this place was that AYCE did not have ANY baked rolls whatsoever! I was bummed at first, but when I tried what they did have, my "bummness level" decreased.  WHAT I HAD:  The appetizers I had were: ahi poke (I might have to say that this is one of the best I've tasted in town! It was very fresh and tasty), mochiko chicken (ahh, I fell in love after the first bite!), seaweed salad (sweet & delishhhh), and baked mussels (always one of my favorites when on any menu).  Special Sushi rolls I had: -Mt. Charleston roll; Since they didn't have baked rolls, they did have baked scallops on this roll.  I had to take advantage because this was the closest thing to baked that I'd be getting that night. Haha, when I did get my roll, I was very pleased! -Ahi Poke roll; I apparently couldn't get enough of the tuna in my system, I needed more! Kudos to this roll though =). -Island Special roll; this roll was my all time favorite! Everyone must have this! It hit the spot indeed.  *NOTE: if you do decide to do AYCE, you get to choose a free dessert! I always have room for dessert in my tummy =D. There were malasada&icecream, brownie&icecream, just plain icecream, mochi, and I believe there were a couple more.  I settled for my mango mochi of course.  WHY: A lot of people have been comparing Island Sushi to 808 Sushi (because of the whole owner/chef switch, I actually am not so clear of it myself), but I have personally come to conclude that Island Sushi defeats 808 Sushi in my book.

Tried this place for the 1st time today! We ordered 2 rolls a la carte and some plates! The 2 rolls came out very fast and were very good! My dad received his garlic shrimp plate shortly after, he was pretty much done with his plate before my mom and I received our plates (about 20 mins) apparently there was a mix up in our order not a huge deal cause we were still full from the rolls. Our waiter (mack) was kind enough to give us dessert on him for the inconvenience which was really nice of his!  He was a great server all in all and checked up on us very often! If it wasn't for Mack being a great waiter we probably wouldn't have a huge interest in coming back but his friendliness is what will draw us back in! Thanks Mack!!

I went to their weekly Sunday Pupu (appetizer) brunch which includes a special Hawaii Pupu menu + the regular AYCE lunch menu for the same price as a regular lunch AYCE, pretty good deal if you ask me. Ive eaten at the sushi side a couple of times and just as it was before the service was eeeh ok at best, i expected better and faster service since its not always full capacity when we go.  I really enjoyed the extra pupus that you can order, my favorite was the "seared garlic-peppered ahi belly" that was the best thing on there, but the only bad thing was that it was limit one order per person, so i recommend getting that as one of the last of your sushi orders, my favorite dessert from the pupu menu was their small slush or ice cream float shot, the one on the menu this time as the green apple slush float shot, it was very very good i got a brain freeze after downing a couple lol. The rest of the menu was just ok nothing really special.  For the grill side i always used to drive 8 miles just to get their bento or malasadas, pretty far drive just for some food but its worth it when i have the Hawaii food craving, i don't go there much anymore since i always hit up the IslandbreezeLV truck which is almost always closer to me than Island Sushi.

When I am in vegas I usually go there for the Malasada.  But, I will get there special of the day especially on Friday for chicken long rice with Laulau and Lomi salmon.  Overall the food is pretty good for plate lunches. But this last time the teriyaki chicken was a little salty compared to previous times.    Once in awhile they would have coconut custard pie and that's pretty good.  The poke is excellent one of the best in the area.  The deft touch on the shoyu for the poke is on point not too salty.
Sunday Brunch just got a regular customer!! Real bargain for all the choices!! Promise, you won't be disappointed

Sigh.. I didn't want to do this but I had no choice...  All I can say is shame on you Island Sushi! We loved getting in the car with anticipation of eating all your delicious rolls but no longer.... Last night the hubby and I wanted,nay craved, your succulent rolls. With mouths watering, we stepped in and got seated.  We order our drinks but no one was around to take our order. We tried, oh did we try, to get someone's attention but I guess the wait staff was too busy chit chatting by the cash register to notice. We decide then and there to get up and fill our empty bellies somewhere else and that we did!

Good for breakfast, lunch and dinner!!! Loco Moco for just $6 bucks or so for breakfast.  Hardy enough that I have it at 7am and not get hungry till after 1pm!! That is back for your bucks!! Poke bowl was generous in size and in flavors.  The only draw back to this place is location.  It's 200 plus miles from home base!!! Luckily I have Bachan's Kitchen!
Damn daniel back at it again with the whiite riice  I am starting to feel like i am in a relationship with this place. I cant stop loving island sushi. Treat a lady so goood

So this is my second review for island sushi and I always eat here. Today is the first time I had ever been charged for something ridiculous. I asked for ponzu sauce because I think it tastes better with sushi instead of soy sauce. Our waitress gave me a tiny bit of ponzu sauce and never refilled it and charged me 75¢! I don't mean to sound cheap, but the principle of being a sushi place and charging for dipping sauce is ridiculous! I've been going here for almost two years and I have never been charged for ponzu sauce! And the charge isn't listed on their menu. Island Sushi should think about getting rid of this ridiculous charge.

Best and closest food to local food. Even better than some local places in Hawaii. We normally just go to California Hotel for local food but this is definitely our new spot.  They have everything. We tried a good amount of everything... Musubi, kalbi plate, garlic chicken, loco moco, Portuguese sausage loco moco, oxtail soup, fried noodles, as well as like 5 different pokes. All were freakin amazing and I'd highly recommend this place to EVERYONE!
Island sushi rocks!  Everything I had was good except the raw tako wasabi was a bit weird!   Go here

Wow I am in love, found the joint in a strip mall but was worth braving 100 degrees with pasty white skin for Island Sushi. Didn't go ayce cos my eyes are bigger then my stomach!   I hate wasting food so ordered ala carte with the Scotsman. Had miso, Salmon Lomi and garlic ahi tuna to start..the tuna had great flavour and was a fave right away.   For rolls we ordered the Big Island, Mauna Loa and another one with Cali roll topped with baked scallop and mushroom on top, the name escapes me cos I am working on 4 hours sleep while writing this after a night at the BJ tables in The Orleans.   Hats off to the fantastic staff at Island, answered all our questions, and since it was Monday we got 50% off our rolls, Bonus!
The food was awsome and the service was great.  Lunch happy hour ends at 4pm, I got in at 3:30pm no rush and everything was nice and relaxing.   A must try.   ENJOY

Food is very good, happy hour every day, half price !! :-) :-),, Sunday brunch with mimosas,specail pricing,, it's really great and you should check it out not only for the delicious food but always great specials

Yes, that's my photo on the front page of this restaurant. Yes, you're welcome for making you hungry.  Now, it's just ok. Quality has shifted to the wayside just a bit, but the volume of sushi you get could make up for it.

This is our go-to AYCE sushi joint in Vegas. Being from Hawaii, we can appreciate the fact that the owners are from Hawaii and the food is authentic. Sushi is great, the plate lunches are great, the desserts are great, poke is great, all of their food is great. You shouldn't even question if you should come here or not.

I was craving mitsuken a restaurant in Hawaii.  I ordered the mini garlic chicken plate with fried rice, bacon, and eggs.  The food was salty with little to no taste.  Gave it a 4 star because the customer service is always on point!  The atmosphere is always aloha in here.  The restaurant splits on one side you have sushi and the other you have local Hawaiian food with poke. The parking lot isn't huge but good enough.  Never had a hard time parking.

Service was awful. I ordered saimin and my daughter and son ordered bento and fried noodles. Food came out cold and I'm almost positive that the server forgot to put in my order. It came 10 minutes after I asked another server if my saimin will ever arrive. Won't be going back.

The place is divided into two. One side is for Hawaiian food and the other for sushi. Which is pretty cool because you can still order from both menus whichever side you are sitting at. I order the bento box B with the garlic chicken. It comes with furikake rice, fried noodle, spam, and fried garlic ahi. There was a good amount of food. The garlic chicken was very tasty with a nice kick to it so was the garlic ahi. The service wasn't bad. The food came out pretty fast. Cool place overall.

All you can eat sushi?  Oh yes! Hawaiian style grinds?  Oh Yes!  This is a must go to place for anyone from hawaii. The AYCE sushi is fantastic, but it does have a timelimit and they are supposedly strict with leaving leftovers (we did not).  Also comes with a dessert.    You want malasadas?  they have them here too!
Had the AYCE, wifey and kids had combo boxes.  So good. Desserts good. Service was great, everyone super friendly.

The first time I came here we got out with 39 items in total, the next day in Vegas we had dinner here again, got out with 49 items all for a little over $100. It is nice that every food you order is fresh from the kitchen, it would be nice if they can serve 2/person on the soft shell crabs on the buffet. Love their fried donut ice cream, shrimp tempura, teri beef, tiger roll.

BEST HAWAIIAN FIX OUT THERE!  this place beats l&l and most of the items found in aloha kitchen! well, actually I only go to aloha kitchen for their adobo fried rice omelet but I have tried their bbq and it doesn't compare. I absolutely love the MINI garlic chicken, that comes with a scoop of rice and side salad of miso ginger dressing, just enough food for lunch or small dinner. their rice is sticky and the bottom of the rice scoop gets soaked in the garlic chicken sauce, best part of the entire dish. poke express is also in island sushi, and they have the best fresh assorted poke! for dessert, get a plain malasada!

Island sushi is by far the "bestest" place for island style food and broke da mouth sushi rolls!!!!  We eat here about 4-5 times a month and it has always been Ono-licious!!!! The ISG crew is very friendly, attentive and fast!!!!  I recommend EVERYTHING!!!!
for an all you can eat, this is an amazing sushi bar. they are very fast with there orders and everyone is friendly. when I come back to vegas, I will be back

Never had AYCE here but I did have their Garlic Chicken, Fried Noodles and Poke. I love the Poke from Poke Express!!! Garlic Chicken and Fried Noodles taste good BY THE ORDER, but if you order by pan, it tastes different. Fried Noodles were bland and garlic chicken was burnt. My sister had a get together on New Year's Eve and ordered a good amount of desserts, including Coco puffs. I'm not a fan of coco puffs but decided to try it since the last time was in Hawaii 6 years ago. I bit into one, and there was a short hair in the chocolate filling, I almost threw up!!! That turned me off even more. I'll probably will never order anything here besides the Poke. I'll stick with other options on Eastern.

Great to eat here during happy hour. Service was good and food was great. I think the total was under $30 and included 6 rolls 1 hot saki and 1 bottle of beer. This was my first time eating here and  would definitly go again.

Really good fish, awesome rolls like "the big island" and "surf n turf". Had the happy hour with half off sake with AYCE. Unfortunately I have to take a star away because quail egg doesn't come with AYCE, like I understand if they don't want to give me 6, but they could offer 1 per person like most other sushi places. If not for the limited AYCE, this would be my favorite spot.

Their poke is ONO-licious!!!!  Everytime I come to Vegas I make it a point to get poke here at least once.  Hands down, the best poke I've ever had!  And so many varieties to choose from.  Also love that they have desserts as well.  Their mochi is so delicious!  Soon as you walk in you can feel the aloha.  Everything is reasonably priced too.  This is definitely one of my favorite spots to eat not just in Vegas but anywhere!

Had to try this place after passing by & hearing other satisfied opinions. The taste of everything was so flavorful. I felt like in a small local business in Hawaii. It's casual and a clean looking atmosphere. The variety of appetizer plates you can order besides sushi for the All You Can Eat is great. I kinda wished there were more spicy rolls but the mussels, nigiri, spinach salad, and etc tasted fresh. Service is fine too. I will definitely be back. My favorite sushi places have some competition!

the malasadas with ice cream, whip cream, and guava dizzled on top! I can't believe my roomie only told me about this now. ugh I'm hooked!  Sake bombs with the workers! If you beat them the round is paid by them.  Fun! hahaha

I don't mind the grill side at all. Food is good and staff is friendly. But the sushi side wasn't the best. Our waiter gave us ok service but when he went on lunch the manager, I think her name was Stephanie which wasn't the best at giving us even a good service at that. Her vibe was totally negative and we just wanted out from there.  I think if we ever come back, we will just stick with the grilling side.

Sushi is good but overpriced so stick to all you can eat! Also their poke is amazing.   Their malassadas are so delicious, especially the custard filled one :3   Only negative is how crowded and small the place is. Kind of confusing when ordering and paying too because they have three different sections you can buy food from. You can get meals to go from the front and the back is where they sell poke, and they have a separate room on the right for dining in.

Don't come on a busy brunch day, too busy  This is my new favorite place...AYCE Sushi for $20....WHAAAAT! Ridiculous right? Even I couldn't believe it but it's true, and it comes with dessert. Start off with fresh shoyu poke...then sashimi...then the rolls...then do it all over again until you get kicked out or your stomach explodes haha. Staff us awesome and they now have Poke Express so you can take home fresh poke. Kinda pricey but it's the closest thing to being home away from home.  They got OK pastries and local bentos which is a plus when you want a home-feel. I love this place...AWESOME!

I order delivery. placed my order a little more than 2 hrs ahead. my order was 35 minutes late, food mas cold. my chicken looked like it was last night left over and it was  put back into the oil to warm it up. on the ordering website it say coke bottle and they brought be a fountain cola. Online when you pay it gives you the option to add a tip this doesn't show on the receipt and then the driver it standing there just looking like really no tip.. Makes me wonder if they even see that money.
Great sushi and even better staff! They are so kind and attentive! The music and vibes are just perfect for a great dining experience! This place is for sure a new favorite!!!
Love love love. Special  10 min drive for pickup. Salmon skin salad, Hamachi Kama. Yums

So a friend invited me to island sushi because our favorite place sin  city sushi  had to relocate and is not open yet. I'm always up for giving anyone a second and maybe a third chance so this is my third chance in 11 months. Last time the food was pretty bad the sushi was really bad unfortunately it hasn't improved I think it's gotten worse.  The sushi is really terrible $21 lunch for all you can eat the miso soup is out of the machine or freeze dried a lot of the fish is obviously frozen. The shrimp tempura was greasy. The appetizer was frozen gyoza. The garlic chicken was burnt and greasy like you don't change the oil kind of greasy. I haven't had the take out part but the sit down food is  bad. How anybody gives this place more than two stars must have a low expectation of getting good food for their money.  I try to be fair but damn get your act together.

The place is really tasty and worth going to during happy hour times. Otherwise, I'd say it's price. We spend about $35 dollars for two people to get about 5 rolls and a drink. The rolls are generally simpler because my husband has shellfish allergies, so you'll be spending more if you purchase rolls with shellfish. We enjoy this place, but it can at times be quite dirty due to the high volume of customers. It's important to note that you cannot bring discounted rolls home.

I visited this place three weeks ago with a friend and had their AYCE sushi. I was really surprised at how good their sushi was. Their service was very friendly and the rolls came out really fast. I think this will be one of my favorite places.

I had the displeasure of participating in a six pound Loco Moco eating challenge here on 8/10/17. This event was a freaking joke! We all had 45 minutes to finish and although no one finished, I came the closest eating nonstop until the last five minutes when I hit capacity and had a small reversal. What ended up happening was the restaurant changed the rules during the challenge and kept the new information secret from all the eaters, out of fear everyone would stop eating. The funny thing is the dude they declared the winner aka 'last man standing' had been knocked out cold by the challenge 20 minutes prior to the time expiring. He sat there staring at all six scoops of rice, macaroni salad and malassada unable to continue and ended being declared the winner, all the while it was me who pushed through the pain like a true warrior eating until the point of no return. I finished everything except a couple scoops of rice. Even if they had added what I reversed to my plate and weighed it I still would have slaughtered the losers weight total by close to three pounds if not more and they had the asinine nerve to declare him the winner. I'm the true champion of this challenge and that is a fact that only a fool would dispute.

My 14 year old son is a huge fan of sushi so I decided to bring him here and give this place a try. The food is great and the staff is absolutely fantastic. We sat at the bar and watched as their staff made each order. It was entertaining and as I said earlier, their staff is friendly, attentive, and absolutely fantastic. If I could give it 10 stars I would. The restaurant is clean, welcoming and also welcomes large groups. We will definitely be back and would recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys sushi and Hawaiian cuisine.
Legit Hawaiian kine grindz. We just moved to Vegas from Hawaii and have been searching for a place with good local grindz. This place is awesome!

So after hearing about this place from my best friend's sister who lives in Henderson and from overhearing a couple folks talking about it at a bank off of West Cheyenne, I had to take my family here to try it. I must say we were thoroughly impressed! I'm not a sushi connoisseur by all means but I have had my share of sushi from all around the world within 39 years of my life and this place generated a big smile on my face when I left. Most AYCE sushi joints around Vegas can't compare to the quality and price of this place. The items you can order with the AYCE deal is extraordinary...especially when you can order kal bi and poke. To top it off, my 11 year old daughter and wife were so happy to be here and loved every bite. And finally, I want to say thank you for supporting the military and offering a military discount to our meal!!! There are few minor flaws about this place. 1. I wish the bathrooms were bigger. 2. I wish you guys would turn up the Hawaiian/Island music more. I couldn't hardly hear what was playing. 3. I wish you guys would open up another restaurant in the Centennial Hills area, or somewhere close to there. Thank you Island Sushi team for the superb experience. We'll be visiting again if we're ever on that side of town.

This is the place to go for good sushi!   Great happy hour specials and AYCE.   The sushi is always fresh and delicious. We tend to eat here a lot when craving sushi. You can't beat the half off happy hour.   Plus Hawaiian food for those in your group that don't want sushi. It's a plus of both worlds. I would recommend not ordering the spam musubi though, very dry.

My cousin took us (and about 10 other members of my family) here for dinner.  3 stars for quality of food and additional star for selection of food. We all got the all you can eat sushi, and for 10 fatties, it was a great deal.. 90 minute time limit was more than enough to stuff our faces with sushi.  I have to admit that the Nigiri was totally worth it.. fish to rice ratio was great.  Big pieces of fish with smaller amounts of rice made the hamachi nigiri a go-to favorite of the night.  Another must is the eggplant fries! My boyfriend isn't a sushi fan, but he loved the garlic chicken and the eggplant fries.   Another aspect on their menu is the malasada sundae... and their desserts in general.  A lot of sushi places just have green tea or mochi ice cream as a dessert... Island Sushi has tempura ice cream, brownie sundaes... yum.   I would definitely come back on my next Vegas vacation.

I'm very disappointed since the majority of the reviews of this place are great. I'm thinking maybe employees (or people who know them) are writing reviews on this place. My boyfriend is obsessed with AYCES so we've been to A LOT of places in Vegas. I would like to think I knew what I was talking about. The menu was so small, I couldn't believe it. Especially since so many reviews are saying what a big selection they have. I don't like the fact that they don't have pictures of the rolls on their menu. I would like to see what I'm ordering. I personally don't eat raw fish so I like to order rolls that are baked or fried. Not one single item was like that. The menu does say baked and fried but they just cook the stuff on top so the rice is still cold. My boyfriend loves albacore tuna. We went at lunch time and they didn't have it so we had to pay dinner prices to get what we came for. He didn't like it at all. He said that the fish was room temperature. I thought that the shrimp and the unagi were fishy. The rolls were nothing special at all. I did like the fact that they were relatively bite size. Some places we go to they cut their rolls so big I have to struggle to get the darn thing in my mouth. My biggest complaint, only one desert per person. The whole reason I go to anything all you can eat is so I can get lots of desert. Luckily my boyfriend doesn't eat sweets too much so I got his. I absolutely love mochi but I didn't get any because the only flavors to choose from were strawberry and mango. I'm a vanilla and chocolate kind of girl. Maybe we'll come here for Hawaiian one day but we will definitely NOT be back for sushi.

Review for the grill side only.   I've been eating here for over 6 years now and I still haven't written a review for them?! What is wrong with me? I was first introduced to this place when my old roommate brought home their oxtail soup. Immediately then, I was hooked. I knew from then on, if the oxtail soup was good, everything else would be good.   So one side of the restaurant is a a sit down sushi joint while the other side is a grill making delicious Hawaiian fare. Like I said, I'll be writing about the grill side. They have large portions, enough to have leftovers the next day. Everything is cooked fresh. They have a display of desserts which include malasadas, chantilly cake, guava cake, mochi and other ono Hawaiian desserts. There is also a small poke counter to order freshly prepared fish. I have tried almost everything on the menu, and nothing has disappointed me. I do have my go-to favorites though...  Oxtail Soup: this is my #1 pick when eating here. The broth is rich and deep in flavor. The meat is fall-off-the-bone tender. They give you huge pieces of meat and 2 big scoops of rice. The ginger and garlic are on the side so you are able to customize your broth. Such a filling meal and very satisfying in the winter months.   Ahi Avocado Bowl: When I'm in need of a "skinny-person" meal, this is it. Although it's not really a skinny person meal because the bowl is absolutely huge. The fish is fresh. The avocados and a richness to the fish and rice. The cucumbers add that refreshing crunch. Plus it's extra delish if you add some soy sauce and sriracha on there.   Katsu Chicken: who doesn't love perfectly crunchy katsu?  That's exactly what this is! It's fried fresh. The chicken is juicy but not at all oily.   I can go on and on and name a few more delicious dishes like kalbi beef plate and a bowl of saimin, but I'm don't want to bore you.   Seating is limited, so try to come during non peak meal times or take it to-go. No matter, just come here and get your grub on. I think I'm going to get this for lunch tomorrow!

All Hail Island Sushi! Any qualms I had with this place are nonexistent now. We went really late craving their combo plates ( pick teri beef / chicken etc) but when we got there the server let us know that the grill was closed.( only sushi is served late night) Sadly we went back to our car when he flagged us down and said that they would gladly make the meals for us. It would just require reheating the grills and if we wouldn't mind the wait. DUH! we waited for our yummy serving of Hawaiian-style carne! and it was SooooOOo good and the fact they went the extra mile this time speaks volumes!! MAHALO ISLAND SUSHI!
Love love love this place! Loco moco is the bomb and the sushi is always fresh! Service is great but on weekends it can be pretty packed so be sure to make a reservation

Honestly I walked in and walked right out. The place looked incredibly filthy. There were stains on the floor and tables weren't wiped clean. I'm not a picky person but there are plenty of other places around town that are more inviting.

I normally order a garlic chicken, garlic chicken combination plate with all brown rice.  Their bentos are great too! The garlic ahi tuna with a choice of chicken suits enough for two meals. The garlic chicken is sweeter in comparison to the mochiko chicken.  I do enjoy this place greatly for Hawaiian food, and it is probably the best in Las Vegas. the Plaza location is way better in though as far as consistency goes. I suggest going there if you want a larger variety of food along with tastier flavors.  The sushi here is sub par to the other sushi restaurants in Las Vegas. Definitely come here for the Hawaiian food and the tuna poke bar though (I will review this as well). It is worth a shot!

This is one of the best sushi places I've been to in a long time! I came here with part of my family in a group of about 12 people. Most of us had the AYCE sushi and it was awesome! We were served often and we almost never had to wait for drinks or more food. The recommendations of the waitress were right on and we had some of the best rolls we have ever had. I don't remember all of them( this was a couple of months ago), but I do remember the candy cane and the island roll. Fantastic. Also loved the garlic chicken. Most surprising was the creme brûlée. My mom is a big creme brûlée snob and enjoyed this so much she wouldn't even let me try it! And the atmosphere made me feel like I was back home in Hawaii and that is a big plus! Will be coming back here on every visit to Vegas!

*EDITED* We are regular customers to Island Sushi and Grill.  We have had multiple family events at the AYCE and frequently eat on the Grill side.  Service was excellent and has always made us feel we are important customers, we feel the Aloha. We recently had an issue with an order from the Grill - take out.  The associate assisting us was new to the complaint department. After speaking to Chef Terence, he resolved the issue respectfully. Quickly. Effectively.   We will continue to patronize Island Sushi and Grill, recommend to friends and enjoy all the local food they have to offer.  Thank you for making us Feel the Aloha. We give this restaurant a Four Star Rating Food - 4/5 Service - 4/5 Customer Service Resolutions - 5/5

What AYCE sushi restaurant gives you UNI?  ISLAND.  Definitely a winner here.  The sushi quality is not the best, but it is pretty good.  It gets 5 stars for being one of the best, if not the best, AYCE sushi restaurants out there.

Big portions with alright flavors.  Stopped here before making the drive back to LA. The ambiance is very casual. You order at the counter and find a seat. The food is made to order so it takes a while to get your order.   Food: ordered the katsu and their pork loco moco. The food was good. The pork gravy was yummy but it didn't reach its full potential until it was reheated at home. The katsu was OK. It had more breading than chicken. My friends ordered a beef with sauce which they said was very good. I will try that next time. The food overall is just not comparable to some restaurants in Hawaii but it will do!  Staff: these ladies seemed extremely busy and didn't really smile much. I understand that they have things to do but it felt like I was a bother any time I needed something.  They upcharge 89 cents for teriyaki sauce. They only have soy sauce and ketchup on their condiment bar.  Table and chair seating for maybe 6 people per row. They have a bout 4 rows.  Overall, its a nice casual spot to get your Hawaiian fix but it doesn't necessarily trigger nostalgia that will transport you to hawaii --- the POKE side is great though

Sushi was good and beers are always cold.  Sat at the Sushi bar for a afternoon break from the norm.  The lunch specails are good pricing and the sake made it a perfect.  Tried some new flavored sake which was prety tasty.  Food quality was good, the scene was freindly and staff was more then willing to help out and get refills.  I will be back and will bring some more people with me. will

This is one of those hidden gems. My favorite sushi place. Everything is so fresh and you can definitely taste the difference. I always do the ace. They have an all you can drink add on with beer too. There's always a crowd here. Very casual atmosphere and friendly faces.

Waited 5 minutes after signing myself in to the sushi side (three servers that made eye contact, but didn't acknowledge me) and then a minute standing in front of the cashier on the grill side (two people at the counter without acknowledging).   The decent thing to do is a head nod, "we'll be right with you", or even a smile. None of the above happened. Absolutely unacceptable. Service here is definitely not even close to what it used to be. Not warm and not friendly with any consistency. Last couple times during the day were okay. Still not the same.   Used to come here all the time and raved about this place to everyone I knew. Sadly, this will probably be my last time here. There's too many options close by.

Great food and great service! Been going here since they opened and I've never been disappointed. I've been a loyalty member as well and have redeemed my rewards numerous times. Mac is a server who I've built a rapport with because I go so much and it's nice that he remembers me and the family. So you have good food and great service.

This place rocks! So happy we stumbled upon this place.   I've never seen a restaurant where you sign yourself in when you walk in the door. We came in,  saw a few others doing that so then we signed in.   We were seated in a few minutes and got great service.   We didn't do the all you can eat but we will go back and do that another time.  The sushi was super good.   There's also a to-go section. Many people were coming in and getting their food for take out.  They called it in. I'm glad we found this place!

If you're from Hawaii and it's time to grind, come here!    This was the first place I ate at as soon as I got off the HCG diet.    The bento C is my favorite, but their Crispy Chicken with Oyster sauce special that got my attention.....Oh man, I wish they had a super size of that!     The Teriyaki beef is ono...brahda, everything pretty good here.    Not too much choices if you're on total strict diet, but at least you can get brown rice, and poke.   if you're trying to watch calories.  .  This is a  Hawaiian style restaurant, and short and t-shirt is perfect....you don't have to dress up.

I am so DISAPPOINTED  we come here to eat sushi all the time and last night was the last time we will ever come here. My boyfriend and I both woke up with the worst food poisoning we have ever had! We have been in bed all day. Not too sure if the fish wasn't fresh or what it was but it's not good.

i came here to eat a few times since the review and a lot of my friends told me that this place was good.  First I tried the hawaiian side which was not bad, but it wasn't great.  The Food I must say lacked flavor.  I ate the Mochiko Chicken and the Beef stew and they could use more flavor in the dishes.  It was pretty bland.   A few days later I decided to try the Sushi side and again it wasn't great but not bad.  the Rice was overcooked and they did not use enough sugar in their sushi rice vinegar which made it a little bitter.  and anyone who is a lover of great sushi knows the rice is the most important ingredient to sushi not the fish.  oh by the way the salmon was really bland.    I decided to take home some baked goods home so I can eat it after at home..  I got some Malasadas, a custard pie and guava cake.. I took it home and decided that i couldn't wait and ate them immidiately.  i'm sorry but the malasadas was hard as a rock.  Not fluffy at all.  The custard pie was good except the crust was too salty.  and the cake was good also but the cake part was very dry.    It seems that they do not have any quality check going on at this restaurant.  or they just don't care.

"OnoLiscious!"  Oh my God, when this place first opened it just had the sushi side to it, obviously they are sooo Ono that they opened a fast food side right next to it, with all the Lorcal dishes back home in Hawaii are also offered here, especially the Malasadas....sooo good!  run down:  All you can Eat sushi - So worth it - get the Poki, Lomi Lomi Salmon, garlic chicken , Heck Try all of the pupu side and sushi rolls.   My friend goes there just to eat poki and she orders literally 8 bowls, believe me you'd pay more for just 4 poke bowls normally.  Fast Food side - Bento Boxes are a good deal Saimin is good Malasada's custard filled are Delicious, taste just like Leonards in Hawaii.  Only things that I'm not impressed with is there Eel and Oyakudon bowls, they are soggy and literally when I tried twice to go there and order the Oyakudon (chicken/egg bowl)  they gave me the wrong one and I got stuck with eel.  But to be fair I had a large order both times, so on the 3rd time I just ordered the Oyakudon bowl alone, and I was dissappointed.  I guess I'm used to everything else, which is 98% of the food there 100% onoliscious.  I was hoping their Oyakudon bowl would be like Ichiza's (spring mt), but this dish isn't a staple in Local Hawaiian food, it's more Japanese, so for them just to offer it is remarkable in itself.  Their Guava cake is ono too, but pricey.  Love there breakfast..mmm...mmm...sooo ONO, I'm salivating for my Home food since moving to Denver. :-( can't wait to get back to Vegas.   Oh, forgot to mention the SERVICE is GREAT!  I've been to a lot of all you can eat sushi, actually literally every place in Vegas that has one, and some of the servers get annoyed when we order soo much and they have to keep going back.  I eat like a typical local girl, from a family where we are eating and then talking about what sounds good and what we want to eat later.  lol   Our culture , well atleast my family...We can EAT.  When you get Hawaiians and they have Puerto Rican and all the people who live to eat, you get one Hungry family.   :-)

Came here Sunday afternoon, Chase was our server. He was very friendly and attentive. The hosts that sat us and got us drinks and refills throughout our time there were very friendly and helpful. Sushi was good, we didn't get all you can eat just a few items. Tempura roll, California, bakes scallop and the jalapeño sushimi. We also tried the vegetable tempura.  Baked scallops was basically just a California roll underneath, it was delicious. A lot of food for the two of us. More than enough.   Everything was delicious, we were quite full, didn't have room for dessert. But we'll definitely come back to try some.
Spam musubi bomb , great friendly staff!! Place is always busy food is always fresh. Breakfast, lunch & dinner this place is bomb

Fast and friendly service. Very attentive and the fish quantity is amazing. I have no shame to admit that this is the second day I've had lunch here..this week..in a row.    Only downside about the AYCE is that you can only order half rolls on your last one, but that's fine. Every sushi place has their rules.    Definitely recommend!

Just went down a few stars for me. They started doing their poke differently. There's not even close to the amount of flavor that their older poke had! I'm really big on poke and this place went down a lot for me. Also, during this visit the service wasn't very welcoming. Pretty bummed! But the garlic chicken was good as usual, which is always nice.

Found this place on yelp while looking for sushi in Vegas...sooooo good! They have all day happy hour on mon-Wednesday which is half off all rolls. They also have a legit all you can eat ($22 for lunch $27 for breakfast), but we chose to go a la carte. We ordered 5 rolls, all delicious: tempura roll, spider roll, tekka maki roll, salmon lover roll, and the poke roll. Final cost was $30 with tax and tip for 2 people and I was surely satisfied. The tuna was realllllyyyyy good and all the tempura was super crispy. Service was also awesome! Can't wait to visit again...probably for AYCE! Only bummer is its way off the strip and probably not worth the trek if you are in a strip hotel.
This place is absolutely stupendous. Their fish and ingredients are top quality. They have great happy hour deals where all cut rolls are half off!!! To top it off they have great hospitality.

"Very good sushi!" I'll add this place to my Sushi list. The staff is friendly, welcoming, very helpful & the prices aren't bad either for the all you can eat :-) I'd definitely come back to this place.

Alright, so after months of aniticipation, the family and I finally packed our bags and made the trek to Las Vegas. For the kids, they were excited to see Grandma & Grandpa...as for my wife and I, well, we wanted to stuff our faces.   Sushi Mon has been our spot for years but after some lobbying from my parents, we decided to give Island Sushi a shot... Plus, Sushi Mon can get SOOO crowded and busy sometimes. We ate at Island Sushi for my birthday and again about 3 days later. We were gonna go to Sushi Mon but I thought: "Island Sushi's a Hawaiian sushi joint, so why not patronize my people, right?"   Needless to say, we were not disappointed! First off their Sushi Buffet is cheaper than Sushi Mon. Second, they have that "local" taste. (Hawaiian-mainland transplants know what I talking about) Everything on the menu is O-N-O! Check out the pics I uploaded! Only thing I didn't take a picture of was the Garlic Mochiko chicken...we ate it so fast, I didn't have a chance! My personal favorite was the "Island Special"... Soft shell crab, topped with spicy tuna and eel sauce (sweet, creamy sauce) HO!!! Buss yo' Mowt!!! And it's all you can eat!!! That's just nutz... The owners name is Dean and he's a real cool, down to earth guy. He even brought out our orders when our waitress was busy...   Well, if you're ever in town or you live Vegas and wanna try out a new Sushi Buffet, you gotta check out Island Sushi!

Stopped in for breakfast today and I had the Hawaiian French Toast. Delicious.  My man had the roast pork mini plate and it was very good as well.  Poke Express opened at 9AM and we finished our meal with some great ahi poke.

Worst service here, never coming here again!  I came here last night to order some poke to-go. And from what I witness and experienced, they're really unprofessional. I've eaten here before and the service was excellent then, I don't know what has happened now. I came in and the girl who worked the counter took my order. I stood and waited because everyone else that came in, was dining. Just me and another man were waiting on our order. 20 minutes in neither one of us has gotten our food. I wished that they had a seating area for pickup. But the man got tired of waiting and from what I understand, they messed up and forgot his order, he waited... and he waited too long! So he demanded his money back after he waited an hour! I felt bad for them but understood why he was unhappy. He still had to wait to get his money back, but not in cash! In a gift certificate.. HA! Shows a lot of their character.  Should of been a hint to leave but I still waited and I decided to ask the girl how much longer because people who came in after me got their order and I still had not gotten mines. She responded to me "what did you order?" much to my dismay. She sees me standing there and didn't even bother to ask me anything. If in her mind she didn't remember me ordering, shouldn't she have assisted me to see what I needed? So I told her and then she remembers. She ran back to the kitchen and came to me and apologized and said a couple more minutes. I waited about another 15 minutes and my order still didn't come. And the girl just ignored me. I could have thrown a fit like the guy did but I realized how embarrassed they were after he did that. So I stayed patient. The owner comes to me and asks me again what was I waiting on. Are you kidding me? Did they forget my order again? After I tell them for the second time, I see him going back to scoop up my poke, literally 3 minutes later he finally comes with my order.   I will not be coming back. 40 minutes wait and the poke wasn't bad, but definitely not worth the wait. They need to learn how to run a business and be more punctual.

One day in Vegas me and my girlfriend had this super craving for poke ! We went on yelp and was torn between this other place that was recommended to us and this place, we went with this place due to higher ratings.   The poke bar is all the way at the back and the guy was super nice and friendly. He didn't seem to get impatient as we wanted to sample everything and everything was delicious! He even gave great recommendations and would mix pokes for us.   We also saw that they had sushi so ordered a couple rolls, the sushi is not so great but the poke is to DIE for. You can tell the poke is really fresh.

Good place to drop in for lunch.  Sat at the sushi bar and was in and out in an hour easy.... came in hungry, left really full.  There fish isn't the greatest for AYCE.   And I'm not normally an AYCE fan... but for lunch this place is pretty good.   I'd actually give it 3.5 stars.  Service: 4 stars - people are really nice and my tea and water were never empty  Menu selection: 4 stars - they have everything from sushi to plate lunch  Fish quality: 3 stars - not as flavorful or interesting/unique as other places like Naked Fish  Rolls: good selection but not overly crazy variations... and you can ask to have a roll customized for you  Ginger: 3 stars - I'm a Ginger fan and was a bit disappointed that there's didn't taste as fresh as I was hoping... it was a little tough and didn't have the sweetness and punch combo I like  Restaurant ambiance: 3 stars - nothing special but it's clean and doesn't smell like fish  Bakery section: 4 stars - their desserts always look amazing but I have yet to give in to my desire to eat them  Poke counter: n/a - have not enjoyed the Poke yet so I'm going back later this week to try it  Parking: easy, lot out front is rarely filled  Location: easy to find, faces Eastern just south of the 215, and is in a little strip mall
We come here every time we come to Vegas! Just like being in Hawaii! Food and poke is on point my favorite is the malasadas and the poke! Exactly like Hawaii, which is very rare to find!
The food is amazing. Best sushi place in town!!! Our chef Juan had great customer service he was very knowledgeable and friendly. I'm definitely coming back.
Malasadas. All day every day. Get your life and order a dozen. AYCE is legit too, I can f up the surf and turf roll!!!

So the food was great! And they have other options which is great if you have picky kids/people in your party. HOWEVER.... The service I experienced was not good at all. I had to ask for straws for our table 3 times. We waited maybe 15 minutes for our small desserts. And nobody came by to ask if I needed a refill... which all of us did. He had to try to wave them down as well. There was a male waiter who did a good job though, but he was not even out assigned waiter. We just managed to wave him down, and he finally gave us our straws and got our desserts.   tl;dr+more:  Pros: More options than other sushi places, good food, really good deserts, Sunday brunch specials, cheap.  Cons: VERY poor service, seating is strange, small and feels somewhat cramped, very loud atmosphere/ Hard to talk to others at the table.

I went here solely for the malassadas. I got my malassadas and some butter mochi as well. Made the mistake of getting the chocolate filled malassadas, it had a weird slightly sour taste to it. I also got custard filled, didn't like that either. But I must say, the plain non-filled malassadas was da bomb, reminiscent of Leonard's back home with the yeast flavor. The butter mochi was ok, too oily/buttery for me.

Ate there're twice this past week thinking the 1st visit was just a bad day for them since they could not get  2 bento plate served correctly without missing items.   Yet the 2nd visit for lunch took them 1hr and 15 mins to get a 1 plate lunch and 1 mini plate lunch order correct, which they never need get right. In frustration, we just left with what they gave us.   Not worth even 1 star  Update..... 2/01/2016  called in  2 garlic chicken Mini to go, told 10-15mins. Arrived 16mins paid then waited additional 40 mins. Asked for refund, then told the plates where sitting here next to the dount machine for 30 mins. Never did hear from Terrance, yet noticed the abundance of sign which read" Check your meal before you leave we are not responsible". Apparently, that's the owners efforts to correct the lack of attention his staff has a handling his customers orders. BTW, It took the manager 22mins to refund my credit card. Of course, they offer the food for free and a box of donuts. I declined since the food sat on the counter forever. I told the cashier and manager, I prefer to pay for my food that way the restaurants stay in business. Several of the patrons waiting for there food nodded in agreement to my conversation with the manager.   I asked to have Terrance the owner call me, which he never did. I can't believe this is not an on going problem with Island Sushi, they wasted another 1hour plus of my day

I need to update my review.  Food is still excellent, but having been there 1-2 times per week for the past year, it gets harder more annoying when you realize that certain customers are treated like old friends, and certain customers are treated with complete indifference.  I am fed up with begging for refills, begging for my bill, and being virtually ignored while the manager is chatting up his pals and the wait staff is ignoring me.  If I do ever decide to go back, I will eat at the bar (the ONLY place where you get friendly, fast service), demand my bill immediately and tip the sushi bar workers.  I have always tipped the wait staff over the recommended amount, and still I am treated like a second rate citizen.  It's just not worth it anymore.   Sushi chefs are A+.  The wait staff absolutely ruin this place, and the manager I spoke to does not really seem to care.  Also, having read numerous reviews about the terrible service saddens me that nothing is actually done about it.  Again, I've been going weekly for over a year.  I have never once left thinking "wow, that was great service."  Even when the manager chimes in on Yelp, he offers apology by NOTHING else.    I reiterate:  sit at the sushi bar, immediately ask for your bill, and bring cash so you are not stuck waiting endlessly for the apathetic wait staff.

Zenshin/Island Sushi & Grill catered our wedding Nov 2016. We were drawn to them because of the variety in their menu. From the very first taste tasting, we were blown away at the professionalism and quality of service provided! My spouse and I were coming in from out of state to have our wedding in Las Vegas and had many obstacles, especially finding the perfect caterer, but Zenshin made it an easy choice from the beginning.  The management was extremely personable and detailed in the services they provided. We never felt pressured into anything we did not want and they genuinely made us feel like we were their most important customers. Additionally, there was a vast variety of food on the menu, and every single thing we ordered was delicious! It was hard to narrow down the choices because we wanted everything on the menu after we experienced the taste tasting. On our wedding day, the caterers were all set up and ready to go at our venue when an hour before the wedding started we had to move the reception across town, not only were they flexible, the rushed over to set up at the new location and their execution was FLAWLESS and they did not miss a beat! Everybody loved their food, especially their sushi and desserts! Zenshin saved the day and I would recommend this staff any day of the week!

The place is renovated. I used to like coming here, service was fast and used to accurate with your orders. I had a bad experience a couple months ago for bday dinner. The server was slow, he brought us things we did not order and he didn't bring us items we did order. I decided to give them another chance today and it was a repeat of the same service. I highly recommend not coming here, place looks great but I felt like I spent more time waiting than eating. What sold me away to not coming here was a beetle crawling on the table where we were sitting.

Great restaurant...not a fan of the sushi tho. I'm a huge sushi eater and could try every sushi place in the city if I could. With the number of sushi places around Vegas, this is good, but not my number 1 choice for sushi.   Garlic Chicken and Hamburger Steak is definitely what I go there for! And their Hawaii breakfasts for Portuguese Sausage, Eggs, & Rice...yummm! haha!  Not a Sushi place for big sushi eaters..other than that...it's a taste of 808 in the 702.

What a delightful find off the strip in Las Vegas.  This is a small Hawaiian run sushi joint that offers one of the best all you can eat sushi deals in all of Vegas. I came here for dinner the other night and I was thoroughly impressed with the food and value! There are over 40 items to choose from and all for an affordable 25 bucks. The sushi rolls are made to order and super fresh. He Kalbi short ribs, garlic chicken and gyozas are amazing. Don't forget to order all you can eat dessert as well. My go to is the Malayalam sundae or the tempura fried banana with ice cream. There is an amazing oxtail soup that is separate from the all you can eat menu hat is a must order as well. Come here often with an empty stomach but it won't empty your wallet!

My research on Island Sushi is a bit incomplete.  We came to sit down for plate lunches.  We weren't sure where we were supposed to sit.  Turns out the plate lunches are on one side and the sushi on the other.  I ordered the combo kalbi and kalua pig.  The kalbi was out of this world.  The kalua pig was less impressive, as was the mac salad.  I didn't try any of the poke or sushi, though. And maybe that's were the magic is.  I'd definitely come back, but I'd be savvier about my choices.  Kalbi 4eva.

Today I had a hankering that could only be satisfied by the taste of fresh sushi and after doing my research I found that Sushi Island may hold the answer but boy was I wrong. Once arriving at Island Sushi we waited for 10 minutes to be seated, we finally decided that our best course of action would be  to seat ourselves and only then did we receive acknowledgment from the staff which rudely told us to go back and wait to be seated while they rudely talked amongst each other. I give them a one star because of there horrific service

This is my go to for some fresh island grinds! Loco Moco, Hawaiian plate, and the bentos are my top picks. You can also order out some fresh sushi or eat in if you prefer to. They have all you can eat sushi everyday. Spicy Tuna and (uni) sea urchin are my top picks. Customer service is on point whenever I'm here! Young lady in the front is always very cheerful and recommends faves of customers if you have no clue what to get. Desserts are so (Ono) delicious and my pick is always the malasadas filled with custard. At the poke counter you can find lots of island favorites like the ahi shoyu, tako, raw crab, dried aku, poi, and lots more (pupus) appetizers to please that hungry belly.
