My faves are the limu ahi and the Kim chi raw crab. They are decently priced in my opinion, but others may think otherwise. Im always satisfied!

I'm not into most Hawaiian food, but I could eat here every day for a week without getting tired of it. The half-price happy hour deal looks great, but their rolls are rather small; Fortunately the all-you-can-eat special is very reasonably priced and it covers almost their entire menu.   Their traditional rolls are good, but I recommend branching out and trying the Hawaiian fusion rolls. The Town & Country and Big Island rolls are both phenomenal, and the ahi belly is some of the best i've ever had. For desert, I've enjoyed the 808 special and the malasada sundae and thoroughly enjoyed them both.   I will definitely return!
My boyfriend's and my favorite place to stop by on our way back home from a Vegas trip. Such a good price for all you can eat. The sushi is so good and the portion sizes are perfect
Likes: they get Hanalei poi and poke!  Dislikes: my fried noodles & teri beef wasn't that great.  I'm told the all you can eat buffet/sushi is killas. Maybe next time I visit Vegas I will try em.

Island sushi grill sucks!  They have totally gone downhill this year.  I used to be a big fan of this place, but recently they have just been dissapointing.  Dine in-They burn the food, let alone takes forever for them to cook your food.  They never have malasadas.  They dont get your order right.  They forget simple items that come with your plate.  Pre-order/pick up-They dont tell you that there is certain items are out and they cant make what you ordered till you get there to pick up your food but they try to charge you for it.  Heres a thought call the person back to let them know, you do ask for a telephone number.  They lost all of their good chefs to other locations.  I've given ip on island sushi, this place is not worth it anymore.
Great food but the service sucks. The people are great just constantly under staffed.

Writing this review as I am dining. I have been here for almost and hour doing AYCE, and so far have pretty much been ignored. Not only have I not received the majority of the items I ordered, but have actually received items that we not even ordered. Definitely think the servers need to be more organized and work on their customer service skills.

Love the food and the employees. We come in once a month and get to enjoy some great island food and sushi. The prices are awesome and the staff make it a point to get to know you. Our 12 year old actually put island sushi on his Christmas wishlist. LOL we normally come in for lunch or dinner but had the pleasure to grab breakfast to go one day. The breakfast was awesome. worth stopping in and enjoying. Mon-wed is 50% sushi dine in only. I know they have other deals to check out their site.

Got spicy tuna rolls to go. Rolls fell apart- tuna was mushy and bland. Rice was loose. Eel sauce on the side unexpectedly runny in consistency. Taste wasn't terrible, just anticlimactic. Overall, not worth $20 for two rolls. Where's the good sushi in Henderson?!

This was the best find in all of Vegas!  We will bring our entire basketball team back for many years. They were accommodating, friendly, fast and super fresh sushi.  Everything about this place is great and I will recommend it to all our friends

So I have this thing for AYCE sushi. Sure, the quality isn't is as good as a regular sit-down spot, but I'd rather get my money's worth. And considering it was $24.95, you bet I was gonna stuff myself. All you Henderson residents should be aware that its just down the 215, so there's no need to go deep into Vegas itself for places like this.   The place is rather small, and it was actually kinda packed for a Tuesday night. Thus, the people I went with were not allowed to sit at the bar because that section was already full. Service was pretty good though considering it was busy. Our waitress came by often to get us more water or take more orders for the all-you-can-eat dinner. If I remember it right, sake bomb shots were $2. Keep in mind it comes in a glass with the beer already.   Their salmon nigiri is pretty decent, and I'd usually get that with every order I made. I also enjoyed the yellowtail nigiri because the place I normally go to in the Bay Area doesn't have it. Noteworthy rolls include the Mauna Kea, Mt. Charleston, and the spicy Mexican. Had a rainbow roll as well, but yeah it was just like any subpar rainbow roll. Do yourself a favor and get the tempura ice cream for dessert. It's pretty damn awesome, so save room for that. Yeah. I'd go again, but I'd like to try something else too.
Not to bad for the all you can eat deal  Service was great  Bring a big appetite

We come here often and really like this place. They make some creative and delicious rolls. We recommend sitting at the bar, the sushi chefs always take great care of us. I like the all you can eat and the combo plates. Make sure to try the mochi for dessert and their selection of Japanese wines.

Doing the serious happy dance right now. This is foodie heaven for me. Sunday brunch including breakfast options, AYCE sushi, Hawaiian specialties and Hawaiian desserts. EVERYTHING is ono-licious! Enjoying the  malasadas now.
This is one of the best sushi place in Vegas. Great happy hour & all you can eat prices. My favorite roll is the Island Special. The Poke is bomb also!

I've been coming to this place for awhile now and I think it deserves a review . When you walk in there are three different 'stations' I would say . You got poke express which is a company set aside on its own . Then two more sections that is just island sushi . One side is mainly the fast hawaiian food and one that is more sit down with the AYCE sushi option.   They've got a happy hour I like to go to every Monday - Wednesday all day that is half off select rolls. I love the surf & turf! I can't not come here without eating it . The food is really yummy , however the real let down is how they lack in service . It is just so-so and sometimes irritating. Whenever I come to the sit down section I can always expect service to be slow and mediocre. Usually it takes a long time for them to refill drinks and take your order, esp if your an AYCE . There not rude or anything there just extremely slow , which is why it didn't get 5 stars.   The atmosphere is nice , it clean with two tvs on either side. It also has a sort of mini billboard on at each of the side tables that advertises local businesses .   I LOVE the Togo/fast food side of this place. It's so yummy , everything that I've gotten from there . I especially love the bentos , can never go wrong with those. If your looking to buy poke I suggest going to the poke express counter .   Tada!

I ordered sushi from Island Sushi on Postmates. I wasn't able to do special instructions to the sushi roll i wanted on the app, so i called Island sushi as soon as i completed the order. 1st i was put on hold for a FULL 5min. So i hung up and called back. I told them i wanted to add cream cheese to my roll. She says it was already made and i can't add it. Which i reply, "well if i wasn't put on hold for 5 min, i would of been able to tell you before it was made." So she puts me on hold again. Now some guy answered and tells me the same thing she did. I said "well than it's to be remade". And then he puts me on hold for another FULL 5 mins! Comes back and said "we were able to add it". I thank him and apologize for being difficult (even though i don't think i was). AND THIS IS WHAT THEY DID!! Are you f*cking kidding me?? Never again Island Sushi, NEVER AGAIN!!

Sushi IS my food of choice although I seem to have only reviewed steak houses. I do not live anywhere close to this place but make the drive as much as possible. The rolls are great and if you can handle it after the best happy hour ever, the 808 is the way to go.  The hours are limited tho and closed on Sundays..my only day off.

I remember when this place was koto and the AYCE was some of the best I've ever had. Now it's island sushi. The AYCE is standard fare. Carbon copy of all the other AYCE sushi places in town for the most part. What this place has that others don't is the aloha spirit. The staff is super friendly and very helpful. Never an empty water cup. When I'm here, I feel like I'm at a friends house. Always feel welcomed.

I didn't make the best decision (their Tuesday special of ramen), but still giving it 5 stars because the service and other options are on point. For me, service is key. This team understands that concept. They are extremely friendly and helpful. They enjoy their job and that makes a big difference. Also ordered salmon avocado poke which never disappoints. Always a good choice on this side of town!

I love this place the cafe/grill side of the restaurant is awsome Poke is always good and  affordable my family ordered delivery a few times it was not consistent but when they did something wrong we got some good deserts in return :) dining in is also a different experience the servers are very nice and the food is good my husband checked in on Yelp and we got all you can drink sake for $8 overall a nice place have nothing bad to say great experiences :)

I came here at the recommendation of a friend who knew I moved here from Hawaii. She recommended the all you can eat sushi but we decided not to get that because I couldn't see myself eating that much. My daughter wanted the yaki sobs but it wasn't available because they ran out of the sauce. My boyfriend got the sushi and said it was good. I got the fried noodle combo with mochiko chicken and garlic chicken. The chicken was good even though it was a little over cooked and dry. The fried noodles was the bomb but little on the skimpy side for the price they charged.  I will definitely be back to try the other items on the menu.   The place is kind of small and not a lot of tables are available. I wouldn't recommend going during lunch hour unless you are doing take out.
I love stopping by here after the gym in the morning. My favorite is the kalbi shortribs for breakfast.

This is one of my favorite spots for poke & Hawaiian food. For awhile, I've been looking for taegu that I used to eat as a kid back in Hawaii & this is the only place where I can find it!  I've been to the sushi side a few times (serves AYCE & more of a sit in restaurant), but I prefer the grill side (sit in & to go available). Bentos are served just like how you would get them in Hawaii & a pretty packed plate for the price. There's always poke bowls on the specials list, but when Poke Express is open that's where I usually order from. Spicy Ahi (tuna with masago & mayo) is the BEST! & if you're into octopus.. Tako with limu is my recommendation!  I probably should've written a review a long time ago, but I guess I was just too busy inhaling all my food. :D

I was told by a friend that this place is THE PLACE to go to for loco moco. So why not try it out? There is spacious parking in this lot. Upon entering this establishment, I was a bit confused because there was a hawaiian restaurant in front of me and then a divider on the right which seemed like a sit down sushi restaurant. I guess it was two restaurants in one establishment. Anyways, I came for the loco moco. I ended up ordering the pulled pork loco moco and the chicken katsu. The lady who took our order in the front counter seemed overwhelmed as she was taking customer orders as well as phone orders. It didn't bother me so much that she was working hard, but it's nice to be in the moment with someone you're talking to.  When the food arrived, oh boy did it look good. All in all, it was okay. It didn't really hit the spot as my go-to hawaiian restaurant in LA. It was filling no doubt, but it felt a little bland. It definitely needed salt. The egg on the loco moco was overcooked. I never had pulled pork in my loco moco and I thought it was an interesting meat to add on, but I think the gravy needed to be more flavorful for me to really enjoy the meal.   The Hawaiian side of this restaurant is small with long table seating and maybe 3-4 booths. There are TVs to keep you company while you wait for your food. In all, this place is alright, but I know there are other Hawaiian restaurants in the area that I might want to visit prior to returning here.

Sorry Sushi-Mon on Maryland/ Silverado.. but because you were unable to seat me within 45min, I had to explore other options.  Thank goodness I did!  Sooooo.... if you're going to go the specialty roll route I highly recommend the Island Special.  Uber flavorful and delicious... as full as I was, I ordered a few of these.  The Spicy Mexican was ok too... but I guess it depends on what you're in the mood for.  There is one thing you MUST order... it's the poke.  It's sooooo good, that if you're on the all you can eat menu, you can only order one order per person.  That is definitely saying something.  Something to keep in mind... they have a great happy hour special (9p and beyond!):  50% off all sushi cut rolls + 1/2 off Selected Beers & House Sake - it's an amazing deal!

I've been here a few times and have never checked in.  The food tastes great.  Portion sizes are meh but at least like I said, the food tastes great.  I've had the Teri Beef and the Chicken Katsu.  I like the Teri Beef.  It's tender and very tasty.  I always get the Kalua Pig and Cabbage for my grandma.  They should probably just call it Kalua and leave off "cabbage" because every single time they are chintzy with the cabbage.  I ordered it today with extra cabbage which is .75.  I have no problem paying extra but there wasn't any extra.  They did however, throw in the bottom core part of the cabbage . Thanks y'all.  Stinginess with the cabbage aside, this is a decent place to have some teri beef or Katsu.

Not the best food. The service was good, but the food was just okay. Quality of food has actually declined since they first opened. The baked goods were not fresh. The haupia cake tasted like it was sitting in the fridge for a few extra days. The coca puffs tasted like store bought chocolate pudding filling. Poke lacked the awesome seasoning as other Hawaiian food restaurants in Las Vegas. Probably won't be back for another couple years.

Service was great Food was great Company was great  I haven't been in a sushi mood lately but Shige O. recommended this place awhile back, so he brought me and my friends here. I'm really glad that I gave it a shot. I'm actually craving the sushi as I'm typing this review.  I don't know why but I kinda doubted sushi in Vegas at first but it was pretty good!   Like I said, the service was ultra friendly. Many people are local that works here and I just had a great home vibe. They played local music and all.   I had the garlic ahi, mexican roll and a negi hama. Loved em all! I even tried a bit of their salad with the house dressing, two thumbs up. The water was fresh too (I never got used to chlorine water within the week that i was in Vegas)  They offer a huge variety of fish, and a lotta other stuff too.  I would definitely return to eat here the next time I make a trip to Vegas again.

Breakfast of Champions!!  Brought in my in laws from Singapore. Had  Kimchee Fried Rice Loco Moco  Portuguese Sausage  Malasadas - plain, Haupia (coconut) and Custard  What can I say, never a disappointment.  Winnas as usual. Great start to the day!

Drove here in Henderson at 8:45am from Summerlin and they don't have Malasadas until 9:30. :(  I was gonna share them with my co workers. It's just frustrating and hard that you come here from other side of town and they don't have it ready. Before, whenever I came at 9ish they already have it available. Yes, I know I could have called, but I assume since they opened at 8am??? It should be available by now.   They have very delicious Malasadas... I share them with my friends and family... they all love it.

My favorite  spot anytime I am in Vegas . Variations of pike to order  wasabi, furikake, spicy avocado, kim chee whole crab pieces, octopus, mussels and ao forth. Order by the weight so it gives plenty of options to to try them all. The tuna was fresh and tender and the crab was finger licking good. Definetly a must for sashimi lovers. Offers other Hawaiian dishes for the non seafood lover.

ok so went to Island Sushi last night and ordered a saimin and a mini tonkatsu.  First of all, we were the only ones in there, our order took over 15 minutes to come out, our  tonkatsu came out first and when we opened our plate, there was 5 tiny pieces of tonkatsu.  ARE YOU SERIOUS?  we just sat there staring at the plate saying are you kidding, are they serious?  we asked the worker if this was really the order, she said yes, they give one piece for a mini!  we had to laugh...then our saimin came out and was not even hot, we had to ask them to put it in the microwave.  this place has gone downhill and I guess that's what they do, suck you in with the food and then they rip you off!  We love their food but seriously, what's next?

Read through the reviews, and decided on trying the garlic chicken and deep fried octopus appetizers. Both were good, but the chicken was a standout. It had a nice thin coating, and the garlic sauce was fucking delicious.  The Island Special roll with spicy soft crab and tuna was tasty as well. Our server, and sushi chef were very attentive even though it was busy. Make sure to go during happy hour (Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday) for %50 percent off all rolls, and drink specials. We ordered a bunch of rolls, and apps, but the bill was still below $50. What a deal!

1 star for the poke bar 1 star for the yummy dessert bar  1 star for the all you can eat sushi option   We went in early evening and they had 3 parties ahead of us. 2 tops and we were a 4 top (2 adults and 2 kids). We waited in their front room, the restaurant was behind a lil curtain in its own room. We waited for about 30min. A little too long for only being the 3rd party on the list and with at least 5 open tables in the restaurant. The lady who was sitting people had called another party before us but we stood up and said, we got here before them and we still haven't been seated. She gestured for us to go ahead inside as well. We walked in the restaurant and they had at least 5 tables open.   We did the AYCE and ordered our girls their own individual bowls of rice and a couple appetizers for their dinner. There was a lot of waiting in between, waters not being filled in a timely manner (we had to ask a couple times for refills), and our server forgot one of our orders but made it seem like they were still making it. It was well over 20min and we ordered another roll after the fact and still got that before the first one. Then he charged us for 2 kids AYCE when they didn't even touch any of the rolls, just what we ordered them individually. That was another 5 or so minutes waiting for them to adjust our bill. We spent 2.5hrs at the restaurant. Half the time was us waiting on their service. We ate our food pretty quick, at the most we were eating for an hour. The rest of the time was waiting to be seated, waiting to order after being seated, waiting for the food, waiting for the bill (we had been done for a good 10min and no one had brought us a bill, we had to ask them), and then waiting for them to correct our bill for over billing us.   The food is not that great to be receiving such a service. They look busy, but they just have 2 servers for the whole restaurant. At least that's what I had noticed. Maybe hire a couple more servers and you'd provide faster service instead of guests waiting and waiting. Definitely not going back to the restaurant. There's other AYCE sushi places with better service and better tasting food. I do like their poke bar though, quick and friendly service every time I went there.

I came here for the Hawaiian desserts and AYCE sushi. I have to say I was let down. I had high hopes...The fish was just okay and not worth the price. At $23 per person I expected better quality and bigger pieces of fish. The rolls I tried weren't very tasty either. I was okay with it thinking, I'll get my desserts and couldn't go wrong there right? Wrong again! The butter mochi needed more flavor, coconut milk maybe, the chantilly coco puffs were dry and horrible, tasted like frozen from the box kind, and the chantilly needs more sugar. I also tried the guava cake, again dry and missing the right flavors, my kids wouldn't even eat it! The only thing that was still amazing were their malasadas! Yes, they got that part right! That's unfortunately the only thing I can recommend. I haven't been here in years and it's nowhere near what I remember :(

Very interesting place, it's a sushi and hawaiian restaurant right next to eachother/in the same building.  Luckily I wanted Sushi and the boy wanted Hawaiian so we drove a little out of our way for this place.  First off, let me say that the staff here, even though it seems young, was extremely friendly.  They all stopped what they were doing when we left and said good bye.  That's huge for me, it shows how much they care and I really appreciate that.    The food?  All good.  We got food to go, I got the spicy mexican roll which was a shrimp tempura roll with spicy hamachi on top and jalapenos.  Then I got hamachi sashimi, which, for 5 slices being only $10, was very well priced.  All the fish was fresh, sauces were balanced, it was beautifully displayed.  The boy got the garlic shrimp combo meal and he was very happy.  I wish this place was closer, I would go more often, but we will definitely have to make a trip back soon!
My son just love this place. We are celebrating his Birthday today. And the saketini Yelp promo put it over the top!!
La la lovvvve their malasadas and garlic chicken!!! The one and only place that serves authentic Hawaiian food that actually tastes like it's from home. (aside from the Cal).

My favorite all you can eat sushi joint.  The staff is great and they are family friendly. I love all the spicy rolls.  If I didn't have such an Army to feed (they eat like one too) I'd be here all the time!

Yummy sushi!  We finally found a place to eat sushi in las Vegas - "The Island Sushi and Grill".  It's sooo good and it's all you can eat.  The ahi, tako and crab poke are addicting! The hamachi kama is to die for! All sushi are made to order and the desserts are good.  The malassada sundae is very delish, reminds me of Hawaii....

There is alot going on here, so I can't give a grade for everything, but the lunch I took out recently was pretty poor. Chicken Katsu Curry, was a mess. The rice was improperly cooked, lumpy and overcooked. The curry was bland and only onion, undercooked carrots and no potato. Thoughtful in the way they put the Macaroni salad in a seperate container so it won't get hot, BUT stale, probably a few days old MAC salad?! I never throw away macaroni, but this time it was a no go. Good friendly service, poor to go food quality.  Makes me want to go back to Ted's Bakery in Oahu, they are the BEST!  ----------------------------- I was in on Sept 24th around lunchtime, not sure why you ask when I was in there. If you have good cooks and bad cooks, you should know. Maybe the menu has too much variety to keep fresh? Simple items like Macaroni salad should be rotated to keep a fresh product. I've had food through here for years and it used to be much better. No complaints about Poke Express, they are ONO! It's a gamble going to Aloha grill or the sushi place, sometimes good, sometimes bad. How can you go to a place where it goes both ways? I sent you a message on the website.
If I'm in the area always try to make a pit stop to grab some fresh hotmalasadas and of course poke!! It shows I haven't been here for so long that they have poke bowls. I will be back!!

Came here over the weekend because my fellow 808 friends loves this place and swear that it's as close as it gets to home.  Us Mainlanders now gotta be on the lookout for Hawaii style cooking. :)  So for starters, they have daily specials and I wish it was a WEDNESDAY because they have Meat Jun.  Hopefully it tastes just as good as Dong Yang in my hometown in Wahiawa. Definitely need to make my way out to Vegas during the weekday.   Food:  Tako Poke Shoyu Poke with limu Spicy Ahi poke bowl Friday's special - Lau Lau plate with rice and long rice Fried Noodles with Kalbi And lastly for dessert 1 dozen malasadas  When you first walk in, there are dessert choices on the left hand side.  Also, looks like that's where you can order "to go" items.  Keep walking in and go straight to the POKE station where you'd find lots of different types of POKE.  On the right hand side is the dine in with a sushi bar.    Our server was alright and nothing really stood out.  Our food came quickly and everyone was really nice.  We even met the owner. Aloha!    For the food here's my opinion:  Poke was on point considering that I've had the opportunity to try all different places from San Diego's Best Poke and the infamous Foodland POKE so Island Sushi is good.  The lau lau was dry, unfortunately.  It was overcooked.   Fried Noodles and Kalbi was also good.  The kalbi was on point however the noodles lacked flavor which is fine so I added soy sauce. (I like salty food so that's my fault) Now for the malasadas.  Lots of places claim that they have good malasadas.  I will say that so far on the mainland, Island Sushi & Grill has the best.  We opt for 6 malasadas to eat at the table then took 6 to go.  It was good that I had to return before leaving Vegas for San Diego.  I called in my order and when I got there my order wasn't quite ready.  :( Which is fine so I waited.  The young lady (on a Sunday morning) grabbed a box from the warmer and filled a couple with custard.  This time around the malasadas wasn't as good.  Not sure why, it was also not as hot.  :(  I think I should've ordered when I got there instead. It probably would've been hot.    Aloha and Mahalo Island Sushi & Grill.  Definitely a restaurant I will return to when I'm in Vegas.   #islandgirlnette

We tried Island Sushi a few times when they first opened and they only had a sit down restaurant. Back then they had so-so food (we had ok sushi) and average service. Unfortunately, we weren't that impressed and wrote them off. Then about a year ago a friend said that IS has opened up a grill section on the opposite side of the sit down restaurant with a very different menu filled with local plate lunch favorites. We heard a lot of good things about their plate lunches, so we had to give them a try.  We walked in during a lunch rush and the first thing I noticed is how empty the sushi and sit down area was and how packed the new grill section was.  I looked over the new menu and was impressed. They had everything...breakfast plates, saimin, burgers, bentos, and many of the plate lunches you would eat in Hawaii.  They also had a dessert case with all kinds of sweets...cakes (chantilly, guava, & haupia), mochi, cocoa puffs (don't do it, they are FAR from Liliha Bakery's gems!), and cookies. And they do make malasada's and they are pretty good. We also had AYCE ($20.99/ person) lunch sushi menu which was very good for the price. They also have a Poke Express in the back of the restaurant.  If you are hosting any party, this is where you should get your poke. They have a wide variety of poke dishes, ahi, tako, shoyu, crab, etc.  Our favorites: Garlic or Mochiko chicken Ahi Belly is ono Hamburger steak Bentos for $8 you can't go wrong.  Tako Poke  Love their breakfast menu- Loco Moco with fried rice  Island Sushi Specials: menu Happy Hour 50% off all sushi rolls + drinks specials Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday     All Day   Drink Specials $3.00 Large Beer $2.25 Hot Sake $4.00 Saketini #1.50 Small Beer $2.00 Sake Bomb   Sushi & Pupu (Appetizer) Brunch AYCE sushi plus Hawaiian pupu menu for $20.95 Sundays                    11:30 AM - 3:00 PM   AYCE Lunch & Dinner Lunch-$20.99 Dinner-$24.95  If you had an ok experience with IS, you should give them another shot. I'm glad we did. They stepped up their game and service.   Shaka brah

I would have rated 2 stars, but because of the Sunday Brunch with added pupus/apps, it deserves the 3rd star.   I know it's called Island Sushi, and the owner is from Hawaii, but, I don't care much for the raw fish, sushi, or rolls here. I swear I've tasted much better, fresher fish. in addition, they DROWN their rolls in a watery, too sweet, unagi sauce. (I'm used to the kabayaki unagi sauce, which is dark and rich, and found at most other sushi restaurants here in Vegas,) The only roll that I can remember from here is the Candy Cane Roll, but, still, it's no big thing. But, in any case, I return here with my boyfriend every once in a great while to fill my tummy with pupus/appetizers galore! The selection of appetizers that they offer is VAST in comparison to many other sushi bars ON SUNDAYS. I like the mochiko chicken, eggplant fries, and their tempura sauce! It is sweeter than most places, which i happen to like as well. The Sunday list changes a lot, and it includes mini desserts too. I always get a creme brulee to finish.  The service is decent at best, some waitresses a little friendlier than the others, and the decor, is... well, i don't know how you would call it, but I guess, they're trying too hard for the local island feel. I am definitely not fond of the digital photo frames up next to our table, showcasing various rolls,random groups of people, and, then, seeing it in a never ending loop from the corner of your eye!   In any case, you just might find me there eating a plate lunch on the grill side. ;)

Favorite sushi place here in Las Gaygas! Hubby and I always come for AYCE. Our favorite rolls are the Kahuku, Mapuana, Dragon, 007 and lasagna. They also have a great selection of appetizers including shrimp tempura, kalbi ribs, seaweed salad, cucumber salad, and others. My favorite is the seafood dynamite. It's clams, scallops, and shrimp covered with spicy mayonnaise and onions and baked. Their desserts are also quite tasty. I always order the 808 special. It's a combination of strawberries and bananas fried in tempura batter with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. My hubby ordered the creme brûlée once and it was laughably small, slightly larger than a half dollar coin! Mocha ice cream is also very good.   The only reason I knocked off a star is because of the service. They always take forever to refill drinks and the waitress there is often rude. I understand that it's always busy but crack a smile once in awhile and don't be so short with the customers.

I can't believe that I haven't written a review on this wonderful establishment. Every time I have mainland family visiting, a stop at this restaurant is a must. In Nov 2014, I think I spent over $200 visiting this restaurant because of all the family we had visiting.  I have been coming to this restaurant for the past four years, before I even moved to Vegas. Two reasons why:  1. I'm a noodle head and they have really good fried noodles. Noodles like I used to get from the manapua truck when I was a kid but with more char sui, spam and kamaboko 2. The POKE deli in the back. As far as I know, this is the only restaurant that has this, similar to all the supermarkets from HI. You can sample some of the different pokes they have. You even can choose to get a 1/4 lb of poke. This allows you to get all kinds of poke to taste!  And honestly, I would say that this is the original poke restaurant in Las Vegas. Although poke is the current trend in Las Vegas and all these poke bowl restaurants are opening up. If you want authentic, original Hawaiian style poke, come here. Forget the rice and all the vegetables and load up on poke. Before I forget, the poke counter closes early than the restaurant, at 8pm.  One of my family favorites, malasadas. When you visit this restaurant, be sure to put your order in asap as it does take time to fry up these bad boys. Try the different filled flavors. Be sure you leave room for these delights at the end of your meal as it is best when it is fresh.  And they did renovate the "carry out" portion of the restaurant. When I visited the restaurant last week, my family of 12 got there as soon as they opened up. We were able to take up two rows of tables with plenty of room for other patrons.  Because this is an extremely popular restaurant for the "9th Islanders", it is important that you plan ahead. Lunch, dinner and weekends, this place is poppin'.

Whenever we're in Vegas this is our always our first and last stop. All you can eat sushi oh yea! At first we thought what? Sushi in the middle of the DESERT? no way. Boy were we WRONG! Everything on the menu is good and we will continue to come back. Half off specials is the bomb and if you go during a UH game, they pass out sake bombs. Well, they did when we were there last time. Yesss!!

We wanted to try the oxtail soup but didn't want to wait until 11 PM to eat at the California hotel.  We ordered some poke and katsu along with the oxtail soup.  You order at the counter first and they will bring your meal to the table.  We went during dinner time and there was 10 people already in line.  There's a sushi only section on the other side of this restaurant.  Crowds of people always stand in line to eat here.  We will have to go back and try their sushi next time.    The oxtail soup has a different tasting broth.  It's more like an udon tasting broth which we found to be very interesting.  The oxtail meat was very fatty which also made the broth quite oily.  My meat had A lot of fat attached versus what I would get at the California hotel.  Quality was lacking but it was good enough for us to eat for dinner at a reasonable time.    The chicken Kutsu was prepared just right and I am enjoyed eating this more than the ox tail soup.  The poke was good for what you'd get in Vegas where it is nowhere close to an ocean!  My mother-in-law got the garlic chicken and that was very flavorful!  Overall I would come here again when I'm visiting Vegas.  Good comfort food but avoid prime dinner hours!

I love this place. It is always busy. Sushi is fresh and the rice is just enough. So you can eat more sushi. The desserts are well crafted and tastes good too. It's decor is very simple and functional. I like that it is open late too. My favorites  are uni, Hamachi kama, and amaebi. .

I love this place!  The all you can eat sushi deal for dinner is absolutely worth it.  The grill is very tasty, from the bbq short ribs to the garlic chicken to the fried noodles.  They also have a fresh selection for ahi tuna in the deli section, variety of flavored marinades.  The customer service is also great!  Once I had ordered something new to me, and it was just too salty for my taste and without any hesitation they replaced it!  Thanks

For a late night snack this place was pretty good.   50% off sushi rolls during happy hours.  Staff was friendly, service was good and fast.  Lots of rolls to choose from.  They also have an A.Y.C.E. if you're really hungry.  I'd definitely go again.
All you can eat on Sunday is the bomb!  Great service, Good drinks, and fun atmosphere.  I recommend to anyone who wants to have a great experience and great for groups!

Island Sushi is our go-to place for sushi. Eastern Ave. has at least a dozen decent sushi places, but we won't go to any other after coming here. We love the Island-friendly attitude. It's fun to come here. Today I discovered that I was the only customer not wearing flip flops. The service is great; everyone there works hard, but Mac and Chuy are always at their best. Monday is Happy Hour all day and rolls are half price. 5 rolls, one big Sapporo and a couple of malasadas are a great meal  for 2 and won't put a hole in your wallet. All of the rolls are great; just tried the Spicy Mexican and Kilauea and loved them both! We'll be back.

I have nothing bad to say about this place. Service is on point and staff is extremely friendly. Hubby and i usually don't like to do ayce because everyplace we tried have been a disappointment with the quality of fish. This location is now a favorite spot for us, we will be back!!!! A big thumbs up from me.

First time eating here.  Decided to try it out based on a pretty good yelp rating and seeing all the food on IG. Service was awesome.  The counter help and the Poke guy in the back helped us out and answered our questions with a smile.  Ordered our food and it came out in a timely manner.  I ordered the Fried  Noodle Combo with Mochiko Chicken.  The chicken was crispy, juicy, and flavorful.  The rice, noodles, and Mac salad was less desirable.  The rice was hard, noodles were soggy and wasn't seasoned, and the macaroni in the mac salad had a weird texture.  My son had the corned beef hash breakfast.  He loved it except for the rice.  Same situation as my plate, the rice was hard.  My wife and daughter ordered Poke bowls.  The presentation was nice.  My wife enjoyed the sushi rice, my daughter not so much.  Poke had good flavor and the sides were good too.  Fresh and crisp Pickled cucumber and Crispy Taro chips.  The portions of the actual poke itself was disappointing.  It was about 2 teaspoons of fish.  We probably will order it by the pound next time.  We also ordered a dozen Malasada's.  6 haupia and 6 chocolate.  These Buggahz was MEEEEEAAAN!  No complaints here.  Aloha....

Got the Mix plate with teri beef, teri chicken, kal bi, white rice and mac salad. Topped it off with some fresh ahi shoyu poke and a malasada. One of the best teriyaki sauces I have ever had! I grew up in HI and the quality here is the same if not better!

Amazing Hawaiian food by Henderson.  There are 3 parts to this restaurant.  The Hawaiian Express, Poke Express and Sushi bar/restaurant.  I've never eatten at the Sushi restaurant, only at the Hawaiian food and Poke Express.  The Poke is really awesome.  If you like Tagu, it is sweet and chewy and very authentic.  The shou Poke and spicy poke is great also.  If you are a poke fan, do try Poke Express.  I usually get the Bento Box A with Garlic Chicken.  It is a huge meal with rice, Teri beef, garlic chicken, spam and noodles.  Very flavorful and filling.  My wife gets the tuna bowl.  That is huge also.  Great flavors with the tuna and rice.  They have Oxtail soup on Saturdays all day and after 600pm other days.  I like this and it's very authentic.  You combine the rice and ginger and green onions and you have a cornucopia of flavors and textures in that oxtail soup.  It has been the best I could find so far in Las Vegas.  I would pass on the Saiman.  The noodles are good, but the broth is not as flavorful as the other places I've tried in LV.    Overall, the go-to spot for Hawaiian food this side of town.

Went here last night for the All You Can Eat (AYCE) sushi dinner and I have to say that this was once of the better places I have been to in terms of the quality of sushi. I'd say probably in the top 3. The dinner is almost $30, but you do get a wider selection of choices known as the "dinner selection items" which are not available during lunch. Also items marked with a hashtag have a one item per person restriction.   I got about 25 items and I recommend getting the crunch and black widow roll. The eel, ebi, and salmon nigiri was really good too. The hot lava roll was not good at all because it didn't have much taste besides spiciness and the inside of the roll had a red paste texture.   Another highlight was each person gets up to two dessert items which was a first for me at an AYCE sushi. Be sure to try the green tea ice cream (strong green tea taste) and the malasada sundae! Malasada is kinda like a Hawaiian donut that reminds me of a cross between a donut and churro. The tempura ice cream was okay because they only have vanilla ice cream and the fried shell was kinda soggy.  Overall, the experience was very nice and I would go back here again. The only downer about this place is the appearance. When you first walk in it looks like a small bakery place with the main dining area on the right side. It has a hole in the wall sort of feel which is okay, but the other AYCE places I have been to have a more classy atmosphere and they even had lower prices haha. Either way the most important thing is the food right? Definitely give this place a try if you are craving sushi with a good selection of appetizers, side dishes, and desserts.

Not bad food, but a little confused. Got the combo plate with the Terri beef and garlic chicken. Did not get any extra sauce other than soy. Mac salad was warm, dry and had mashed potatoes in it. Never had island style mac salad with mashed potatoes in it. The Terri beef was good, but was not terri sauce not sweet at all. Portions were good and I would go back to give it a second chance.

If i am in a roll mood, I go to Island Sushi hands down.  This was one of the first sushi places I ever went to and it has spoiled me to any other restaurant.   Island Sushi sets the bar for ayce sushi and each roll is so good.  They also have unique appetizers that are not in any other sushi place.  The customer service is awesome, and the environment is very comfortable.

After reading many reviews, I decided to try this place...and so glad I did.  Not only was service was great, but the food was so awesome as well.  We got there for lunch, but decided to do the dinner ayce instead.  4 bucks more and you get uni, amaebe, and so much more... what an awesome deal!  Like other reviewers had mentioned, they don't try to fill you up with rice.  The nigiri was definitely awesome, with the fish totally covered the small pile of rice.  You definitely get your money worth!  The hamachi kama was really awesome.  My bf, who does not eat ayce (strictly sashimi only), thought this place was great.

Me and my boyfriend consider ourselves regulars here. We have our favorite rolls and everything. The Mexican Roll is my favorite and 007 is my boyfriends favorite. They have the best quality for the awesome deal you get. Best advice is to go during happy hour. I would say the ONLY reason I don't give it 5 stars is because the service there isn't the best. They definitely need to work on their customer service. Overall top 3 sushi places we've been too :)
Wow wow wow ! If I could give more than 5 stars I would ! Amazing sushi ! Great costomer service ! And a cozy environment , best sushi place I have been to in Vegas so far

This place has 3 sections; Hawaiian grill, poke and sushi. Last night I tried the grill section; the place packed when I came in. Almost everybody getting to go order. The place is really small so I prefer to eat at home. We tried; classic loco moco, mochiko chicken and teri chicken, all really good and very flavorful. We also get some filled malasada; the filling is pudding but all good. My kids said they like malasada better than regular American donut; they never had one before. We all really happy with everything we ordered. They also have lots of classic Hawaiian desserts.  Next time I wanna try their sushi.

Amazing!   We found this sushi bar on Yelp! while vacationing from So. Cal. Back home we've had a lot of AYCE and let me tell you- this was the best! We'll totally be back the next time we're in town.

Used bite squad tonight and ordered a couple rolls and a cucumber salad. Their menu has a wide variety of Hawaiian, American and Japanese food. I was surprised at how low the prices were.   The 007 was delicious! The fish all tasted fresh and they threw in a side of eel sauce for me without me even requesting it. I also ordered the Spicy Tuna roll and although it wasn't spicy enough for me, it was still tasty.   They put the dressing on the side for the cucumber salad so I didn't have to worry about the cucs being soggy. Overall, I was pleased. I'll have to try out the restaurant next time, I hear they have amazing desserts!

There is the "sit down, get served" kine, and there is the "lunch stand" kine. I just went to the lunch stand part.. I went to the very back to get my quarter pound of spicy avocado poke, then I went to the register to order musubi. :) In the future I will go to the sushi bar area and check that out. Otherwise, I love it I love it I love it. Broke da mouf, fo' sho'!

Ok. Can't be nice right now. Very bad representation of this restaurant. And come on guys, I recommend that everyone eats here. I am obsessed with your restaurant. But today my friend Lisa and I had the displeasure of being served by Mila and I have to say something about it. We were coming to get some sushi. Decided to do all you can eat and heard about all you can drink for $10. Awesome deal. We are both full time business women and wanted to unwind with a few beers and some good food. Mila explained that it's $10 all you can eat sake and beer. Cool. Then she later corrected that they are individual charges. We said fine, Lisa would get the beer and I'd get the sake. We could have it all! Mila corrected us, which was fine. That's her job. But being in the customer service industry, I welcome all feedback and use it as growth to improve every customers time in my store, and decided to tell Mila that I would appreciate if she could just give the feedback to the restaurant management that I feel it should be interchangeable. Just like getting all you can eat and sharing the rolls, getting all you can drink should follow the same structure. * if both parties are paying, then why not?*   She seemed to think my feedback was more funny than valuable, and proceeded to point at a table in the corner and say "well they are all sitting over there, so-" as if I wanted to stop my lunch to go relay the message.   All she would have have to do is say "thank you for that feedback, I will make sure they hear it".   From then on I just began to lose my desire to be there. Listen, all you can drink is a great idea, in an atmosphere where you facilitate an environment where people feel valued and welcomed. Mila sadly had a poor attitude the rest of our visit and did very routine "check ins" but obviously was following a script vs. any kind of genuine interest in our satisfaction as customers.   We were the only ones there too, and Mila kept going to the other table (the table full of the owners and managers) it made us feel like we were being talked about and it created less of a welcoming atmosphere. Remember, perception is reality. So be aware of your customers.   I'm so bummed about this experience. It was my friends first time here and I feel she had a very bad impression of what this restaurant stands for. Sure makes me think twice about coming here. The prices are the same anywhere, I come here equally because the food kicks ass, but mostly because of the environment and the amazing customer service. Well, this is not what I spent my money on today.

As an island girl it's nice to have a place to pick up local style goodies!!! I get malasadas from here sometimes & even all of my friends who are not from Hawaii love it when I bring these by. I'm not super into the chocolate but the custard, haupia, & guava (my fave) are super ono. I'm a fan.

So I've never had AYCE at Island sushi until this past weekend. I have to say I thought the food was ok. It wasn't anything that would make me want to take people to. The rolls were ok. The uni was good. The service was good. I just don't think that it was worth the price for the food. If your into Hawaiian infused sushi this place is for you but I will stick to my fave spots. The poke here is very good just expensive.... it's more worth it for me to go buy fish & make it myself. All in all it was ok but I will NOT be returning here for sushi when there are far better places, better priced.

Came here for Sunday Brunch and it was packed because it was Mother's Day, and the only available seats were at the bar, so we were sat up there. This is another place that feels like home and the staff are always friendly and welcoming  I will be totally honest and say that I prefer sticking to the Sunday Brunch offerings and not so much their AYCE Sushi items. Flat out, the quality is just not as fresh as it should be, and I could really tell the difference as I have consumed a few thousand pieces here in Vegas alone.(True story!!!) That first order of nigiri was our last, and I just told the Chef that we were sticking to the brunch stuff.  He didn't seem too enthused about it, but hey, I ain't taking that kind of risk. I can't believe others at the bar eating sushi didn't detect that pretty sketchy quality. Anyway, back to the brunch items. We killed a good number of items from the whole list of offerings, like  Island Sushi Roll 008 Roll Red Velvet Pancakes X4 Hawaiian Sweet Bread French Toast X2 Egg in a Basket with Bacon Kim Chee Clam Dip with Malassada Chips Tempura Green Beans with Wasabi Nori Ranch Cold Ginger Chicken with Cilantro Pesto Chicken Curry Salad on malassada Chip Kim Chee and Lup Cheong Fried Rice Grilled Mongolian Beef Tips Crispy Pork Belly Bun Green Tea Tiramisu Vanilla Creme Brulee Cocoa Puff Malassada with Passionfruit Cream Cucumber and Melon Granita  All plates are tapas portions, and you can order as little or as many as you like. Sadly, the Cocoa Puff and Malassada kina come up short and I goitta wait to go home for the real deal at Leonard's and Liliha....ALOHA!!!  YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(261/365) "Sunday Brunch Bash"

This is the best sushi joint on planet Earth! They have an all you can eat menu for only $24.99. When we walked in, we thought we might be in the wrong place because the front door leads you to the take out counter for Hawaiian food. However, the sushi joint is connected.   During our order, my wife asked if they had any rolls that had sliced strawberries. Unfortunately, they didn't. However, the owner and sushi chef overheard the request and created a roll on the spot that had strawberries. That alone might warrant the 5-star rating, however, the service overall was fantastic as was the AYCE sushi.   The Nigiri sushi is a little smaller than what you normally get at a standard sushi bar, but it doesn't matter when its all you can eat!! The fusion of sushi and Hawaiian cuisine was a little intimidating at first, but after the first bite, it all made sense.  We are tourists and decided to try a local place and we are glad we did. I will visit Island Sushi every time I go to Vegas!
great sushi especially at happy hour prices. bite into a spam musubi and makes you feel like bj penn is doing a duet with iz that big guy with the little ukulele.

Last night my wife ordered take out their Chicken Eggplant and I was really surprised that they would have the nerve to serve that item using old dried out chicken!  The chicken that was used I believe was left over Mochiko chicken from days ago that was very hard and dried out.  Lots of the pieces was all black on the outside.  Very disappointed!  When I first opened the plate box, you could see the chicken was all old and dried looking but I decided to not pre-judge before tasting but my first impression was confirmed when I first sticked my fork in the chicken.  Very tough!  Even with a knife it was still tough.    Overall the quality is a hit and miss.  I recommend if ordering take out, please take the time to open the box and see what your order looks like so you can at least make your comments while you are still there.

Easily one of my top Sushi Restaurants in the Las Vegas/Henderson Area.   The rolls are exceptional. Remember these Rolls.  Candy Cane, Meat Lovers Roll. Black Widow, Kilauea.  The Meat Lovers Roll is a Carnivores dream made reality. Fish and beef. Beautiful.  This place is literally a one stop for all your Hawaiian Food needs. Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. Its all here, and its all good. I have love for their Fried Rice Omelet. I believe this is an appropriate time to give it honorable mention, as a delicious yet simple breakfast item. Add an extra egg and you have cheap solid nutrition!
I love coming here since it's so close to my house. Friendly customer service and very clean. Gotta try their malasadas which is probably the best I've ever had.

06.14.2014  The plan was H & O will share a chicken katsu lunch and me and hubby will share a Bento Lunch A (teriyaki beef & teriyaki chicken).   We all shared both but ate all the katsu lunch. We had leftover teriyaki chicken, beef and rice, which will probably be a snack for hubby later after his nap.   PROS: -Food cooked fresh -The teriyaki chicken was delish!  Next time hubby wants just teriyaki chicken. :) -I loved the Furikake rice in the bento box!    CONS: -Long wait to get food (that's what happens when you show up right at lunch time 12:00pm) -I wasn't too fond of the Mac salad--too dry, not seasoned well. Tasted like it was made a few days earlier and just stored in the fridge.  -ran out of some poke I wanted to try   Eating here sure beats hubby's suggestion of P.F. Chang's for lunch.  Thanks fellow Yelpers!  I guess we'll have to come back for malasadas and salmon poke next time. :). Like tomorrow?  LOL!

We came in on purpose on a Monday, bc its happy hour all day - 1/2 price rolls!! Its our 1st time here, and we REALLY don't like going to new sushi places bc we are pretty picky when it comes to sushi, but our usual sushi spot is very pricey and we are on a budget these days :p we ordered 5 rolls btwn the two of us and the sushi came out really fast, and it was very good for the prices! we paid an avg of $7 per roll, they were fresh and presentation was good... A little on the plain side, but we asked for some ponzu, screaming o sauce and siracha sauce and fixed em up a little the way we like them!  What won us over was the friendly and attentive service we got from the servers!! They were great !We will definitely be back!!

This is as good as it gets for me when I'm craving "home" food.  Garlic chicken. Hamburger steak. Oxtail. Kalua pig. Poke. Fried noodles. Musubis. Spam. Sushi.  *sigh* I MISS HAWAII FOOD *sigh*  Anywhoo... Their late night specials of half off sushi and sake is just what the Hawaiian ordered.   The workers know some of my friends by name; it's like home. And they have sake bomb challenges with the workers. If you can out sake-bomb them, you drink all night sake-bombs for free.  Island Sushi and Grill: SAMPS THAT!!!

Overall, this is a unique sushi experience because of the way it blends Hawaiian and Japanese flavors. It's very creative and I plan to return, maybe during happy hour.   Favorite rolls off of the all-you-can-eat menu: Big Island  Island Special Black Widow  I wasn't a fan of the Surf and Turf, the roll with beef teriyaki outside/shrimp tempura inside. Just didn't like that mix of flavors but other people in my party did.   Had I done my homework, I would have tried the fried octopus and the spam sushi roll. How could I have Hawaiian food without Spam?   The Ahi belly was tasty. We ordered four of those, one for each of us. Even after 10 rolls, several appetizers, many plates of sushi, I polished off the Marssala dessert without even talking. I totally felt like a pig. I was a pig.  I heard Island Sushi has an awesome brunch. Can't wait to try it. I would rank this place higher than Sushi Mon, for sure.  There was no wait to get in, the service is better, and I think the rolls are more creative. I can't compare it to I Love or Momo (apples and oranges).

HORRIBLE SERVICE.  My group waited 10 minutes to get seated when there empty tables available and the three servers walking around got the orders from everyone around us and didn't bother to ask if we wanted to order anything.  When they finally did, it took them near 20 minutes to get our first sushi orders to us.  I'm no sushi chef and I understand the restaurant gets a bit busy, but when all three servers are busy chatting away with everyone else and forgets to bring you the order you've been waiting for, 20 minutes is quite a long time to be waiting for a few sushi rolls.  Plus, the sushi rolls weren't even cut correctly and fell apart in a mess when we tried to eat the sushi.  After the first round of sushi, they asked once if we needed more sushi (and we said yes due to the pending 8 more sushi we ordered) and despite our long list of ordered sushi, it took about 30 minutes for one of the servers to come by and take our order again.  By this time I had lost my appetite and decided to pay the bill before I became even more pissed off due to their incompetence.  I'm from Hawai'i and when I saw 'Island Sushi' decided to stop in and check this place out, I really thought I would get that local island hospitality.  The only hospitality I got was "Oh, sorry ah" when they realized they forgot our table orders half and hour later.  Bad service and I definitely recommend this place if you're into spending your hard earned cash by sitting around and looking at other people eat.

Their service is terrible!!!! Here for an hour and our server passed us over and over. Other tables that came in after had their food before my order was even taken. Then all I ordered was sushi and it took another 30 min. This is redicilous!!!!!!! Food is good, but don't come here hungry.

I  had to wait to long to be seated with no greeting. When seated it took to long for the waiter to take my order. The sushi and dessert was good. Not as good as the old Plaza location. Price was fair. Will not be visiting again; not worth the drive.

I'm not sure if we overwhelmed this place with a party of 10, or if someone was off that night, but I wasn't impressed with the sushi or the service.    Yes, they have a hawaiian slant to their preparation, and everything tastes okay.  But none of the fish was spectacular, fresh, or well-cut.    Most of the rolls had tons of sauce on top that overpowered the flavor.  The amaebi was not good, and the heads were overfried.    One issue which bugged all of us - the servers kept reminding us that we had to eat everything we ordered...and the sushi came out very slowly.  I wonder if they did that on purpose.    Anyways, right as we were paying the bill the whole restaurant filled with a strong scent of smoke.  We asked the waitress - she laughed and said the chef burnt a bunch of eel in the kitchen.    On the bright side, you don't have to wait an hour for a table like at Sushimon.  But maybe there's a reason for that.  This place would be two stars if it was in California, but being an all you can eat sushi restaurant in a landlocked state, I'll give them three.

best AYCE sushi!!! seriously this is one of the reason why i come to vegas. the quality is pretty good and they have very good sides as well! fried oysters, seaweed salad, teriyaki, etc. they also have many rolls to choose from too! very worth it!!! they also have ahi poke!!

First time here. I went because it was highly rated on Yelp. Did not even think about all you can eat but my guest suggested it. The fried oysters were amazing. Was kind of blown away just about everything on the menu was available for all you can eat. Only had one issue. I ordered the salmon "Sake" sushi a number of times and it was never delivered even after I told two servers it was never delivered. Seems like a small thing, but that's my fave.

Came with the whole family to eat here for AYCE sushi lunch on Sunday afternoon and to my surprise with no wait..   I like how you can get AYCE sitting at a table & not only at the bar like how most Cali sushi places are.. super plus!  And unlike most AYCE sushi places in California (specifically the valley area) the food here was great and is sooo much better than the sushi i'm used to.   I liked how there was 3 pgs of food (basically everything) from the menu to choose from on the AYCE.. plus being Sunday there was a "brunch" option that included a few Hawaiian breakfast and special sushi options.  Try the Lechon from that menu!! It was f*cking delish, chopped crunchy pieces of pork with a vinegarry-soy sauce and pieces of onion and tomatoes, we had to order it 3 times it was so good! We really loved the yellowtail sushi, Salmon Sushi w/ Orgasm sauce, Kona roll, and especially loved that we got to try the Poke on the AYCE menu (limit 1 order each).  There was this roll with a sliver of jalapeno on top and sriracha that was freakin the best.. just can't remember the name of it.   Service-wise they were all awesome.. perhaps it was because we were a party of 7  and for groups of 5+ there's an automatic service charge of 18% so be advised of that.. but honestly they deserved it because they were so friendly and on it with the refills of drinks and the plates came out to us fast AF.  I love that sh*t, thank you! Will have to come here every time i'm in Vegas from now on.

Very, very, very good service!!! Excellent AYCE menu. Went in on a Friday night at 8pm, place was busy, but my bff and I were seated right away. I love when we don't have to ask for our water refills. I ordered everything your only allowed to get once but it was sooooo good. Rolls and nigiri were awesome. Will definitely be back again.
Great food great service I always try to come and eat here at least once a month! The fish is fresh and chicken teriyaki is great! Reasonably priced.  A local Hawaiian hang out!

So my review is based upon some malasadas that the hubby brought home from  Vegas.  What are Malasadas say you? Malasada is a Portuguese type donut.  Malasadas are made of egg-sized balls of yeast dough that are deep-fried in oil and coated with granulated sugar. They are popular in Hawaii and since Las Vegas is considered the "9th Island" you can definitely find them in Vegas...  I was craving the famous Leonard's malasadas found in Oahu, so when my husband visited the in-laws in Vegas, I asked him to find some of these yummy treats and bring some back home to the Bay Area.  My only concern was the fear of being disappointed by what he brings back... boy was I happy!  He came back with some haupia filled Malasadas that felt like it weighed half a pound each.  Haupia is a type of coconut custard, and it was perfect inside these warm slightly crispy Malasadas.  The custard was not too sweet, therefore, i scarfed down like 4 of them... *oops!* **blush**was I supposed to save some for the kids? Overall, they are still not as good as Leonard's but they definitely "fit the bill" when it came to cravings..  I cannot wait to try the rest of the food here in person.  BOOKMARK!

Wife and I have been coming here for the last four years. When we're in the area for lunch or if we aren't in the mood for cooking dinner and one of us is passing by after work we'll call in a Bento A and Bento C. We really like the garlic chicken. Unfortunately, we haven't tried anything else there because we like the Bento's so much. The price for the two bento's is reasonable to us. It can get pretty busy around lunch time so it wouldn't hurt to call it in if you're in a rush.

This place is soo not the business anymore.  Quality if food has dropped tremendously and I don't even know how they serve the food they did tonight.  First of all my RICE came out cold, how does rice come out cold like what the??? The garlic chicken has changed it doesn't taste like how it used to, the pole and fish side is totally different too the taste has dropped dramatically.  I'm sticking to pole express! Hopefully they get better and not worse because by the taste it has gotten WAY worse!

Latest visit VERY disappointing! $21.95 for lunch, and $26.95 for dinner weekdays. Again no Uni, or sweet shrimp at lunch. Also, sashimi salad and crab salad only available for the dinner price. The other sushi joints near the strip charges the lunch price and provides all of those.   Ordered a bunch of sushi: albacore, tuna, white tuna etc. The fish was a teeny tiny very thin slice of fish on a very large piece of cold, hard rice. I had trouble swallowing the sushi. The quality of fish was ok. I got the dinner price and ordered the crab salad and the sashimi salad, compared to some of the other AYCE sushi joints, the sashimi salad is tiny, and only had very few pieces of fish. Really disappointing quality compared to the other places. Also, I ordered the sweet shrimp which only came with 1 piece, other sushi places gives 2 pieces and charges less.   The service was good, sushi chef was nice, BUT I was charged extra for hot tea! Many sushi joints gives complimentary hot tea. Really disappointing and will not come back anymore.

Great service and even better food. We are from out of town but everytime we come to Vegas we have to come here. Great Local food and even better, there is a full Poke bar. I suggest trying the malasadas if you've never had, but anything off the menu is Ono!
By far my favorite sushi restaurant in Las Vegas!  Chuy and Jayson are the best sushi chefs.  They know what I want before I even order!

If you're a fan of Hawaiian food and Sushi, this is the perfect place for you.  We went there when they were doing Happy Hour, so some of the makis were 50% off. Yay! The makis tasted really great. The quantity was good too. We were so stuffed only after 3 maki sets + poke.   Since we seated at counter, the sushi chefs occasionally asked us if we needed anything which was nice. They recommended me malasadas, so I ordered 3 regular ones and 3 coconut ones. OMG The malasadas were so amazing! I especially liked the coconut ones. They are only 89 cents per piece and I think they had other flavors too.   We'll be back there soon to try their AYCE.

They were very friendly the only problem I had was that I wasn't greeted or acknowledged, I understand it can get busy but I feel that as a paying customer we deserve to be acknowledged, this is why I'm giving 3 stars, although they made up for it with a friendly smile and was told to have a nice day at the the end of my visit. The decor and ambiance could also be updated, it looks a little run down. I come here only if I'm only on this side of town and if there's nothing else that appeals to me. At the end of it all I feel that their food and portions is always good here which is why I continue to return.

A good friend of mine had been raving about this place for a long time, and we finally took a trip down from Salt Lake City in large part to eat here. He swore that he had done his best to oversell the place not just to us, but to many other people, and that nobody had ever been disappointed. Well...he was right. This place is amazing!  Normally, all you can eat sushi is more a matter of finding a place with decent sushi rather than anything great. But Island Sushi is simply fantastic. From the service to the food, I can't believe how good it was!  I'll admit, pulling up to this place, I was somewhat skeptical. It was pretty dark from the outside and didn't even really appear to be open. Even after coming inside, the initial welcome room was dark and pretty void of people. But once we got into the main eating area, it was on!  I knew that we were in for a treat when the sashimi salad and poke bowl came out. I could have eaten nothing but those two and been extremely happy. But my friend was ordering all of his favorites, and we ate all of them happily. The nigiri was perfect--a better ratio of fish to rice than most places. The cooked dishes we had, including soft-shelled crab, tempura shrimp, and beef of a couple of different varieties (one of which was right at the top of the best dishes there) were all perfectly cooked. I probably could have made a meal out of any individual dish I was served, so to have so many different delicious items made for a great experience. Dessert was pretty decent, too. You get your choice of 2 desserts (because you need 2 desserts after all you can eat sushi!), and they're all pretty interesting. There were 2 dishes involving bananas; any place that offers banana desserts gets points in my book.  The service was fantastic. I'm used to waiting long periods of time at any sushi restaurant, much less an all you can eat sushi restaurant, for each round of orders. But Island Sushi was bringing out dishes left and right, as they were prepared. We had a constant stream of food and were never left waiting. Excellent, friendly service!  And price-wise, this place is great. It's only around $25 for all you can eat (although they do limit the quantity of certain dishes that you can order).  Next time I'm in Vegas, I'm definitely coming back to Island Sushi!

I hope that anyone that reads my Yelps realizes that I usually review places that have rubbed me the wrong way. (Unless they rub me in a really good way and I've thoroughly enjoyed it.)   First off, this place is the pits. I've been coming here for a while now, and I've experienced quality degrade. The more I come, the less I want to be here. Today is the final nail in the coffin.   What a long wait time to even order food! I was in line for a good 7 minutes before I was given attention to place an order.   Prices are outrageous! For what I got, I would have preferred any other Hawaiian restaurant that's more filling and has better quality.  I got the garlic chicken and chicken katsu combo. My mom got a saimin. So what's easier? Two pieces of different styles of chicken and frying it, or putting noodles, some toppings in a bowl with broth? You tell me...  I got mine in 7 minutes after ordering and was told the saimin will be right out. Great! Then, we waited 7/8 more minutes before requesting a refund. I don't like eating in front of other people, and I don't like waiting so long for something so easy. From the time we ordered to the time I requested a refund... 30 minutes. There was a little wait to ask for a refund.   Maybe I was a little impatient, but don't bring out other people's order when a part of a party has already received their food and the rest haven't. Don't forget to season your customers' food.   We ended up going to Aloha Kitchen on Sunset road and it was only 7 minutes from the time we ordered for it to be bagged ready to go. And they were equally as busy as this failure.  The saving grace which allows for two really generous stars are for their malasadas and their poke. Besides that, you have plenty of Hawaiian favorites to choose from, don't go here if you want to wait and want to eat tasteless food.

My family had a HORRIBLE experience at this restaurant today. We came in for Happy Hour and got there at 3pm. We had a one year old baby with us who is very picky with food so we had to bring fries with us from a fast food restaurant. The woman who brought us to our table told us that we cannot have outside food inside Island Sushi but I explained to her that it is just food for the baby and to please just let us keep it. She said she would have to ask her manager if that was okay. She spoke to the manager and he came to our table and told her our baby can't keep the food because it is their "policy". So for the next hour, our baby just sat there hungry while everyone ate.   So we ordered our food and our first roll got to our table. But none of us can eat because they didn't provide any plates. We sat for a while waiting for someone to come by and nobody came. My sister stood up and went to the front and told them we didn't have plates. They took 5 mins after to finally bring plates. Next, they brought my niece's fish but she couldn't eat it because they didn't bring any forks. We waited again for someone to come by and after 5 minutes, my husband stood up to ask for forks at the front. And it kept getting worse. We ordered rice with the fish but that didn't come until 15 minutes later after the fish. The miso soups didn't come until 20 minutes after we ordered (which if you go to sushi restaurants often, you know that's the first thing they place on your table). They did not give wasabi and ginger until we asked for it (again, sushi restaurants ALWAYS give this automatically) and when they gave us the wasabi, it didn't come with any bowls so my husband had to get up again to the sushi table to ask for one. In total, our family had already gotten up 3 times to ask for stuff. Halfway done through our food, we had to remind them that they still haven't brought 2 rolls that we ordered. Only the manager checked up on us once. Nobody else asked if we needed anything, which is weird considering there were only about 20 people in the restaurant so they weren't that busy for us to be ignored.   Worse yet, the food was horrible. The sushi tastes like the refrigerated ones you can buy at grocery stores. The raw fish were thin and dry. We paid half price for them because of Happy Hour but even so, their sushi is not worth it.   Never coming back to this place again. The only good thing about this place is that the employees were friendly, the manager especially. My guess is that they're just unorganized and forced to follow stupid rules by the owner.

THIS PLACE IS DA BOMB!  As any islander living in Vegas would say!    My friends and I came here randomly one Sunday looking for a good sushi place to eat.  Of course we directed our interest to what Yelp had to say.  20.95 for all you can eat sushi PLUS side dishes PLUS Sunday specials!  What a steal!    I was really impressed with the flavors of the sushi and the taste of the food served here.  Of the three other "all-you-can-eat" sushi restaurants in Henderson, I have discovered Island Sushi to top it all!  You won't be disappointed!    One thing that I really enjoyed was that they do not flood each roll of sushi with white rice!  You get a significant amount of "filling" and "topping" on each of the rolls you order!  They aren't being cheap at all!    Also to all those locals from Hawaii out there, they have Poke here!  And it's GOOD!  They also have a extensive plate lunch menu and they serve saimin and bentos!    One suggestion to the fellow yelpers is to come on Sunday!  Those Sunday specials are a steal and are very delicious, particularly the Ahi Belly!    The only downside to this place and for me giving Island Sushi only 4 stars is that you are only limited to one dessert. Cmon!  Dessert is like the best part of a meal!! =P  Hopefully that rule changes!    Even so, I'd definitely be back to try this place!
I freaking love this place. The poke is amazing! My favorite is the ahi and avocado poke bowl. The crunchy part from the chips is what distinguishes it from most places. Yum!

It is hard to find Hawaiian food in Houston, so we jumped at a chance to have a good local plate.  The Kalbi Rib plate was so delicious - Best flavors!!  Everything was delicious. Fried Saimen noodles, Teri chicken & Teri beef local plates, kalua pork with cabbage and a spicy tuna poke bowl with sushi rice made for an excellent Hawaiian feast.    Do not miss the Kalbi Rib or the fried Saimen noodles!!  Wish that I had photos, but we scarfed it all down too quickly.

This review is strictly for the all you can eat sushi. There is nothing disappointing to say about this place. The restaurant is separated in two, one side is the sushi bar and the other is for the local food.  Food & service was great. Everything we ordered was tasty, so tasty that we ordered seconds of some of the same foods. My favorite was the eggplant fries & super white tuna. Soooo good. One thing I like about this place is they have tobiko! Some sushi spots only have masago so I was excited to have it here.   Not to mention they have happy hour on drinks during lunch time so feel to treat yourself! All you can eat also includes the desserts which is limited to two per person.   The only thing different about lunch is some of sushi rolls on the menu are not available. So it will be worth it to go back for dinner time!   Definitely will be back to try their local island food :)
Always great food and service. Havent had bad experience yet. Ordered spicy machiko chicken and finished with coco puffs for desert. One of my favorite spots for plate lunch.

Yelpers you've done it again!  You've provided me with some good "ALL YOU CAN EAT" sushi, and this one is on my list to go to every time I'm in Vegas.  I was here during the 2010 New Year's weekend and looking to avoid the strip since there are a lot of people in town celebrating the New Year.  So decided to look into my trusted Yelp iPhone app and with a high rating of this place, I know I can't go wrong.  So I took the wife and kids and we went along with what was recommended, "ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI" for $24.95!!!  Just two servings of the AHI POKI pays for it self already, and that's just the appetizer.  I would also recommend Joe's Special roll, Ahi Fever, and the Island Special roll.    As for the kids, we were able to make it there before 5 PM so they had their usual California roll (my boys are 3 and 5 and already eating sushi!) and some Ebi sashimi.  After the meal we treated ourselves with some Malasada to go.  Good for kids and has a lot of parking.  The only complaint (reason I didn't give them a 5 star) was service, the waitress forgot some of my wife's order and ended up making the entire order again, but no problem since it was AYCE, it was all good for my tummy!

Island Sushi is one of our 'go to' favorite sushi spots!  The wait staff we had for our large group of 7 provide us with exceptional service.  The food was great!  We will continue to go back for all of our sushi wants and needs! :)

Solid place to get local Hawaiian food and poke!  I've been coming here quite often to get my sweet taste of home here in Henderson and I do approve! I mean nothing beats some of the joints back at home, but this place is great!  If you are every craving poke or Hawaiian or local food (yes, there is a difference between Hawaiian and local food), then this is a wonderful spot to go to.   I've been to both the plate lunch side and the sushi side and both are great dining options. The sushi side is especially good during happy hour where all of the rolls are 50% off! I believe happy hour is Mon-Wed all day! It's a great deal for delicious sushi. They also have an AYCE option but I've never tried it yet since I usually just go for happy hour!  As for the plate lunch side, I've had the bento boxes (which are really filling) and the spicy tuna bowl which I am a fan of, especially the taro chips inside.  The poke is also not bad. I really enjoyed the spicy tuna avocado one. The fish was good quality and had a nice texture but I wished there were more fish/avocado and less of the spicy mayo.   The parking lot can sometimes get crowded as can the restaurant so try and come early or later in the evening. Also, the sushi side of the restaurant does take reservations so call ahead if you can and know that you have a big party!

So good. The front of the restaurant looks deceiving, when we first walked in I thought it was only hawaiian food (which is incredible) but there is a whole other part to the restaurant, with a sushi bar and all. So yummy, the waiter and food runner were amazing, very friendly and helpful. The food was delicious, fast and so yummy! Will def. be back soon!
Love the garlic chicken here. I like the fact that they are boneless, you can just eat it on the spot without using your hands. There spicy ahi is also great in taste!

I came here for lunch and ordered the poke burrito.  It was delicious.  Contains tuna, onion, furikake, cucumbers, avocado, sesame seeds.  It was recommended by the cashier.  They have a surprisingly good baked food.
Was looking for sushi in Vegas and found this place. Love it!!  Best Sushi than I've had in a long time. A must when your in Vegas.
