Best ahi tuna I have eaten in Nevada. Great staff, gotta check it out!!

Super great sushi joint, run by a couple of bruddahs from the Islands.  All you can eat, or by-the-piece.  Lots of options for the non-sushi gnoshers in the group - but this stuff is so good, that even the folks who are afraid of raw fish will be tucking in!  The AYCE option includes appetizers and desserts too!  (The Mochi chicken is really tasty!)  The Garlic Tuna is my personal fave, we lost count of how many orders we got last time!

bom.com! Iv never been so happy to find a place here in vegas that knows how to cook delicious hawaiian food! Poki is out of this world and they also have the malasadas!!! Anyways i give this place 5 stars for sure!

My cousin showed us this place while my family was on vacation. This place is great. The employees were friendly, the food was delicious, and the environment was relaxing. There is such a large variety of food that it was difficult for me to pick! My brother and I got yakisoba with chicken, my parents got something else but I forgot. The yakisoba contained a perfect mix of ingredients. Not too much vegetables and not too little yakisoba! My parents said that their meal tasted like they were in Hawaii! We ate on the grill side, but as I saw, the sushi side has a nice modern look.

Been here 3 times and loved it..!  Even better for Sunday all you can eat brunch..  They have two different menus with tasty things to choose from, the regular lunch menu and a special sunday brunch menu, all for $21..!!
Family favorite.. AYCE... all you can eat... we are from hawaii and this reminds of home..

Not what I would expect to see decor wise for an AYCE sushi place but don't let that deter you. They serve some of the FRESHEST fish!!! The wait staff is nothing but super friendly either!! Definitely a go to spot if you love sushi.

Best real fresh sushi in town! All fish flown in fresh daily, plus poke express!! only place I would trust poke (spicy poke, killer!!)  Not sure what joker put this place as 4 stars, they must think sushi is supposed to be fancy.. Sushi is from the ocean, where people wear shorts and flip flops.. This is a laid back causal place just like sushi is suppose to be natural ingredients and natural people.

This was not my first visit. However, probably my last. The food was OK. Nothing spectacular. However both myself and my dining companion ended up with upset stomachs shortly after leaving. The tables were very close together. In an almost empty restaurant, they sat us all in the same section. It did not give us much room to maneuver with a toddler and was not pleasant having to hear every word of the conversation of the people next to us. Half way through our meal, our waiter just disappeared. It took several minutes to get one of the people standing around to assist us. A very sweet and friendly waitress took over and assisted us took the end of our meal when our original waiter showed back up to hand us the bill with no explanation of his disappearance or apology. All in all, was very disappointed with my experience this time.

PROS: -BIG portion sizes -The poke is super yumm!! -Friendly service; they have that Hawaiin hospitality :) -They have like a cafe section & a restaurant connected to that. I only come to the cafe because of their really good garlic chicken.  FOOD 4/5: -Garlic Chicken ($7.75 regular/$5.25 mini): MY FAVORITE, crispy outside & soft inside. -Mochicko Chicken ($7.75/$5.25): 2nd favorite chicken dish here. -Regular plate comes with 2 scoops of rice & mac salad. Mini plate comes with 1 scoop of rice & mac salad -Ahi Avocado Poke Bowl ($10.75): OMG i love this poke bowl because it has tuna & avocado with cucumber & taro chips :) -Bento A Teri beef & garlic chicken ($8.75): The teri beef & garlic chicken combo is tasty. Bento boxes are filling as it comes with rice, noodles & takuan (korean pickled radish)

Had brunch here with my cousin. Small place with a lot of Hawaiian inspired dishes. Had the small portion of kalbi beef with rice.  It was good but a tad too sweet. The pasta salad was amazing though. I could have had that for my dish. Nice place for a quick bite and friendly faces.

This is just wrong. I ordered the sushi burrito and the ahi tuna bento box. The burrito was very bland and wasn't very fresh. It wasn't horrible though. HOWEVER, the ahi "tuna" bento box was the most off putting thing I've ever received. It was incredibly dry and super thin. Nothing resembling tuna. I'll post pictures

I met a friend for lunch here yesterday.  We went into the main room with the sushi bar and were seated at a two top table.  Our server, Mariah, was there quickly with menus, took our drink orders, and brought us our iced teas quickly.  She answered the questions we had about items we were considering.  We order two sushi rolls and two side dishes.  The sushi rolls were the standard California roll and a Lava Lover roll which the menu describes as a spicy tuna cucumber roll topped w/ cajun ahi, chili paste & garlic ponzu.  Both rolls were good.  The more interesting of the two was the Lava Lovers roll.  It was not very spicy and carried just a small kick--wasabi being a good addition to the heat for me.  The two sides were mochiko chicken and teriyaki beef.  This was only the second time I had mochiko chicken and I liked it better than the first time I had it elsewhere.  There was not sweet sauce on the chicken.  Rather, it was served plain which was good.  The teriyaki beef was good with a topping of sesame seed for decoration and a small amount of flavor.  We couldn't leave without some dessert.  My friend ordered mango mochi and I got the malassada sundae.  My sundae was very good.  The malassada and the ice cream may have been overkill calorie wise, but ti was very tasty!  I checked out their case and I know where I can buy poke in the future without having to drive to North Las Vegas where I got it once before.   Island is a solid place for sushi and other items from the Pacific.
Amazing sushi. Always satisfied. Their menu is very creative. Great variety. My first visit there was about 5 years ago.
Only place you can find Fanta Fruit Punch!  Liking the malassadas too :)

First time here and I'm so impressed!! This restaurant is split in half which was pretty smart imo. Half of the place is ayce sushi and the other half is Hawaiian food / a poke station.   I ordered the slow roasted pork loco moco and my boyfriend got their Thai shrimp sushiritto and both were incredibly good!  The slow roasted pork loco moco was really tender and they gave a pretty generous amount (4 big slices)! it's served on a bed of white rice, covered in delicious brown gravy and topped with your choice of egg. It also comes with a side of macaroni! Such a great portion!  The sushiritto is made fresh to order, so it makes it so much more yummy! It is made tempura - style, so there's a nice crunch to every bite!  Also, definitely get the malasadas for dessert!! You can either get it with custard or chocolate filling or have it plain! Malasadas are almost like whole fat donuts rolled in cane sugar. Yummmmm! Try getting it fresh because that's when it's the best!!

I love this place. The sushi is always delicious but the avocado ahi poke bowl is seriously one of my favorite dishes on this planet. It has tons of fresh ahi, cucumber, avocado, onions and crispy won ton strips over white rice with this amazing sauce. Definitely give it a try!

On a little weekend trip to Vegas, me and my friend wanted to explore the local joints a lot more and heard about Island Sushi Grill.  We happened to go there on a weekend ayce brunch time and ordered alot of rolls and fusion-y items from the menu.   All the rolls were pretty yummy and the spam sliders were addicting!    Overall a good relaxing local place for japanese food.  Definitely a place to be around to hang with the locals of Las Vegas versus all the random tourists.

Another Update: This island girl still like this place but gonna have to find someplace closer to my house cuz the drive across town isn't worth it anymore.  The Cali rolls terrible today. Noodles still good mochi still good poi mochi even better but OMG the roast pork more like roast hockey pucks was the worst I ever ate !  I had to take a picture and send to all my peeps! Overdone dry tasteless just bad.   Update:  Food still wonderful but the service is going down hill- there's a local girl in there that's good but everyone else up front either needs more training or needs to go if they don't enjoy their jobs and have attitude or face all the time is time to get someone who really wants to be there and has the Aloha spirit the same way the food does!!  Also wanted to mention the poke section very fresh awesome flavor!   I love love love their noodles wet or dry they season perfectly and give lots, the Mochi chicken teri chicken just about everything on the menu is good!!! The sushi some is great and some not too good the use paste roll for example not so good.  The malasadas and mochi is good but don't order the chantilly cake! The cake is dry and tasteless and it is not chantilly!  You should be shame for calling it that! All in all I eat here all the time and it's worth it! I give the food 10 of 10 and desserts 7

Gambled one day while my friends and I were in Vegas, not wanting to eat at a buffet we decided to trust yelp and roll the dice. We now make special trips to Vegas just for this place. The rolls are the star of the show. Creative and delicious enough to make a group of 4 drive all the way from Los Angeles to eat here. Keep doing what you are doing. The lunch all you can eat was a phenomenal deal that left us all more then full with delicious food. To the people who live in the area consider yourselves lucky, Island sushi is the real deal.

Kinda bummed on this. I have been eating here on the grill side of the restaurant for years (has a sushi side) . My dish of choice was garlic shrimp but for those that have had it in Hawaii where it is prepared out of the shell, they don't do that here. Its in the shell so had to scratch that. Moved to garlic chicken and for years. Spot on. Lately it has been served kinda cold. I'm stumped how chicken that is fried can be cold but yet cooked thoroughly.  I will say I continue to come here and when its on ... Its on and even off its still good. Great people ... Both staff and patrons. Check it out ... Maybe it's just me.

Absolutely amazing!  This is probably the best deal in all of vegas if you can make your way out there.  It was so good that I went back there twice in one weekend.  The fish is all very fresh and delicious.  The best part about the rolls and nigri is that they dont overload the rice and give a good balance of fish and rice, so you aren't getting ripped off.  You also get a variety of appetizers to choose from, and I highly recommend the fried geso (squid/octopus) and the garlic chicken.  Super good!  For dessert, the green tea ice cream or the 808 special are both good and you cannot go wrong with either one.    My friend and I went for lunch and paid 20.95, but after seeing the menu and tallying it up, we easily ate over $200, no lie.  The waitress was shocked on how much we consumed.  haha  On a side note, make sure you save just a tiny bit of space for their bakery next door.  The malasadas are very good.  The plain is the best, but the haupia (coconut) and chocolate filled ones are also very delicious.

After my first visit here, I came 2 more times to come back for more within the same week.  Yes, the stuff I ordered is that good.  Plus, I have an addictive personality.   When you walk in , you have 3 options.    1. Order from their fast food section complete with all your local Hawaiian favorites.  My favorite dish that I have ordered twice from there, is the Garlic Chicken.  If you like crispy fried chicken and garlic, this dish is for you!  It is delicious and will. make you want to come back for more!  The mini size is just the right portion for me.  2. Order from the Poke Express section complete with all your poke needs from Ahi, Salmon, Shrimp, Special combinations, and even cucumber kim chi for your veggie requirements.  My favorites are the Special Combination poke, and the Furikake poke.  The raw fish is fresh, and you can order by the 1/2 pound.  This gets pretty pricey though, and you can get pretty full if you just order a 1/2 pound of poke and maybe a 1/2 pound of cucumber kim chi.  Good for the no carb dieters!  3. Sit down in their sushi restuarant and order sushi.  This I can't comment on because I haven't actually ordered from their menu.     My stars are strictly for option 1 and 2.  If I try option and 3 and love it, I'll add my 5th star.  I'll be back for sure!!!!   Yelp Challenge! Started 8/20/2011 (64/365).

First time visit on May 9th. The place was packed-shouldn't have visited on a Friday night but I was craving some sushi.  SERVICE We had a server named Marc who was just awesome! He was attentive and after telling him that it was our first time there, he ordered some of the most popular appetizers and rolls for us to try. They were all terrific!  FOOD While our server was super amazing, kitchen people were super slow. We waited over 30 minutes for our sushi. Yes I understand the place was packed but I've never waited that long at a sushi place. I was surprised to see that for AYCE, you only get 90 minutes limit. LOL are you kidding me. Half the time is spent waiting for food. Anyways, appetizers were good but sushi was ok. Some of my favorites were:  -Poke Roll -Garlic chicken (must try) -Salad (pieces of tuna and salmon in it. It was delicious!) -Joe's special  I felt like some of the sushi weren't that fresh. Having raised in Japan, I've had some good sushi and know what fresh sushi taste like-this wasn't it.  CONCLUSION Not the best but not the worst either. If you are not willing to wait 30 minutes for some sushi, I suggest Makinos for no wait & fresh sushi!

It's not bad, not the best either.  I was going to meet a friend at another sushi spot nearby but when she got there she told me they were closed and open only at night.  I told her to drive further north towards my favorite intersection in LV (215/Eastern) because I've always wanted to try Sunday brunch at Island Sushi.  We both had all you can eat, we had dinner pricing because we wanted some of the dinner only items as well.  They have a special Sunday Brunch pupus menu and I pretty much ordered all of it.  The one item per person on the pupus menu, crab poke something, had a nice spice kick to it and it's basically a small crab cut in half with that spicy sauce.   I'm the unlimited mimosas champagne, I mean champion, and I had that here as well.  Keep it coming man, keep pouring it.  Unfortunately the restaurant was busy and so service was spotty.  Luckily we sat on the table at the far south east end so servers always passed us but even so, it was somewhat hard to get their attention.  But back to my mimosa, I started with the guava mimosa and it just didn't work.  I ended my next 6 refills with regular champagne.  The thick guava syrup was just too sweet and settled on the bottom of the glass.  So do come and try Island Sushi but Sunday brunch (gotta have a taste for their pupus section) is a definite must try.  I'll definitely be back.

Used to come here all the time. Portions on the food seems to be getting less and less. Bought the fried noodles with garlic chicken. Must be a noodle shortage because there was more rice than noodles.

2 1/2 to 3 stars.    This place is a very strange hybrid of 3 restaurants: an AYCE sushi place, a hawaiin plate lunch grill, and a poke bar.    We went in with a Hawaiin friend of mine who raves about this place for the plate lunch.  The sushi section was packed.    Hubs and I shared the eggplant plate and the mochico chicken and shrimp plate.  The eggplant had great flavor but was insanely oily...it just sat in an inch of bright orange oil in my Styrofoam box.  The chicken and shrimp were nothing special.  The meals were served with a scoop of white rice and mac salad as expected.    Everything was fine but I've definitely experienced better.  Maybe the sushi is where it is at?
My girlfriend enjoyed the sushi and I had some regular noodles and chicken that were good.

I don't eat fish, and yet I love sushi (I know, I'm a weirdo). If you are a vegetarian, this is the BEST all-you-can-eat sushi in town, without a doubt. I have plenty of choices and eat to the point of regret and self-loathing every time. My non-vegetarian, sushi snob boyfriend loves the food as well!

The pictures itself of this restaurant is drool worthy. Hawaiian food, desserts, fresh poke, sushi all under one roof?! Yes... I know. Run over there! Located on eastern and 215. The restaurant is divided into two areas, the sushi restaurant, and the Hawaiian food/poke section. We got a little bit of everything- poke, ox tail soup, beef teriyaki plate, malasadas, spam musubi. Everything tasted so good, food came out hot and fresh, poke was fatty and soft. I really have no complaints, and pricing was great too!

I love some goooood poke every now and then! This place is mouthwatering and lip smacking goooood!  Poke so good it makes you wanna slap yo mama!!!!!! I also had the bento which was very scrumptious and finger linkin delicious.  Great place to eat!!! :)

This is my favorite sushi restaurant! I've never had a bad dinner or lunch here nor have I ever had bad customer service. I usually come here for half off happy hour where you can get almost any rolls for half off the price. This place is my holy grail for sushi

Cool place for sushi i guess.  What I really dug is that early in the AM they do breakfast at a very affordable price.  Any place that offers spams is A-OK with me.  If you order a breakfast meal it comes with a side of a delicious sweet bread.    Added bonus is that they make Malasadas daily which is basically a donut coated with sugar.  All my Hawaiian friends says it's the best in town, so i think it's just a "Island" thing.  I don't care for them personally, but i bet they're great treats that my Hawaiian friends would appreciate more so. They can also fill it with chocolate custard, but why would anyone want to do that?  Workers here are friendly too  3.5

I like Island Sushi & Grill because it is ideal for groups that include both sushi lovers and those that will not nosh on raw fish. While it is not my favorite place in town for sushi, it's a very solid option, and I have never been disappointed with any of the non-sushi items I've gotten.   Most of my visits to Island Sushi & Grill have been to pick up to go orders (and poke from Poke Express, located in the back) and these experiences have always been solid. To-go orders have always been ready when they said they would be, packaged up properly and handed over by a smiling employee.   On my most recent visit I took 3 out of towners: My brother-in-law and his wife aren't big on sushi so they got items from the grill side of the menu while a friend and I both did ACYE. Pricing for AYCE is in line with most spots in town. There are some limitations on the menu (the standards: certain items can only be ordered at dinner, some are limited to one per person, no sharing). All of the sushi we ordered was excellent, nigiri was cut well and had a good fish to rice ratio. My in-laws were pleased with their selections, and we all left happy and very full for a great price.  On Sundays, Island Sushi & Grill does an AYCE brunch that I am looking forward to trying soon.  If you love sushi but also love to dine with people are don't care for it, give Island Sushi & Grill a try.
Love it!!!  Local girls at the counter are sweet, but be on your toes! Feisty. Killer poke, great garlic chicken.. Mmmm

I've been hitting up Island Sushi for years prior to the Yelp career.  It's time to show some Yelp love.  I'm yelping in regards to the AYCE sushi while sitting at the sushi bar..  Service: I've hit up their ayce sushi bar for Sunday brunch, weekend and weekday nights. The staff has always been GREAT! I'll usually sit at the sushi bar and the chefs are all cool but I want to give a shout out to Juan.  He's a great sushi chef who is friendly and is quick with getting your order out.  THe wait staff is awesome with keeping the bottomless mimosas or beers coming which I'll usually pair up with the ayce sushi.  There's a TV and they'll change the channel to the games you request as you throw down ayce and bottomless booze.  AYCE Sushi:  The Nigiri is always on point and I've never had a bad experience.  Everything we order is great but these are my favs: Yuzu Yellowtail, Salmon, Super White Tuna, Squid and the Garlic Tuna.  The Mount Charleston is bomb: California roll smothered with Spicy baked scallops and eel sauce.  Nigiri game is strong af here, everything is solid.  Ambiance: There's two parts to Island Sushi:  Pick up window dining and sit-down restaurant dining.  The Sushi Bar is in the Sit down restaurant which is directly to your right after you enter the Pick Up dining area.  The restaurant area is small and they pack a lot of tables so it's going to be noisy but nothing to derail from the dining experience.  This is my go to casual AYCE sushi joint.  Staff, service and the sushi has never failed me and I appreciate the consistency throughout the years.  It always seems to be crowded with regulars which is a testament to their performance so waits for parties of 5+ can occur.  However, if the sushi bar is empty, it's an easy sit down with no wait.  Keep up the great work Island Sushi, Mahalo! =)

Big fan but very inconsistent. Sometimes my rice in my nigiri is small, other times it's the biggest ball of rice on this side of the Rockies.  Not in anyway demeaning the quality of fish or sides, but the rice to be honest, not that good. It's almost as if there is something added to the rice that just shouldn't be there. The rice to me, tastes funny, and I never complain because of how polite I am. So I will give them three stars until the quality and consistent size of rice improves.  Terry,  Fish is always great. Love the white tuna, hamachi, and unagi. I try to taste at least one order of each. Rice machines are great. Which is why I have upped my review to four stars.  All this place needs to get to five stars is top notch service. I feel like I come sometimes and the line will be out the door but tables and the bar are open.  Sushi Chefs are top notch and are always great. Some people like going to authentic places where all the chefs are shipped from overseas, but I don't speak Japanese so most conversations are just placing orders.
Food is delicious, had the all you can eat and it was worth it.  They have a good variety of choices to pick from.
We love the plum sakatini. So yummy. Their rolls never disappoint me. Our order gets to us in a timely manner and we the service is usually great.

Came back here 2 more times, this time I stuck with the lunch pricing vs dinner pricing during lunch time. Food is still fresh. Depending on who the server is that day will depend on how great of a customer service you are going to get.   They get pretty packed during noon time and there seems to only be 2 people working there so expect to take a longer lunch.   I finally tried their desert (808 special and malassada sundae) and its pretty tasty. I like the malassada sundae a lot because of the flavors in it.   Definitely would like to go back and eat more.
Poke bowl with sushi rice was awesome.  I swear I probably had more than a 1/2 lb of poke on there!  Total grinds!

This place was one of our fav sushi joints till today. Had 3 all you can eat dinners plus my 2yr old. Then I get my bill...$13 for a kids all you can eat? First of all, my kid didn't even touch his Miso soup and had maybe, a couple of spoon fulls of rice (picky eater). And I get a $13 kids dinner charge? I was informed that the owner has updated the "clause" in the menu to "children under 10" must pay half price for all you can eat...so am I to understand that a 6mo old or a 1yr old - or a 2yr old will be charged $13? The hell is wrong with you? Seriously? I can see how an 8yr old or even a 6yr old could be a threat to your profits, but a 2yr old?  Please reconsider this absurd policy...because it makes you look petty. And your a better place than that. I hope.
Very friendly atmosphere! I have had the oxtail soup it was delicious. Tried my friends sushi and it was fresh and tasty. Took my son about a week later, he loved it too.
They have the best service ! Great delicious food! Worth it!!! Give them a try I promise u will love it!  Missing Hawaii !!!!

Need a sushi fix and don't wanna break the bank?  This is the place. This restaurant has two parts to it. A plate lunch side, which you can also order sushi, poke bowls, etc. and a traditional sushi bar side, where they also let you order from the plate lunch side. Plate lunch has all your local Hawaii favorites and the sushi side has all your traditional rolls and some unique rolls as well, including alcohol. One of my favorite local restaurants in Las Vegas!

Island Sushi is Awesome!  I've been coming here every week for the past year + and it's my favorite sushi joint hands down.  My usual picks are Island special, Chuey,  fried geso,  Ahi poke  The service is quick and friendly, sometimes the sushi chefs will make random tasty tidbits and send them our way, so good!

I am soooo disappointed! I'm not going to lie the food is really good but the service we received from Stephanie tonight was completely out of line. It sucks that although the food was good I still leave a negative review but honestly I will not be back just because if the service me and my party received.  We had a party of 15 and most if us got the all you can eat sushi. We didn't even receive 1/3 of the sushi we ordered because she kept giving our rolls to other people in our party even though me and my wife were on a separate tab. She didn't offer us out desert and just asked us if we wanted the bill at the end- we felt like we were being rushed!   On top of all that she over charged us on our drinks and I when I tried explaining it to her she ignored me and started talking to another person in our party WHILE I WAS STILL TALKING. She rudely said "fine I'll take it off the bill". Are you serious!?!? Wth is that?   After she had someone else drop of the revised bill she NEVER came back to pick it up! Our entire party of 15 left because we were waiting so long and me and my wife ended up waiting by our selves until we finally decided to walk up to the cash resister and asked if someone could ring us up. Stephanie should NOT be working in a place where she has to be polite to paying customers or any service oriented job because it is not her cup of tea.. I will not be back here ever again!

I like the food here but this reveiw is just for the some of the desserts: 1. Guava Cake - I was craving for some Guava cake so even though I came to the conclusion that I don't like the Guava cake here I decided to give it another try...Yup, I don't like it- The Guava Paste/Jelly on the cake just doesn't have a good Guava flavoring at all, it's just sweet. Oh, how I wish someone on this side of town could make some good Guava Chiffon cake just  like in Hawaii!!!! 2. Cream Puffs - The pudding on top and inside is just so overpowering - Hmm, I don't know- it was just way too much.  So, even though I didn't care for these 2 items doesn't mean that I don't like/enjoy everything else in this place cause I do. They do make hella good Malasadas, Banana Bread & Garlic Chicken.

AYCE sushi!  Ordered so many rolls, i can't remember what I got but I just know they were all delicious. I love the Hawaiian theme behind this sushi restaurant. I can't wait to come back to try their baked rolls because they all looked so good. I wish this place was back in my hometown because I would be a regular! I didn't get the chance to try their plates but looking on their menu, their plate dishes looked so good. I only wish that my stomach was big enough to eat the entire menu.   I did try their desserts, and they were all good! Next time, I'll definitely try more of their desserts. Brownie was warm and it was a perfect combo with their ice cream.

BEWARE of ordering off their CATERING menu. I paid $90 for a FULL tray of Teriyaki Beef. I ended up with a HALF tray of Teriyaki-4 lbs of cooked Teri Beef. Menu says it can feed 25-30 people. Definitely NOT TRUE. What they fail to tell you is the FULL tray of Teri Beef is half in height-in essence NOT a FULL tray of beef. What a total disappointment!!! I ordered for my daughters graduation party and did not have enough for all my guests.   Also, my order was picked up at 1030am. Shrya called me at 1130am to ask when I would be picking up my order? She said it was still there. Which leads me to believe they gave me the wrong order. I spoke to Lee and he didn't help matters.   So basically, DO NOT order any catering from them. It is a HUGE ripoff. I paid $90 for 4lbs of Teri Beef. Terrible Service and false advertising!  This is my reply to Owner-Terrence Fong seems like a good excuse to me. I missed Steve's phone call as I was hosting a graduation party and trying to figure out how I would make up for the shortage of Teri Beef.   It is a FACT that the tray was  NOT up to value. No where on the catering menu did it say "Full Tray is 8lbs". That to me equals-FALSE Advertising. I also purchased a FULL TRAY of Deluxe Noodles and guess what? That tray weighed a lot more than 8 lbs. What is your excuse for that?   I always try to support local businesses. But, how can I when this is he result. Very sad that you decided to respond this way instead of trying to making it right. AUWE! Clearly you are not in the habit of running your business with Aloha and respect for your customers.

Island Sushi & Grill is an ABSOLUTE MUST when we come to Vegas! Best sushi, music, and service! My family and I always come here when we get together. Servers like Kevin and the team make the experience GREAT! Go with the All-You-Can-Eat when you're there because it's worth it. Here are some of our family faves below! Oh and make a reservation  Starters  * Shrimp Tempura  * Mochiko Chicken * Garlic Chicken   Sushi  * Big Island Roll * Kahuku Roll * Kona Roll   Desserts * 808 Special  * Malassada Sundae
My cousin who lives in Vegas, but from Hawaii took us here for breakfast. The food was good & portions were generous. I will definitely go back on my next Vegas trip.

Really good place with a local atmosphere. Super comfortable friendly service. A lot to choose from on ayce menu, and everything was right on. The sushi was actually really good, and although there are some straight sushi places with slightly better sushi most of those places don't have the variety that this place has. Delicious ahi poke, and a bunch of sides that I wouldn't normally get at sushi places puts this place over the top.  I went with my wife and kids and we just ordered a ton of food. There was nothing that didn't taste good and we didn't feel rushed or like they wanted to present a bunch of "rules" for ayce like other places. I will go back regularly. Awesome find.
I Come every week to their poke bowl ! The poke is always fresh . Remind me the poke bowl in Hawaii . Excellent customer service .

The best sushi place in town, hands down. AYCE and they give great portions. I'm a big nigiri sushi eater and their proportions of rice to raw fish ratio is pretty even. I recommend the soft shell crab, it tastes amazing (one order per person).   There is not an item on their menu that I don't recommend. They are always busy, but reservations are welcome.   The best customer service I've ever experienced in an AYCE sushi restaurant.   I highly recommend coming here, not only for sushi, but they have really good Hawaiian food AND the best Poke in town.

This is by far MY FAVORITE AYCE sushi place!  It's not that close to the Las Vegas Strip, but driving here is totally worth it.  Upon entering, the first section you're in is their bake shop where you can order malasadas and wonderful treats like cocoa puffs.  To the right is the main dining area.  You can choose to order a la carte style or AYCE.  From their regular menu, we ordered their garlic chicken, mochiko chicken, and fried noodles.  ALL TASTED GREAAAAT!  From their sushi menu, we ordered ahi poke (tuna), tako poke (octopus), ebi (shrimp), ika (squid), masago (smelt roe), unagi (fresh water eel), amaebi (sweet shrimp), and their uni (sea urchin).  We also ordered a few specialty rolls.  All were very good and fresh!  Just writing this review makes me want to drive 4 hours just to eat here!  Okay, back to their review.  Their friendly staff did a great job in making sure we had enough food and when we would place an order, the food came out fresh and quick.  This AYCE isn't your typical buffet where you get up and serve yourself.  Your server comes around and you would inform them what menu item you'd like to order.  Simple as that!  When the place gets extremely busy, they have a 90 min. time limit.  The rules are noted on each table.  However when we were there, it was pretty packed and we stayed their longer than 90 minutes.  I guess they don't want you to practically live there and live off of their awesome food.  Also, they don't like it when you waste their awesome sushi.  So order accordingly.  It's an AYCE, so pace yourself.  DO NOT ORDER RICE OR ELSE YOU WILL GET FULL FAST!  For each person, it's about $24.  Don't come here expecting to eat crab legs all day.  For $24, that is a VERY good deal for fresh and great tasting sushi.  Their AYCE menu is extensive.  Did I mention that their mochiko and garlic chicken are both delicious?  I will most definitely eat here again.
Oh no!! I found my new lunch place now..Yummy! We ordered the 1. chicken&eggplant . 2.Curry chicken. 3. Garlic shrimp. All Mini. Plus uni Sushi. Perfect size for me and my husband. Tasty!
Best poke in this town/city. Service is absolutely the best even when it's was busy. Great food, hidden gem for sure.

4 star food and service is always great so that pushes it to 5 stars for me.  Love their garlic chicken wings, the mount charleston and all you can menu.  I've taken different friends and family here and they all love it as well.  Sorry to see the downtown location closed, it's definitely a favorite place of mine to eat!

Quick stop by this joint today for lunch after a morning full of Garage Sale hopping in Southern Highlands!   Our cousin said this place has bomb custard pie! If you're from Hawaii, you're used to getting bomb custard pie from Zippy's and Foodland or any other average Hawaii grocery store. Here in Vegas, custard pie isn't such a hot commodity, so when Your Cousin says "custard pie", you just reply, "lead the way"!   We arrived on a Saturday afternoon at around 1pm. The place was semi-packed, we were rushing so we opted for the take-out side of the restaurant. I ordered the kalua pig with poke plate, we shared a custard pie and a side of chicken katsu.   When you walk in, the place is kind of confusing...to the right you'll see a sign in sheet on a table with a sign directing Wait to Be Seated, straight ahead at the end of the take out side of the restaurant you'll see an ordering window with Poke Bowl only menu, and to the left you'll see the take out window with bakery showcase!   I was overwhelmed by all the signage, I just picked a seat and waited for my other half to order us lunch. It took a while to get our order but it was clear that the place was busy. Our food was good, I like that they had shoyu for us on the side next to the soda machine. I also like that they have free refills in the self serve soda machine. I was kind of disappointed that I didn't get to really take a look at the menu so I'll be back again. Next time I'll opt for the dine in side.

Okay kids, I got LOST in Las Vegas (isn't that a movie with that lame-o Nick Cage, I can be wrong, no wait, I was wrong, that's Leaving Las Vegas, and I'm not wrong about him being LAME). With the new car rental terminal thingy being miles away from the airport, I got lost and wound up going the wrong direction in search of the Strip. Don't laugh at me. I'm horrible with my bearings once I get anywhere, but once I get my internal GPS going, I'm good to go.  At any rate, we wound up consulting our Garmin to look for a sushi place and were actually looking for Koto Sushi (never been, but hell it came up on our search so why the hell not), but found that was Island Sushi instead. Scared as hell that sushi can be either BOMB or ASS, we entered in and knew that it wasn't all bad when everyone, well, almost everyone except us, were island folk! No shit! I was thrilled because you want to go to a restaurant that has the people there. Go to a Chinese restaurant that doesn't have chinese people? Are you high? Anyways, real Hawaiians, real ono food, you heard?  Husbandido ordered the chirashi and was NOT disappointed. Was thrilled when he couldn't finish it (take that SF chirashi!) and saw just how much rice there was to offer. I ordered chicken katsu dinner and lo and behold it came with dessert (808 special is a must have, people). So I give them mad props. I frequent SF sushi just as regularly as I frequent my home, and it's nice to find good, solid sushi and grinds as I would at home. I would dare to say not necessarily just good...but maybe better!  I highly recommend this, even if you're not lost. It's worth a drive out, and it's not too far off the freeway to scare the crap out of you.  You will definitely have enough scratch to hit the casinos afterward. Two hungry people fresh from the plane? $34. Baller status.  Oh and the peeps that work there are really COOL! Love 'em. Mahalo!

Used to love to eat here all the time. Although the food is still ok, the service has gone down. Went in there the other day and the person at the register looked grouchy and was bothered that the restaurant was busy. Bring back the Aloha feeling that was nce there when you first opened.
Literally everything is delicious at this place. So many options can't go wrong. Favorites- Kalbi plate, oxtail soup, poke bowl, spicy tuna roll, Kona roll.

I don't think I ever had a bad meal here. I'm not from Hawaii but my fiance say is and he tells me all the time this place is the  closest to being straight from home. I am obsess with poke and all the different types, so nothing makes me happy then their poke bar. A bit pricey,  but what do you expect when you live in the desert.

I used to come to this place very often however the customer service is quite lacking. If you are not of a particular racial background (white or Asian) you are ignored in line until you say something to the employees in line (who are placed higher in the line customers for their own personal orders).  I observed and experienced this twice and said something to the staff about it and all they could muster up was to say sorry. The staff here need a serious lesson in courtesy and overall business practice.

I didn't know what to really expect when I came here, but I saw a picture of saimin the day before and I knew that I just had to go!   I got here a lil before 11 am and it was pretty packed. I ordered the deluxe saimin and subbed it out with udon noodles instead. Everything came out fairly quickly. Broth was light and there was a good assortment of wonton, bbq pork and imitation crab meat. I didn't leave full though, so that was the downfall. My coworker enjoyed the teriyaki chicken which he ate all of.  I know I will be back to get some chantilly cake to go! They have a pastry selection that looked pretty delish, but can be pricy at $4.50 a slice.   We were in and out in 30 minutes and everyone was quite friendly.

This place is on my top five of all the AYCEs here in vegas!! it is well worth your $20.95 for lunch. its just so goood! Their side dishes are really good you'll have to try all of  them . They also have over 20 rolls to choose from they kind of cut it tiny but i guess thats good if you want to try alot of their rolls.  i recommend the CANDYCANE roll:]           GESO!! omgahh you cannot go here without getting gesos (which are baby octopus goodness!)   The only down side would be their nigiri. Last time i ate there the salmon wasnt fresh :[. but sometimes it is. but if this place isnt all that if your crazy for nigiri ive had way better quality in other sushi joints. Also their service could be slow and youll have to be patient if there is alot of people, their really nice though.  But other than that this placeee is really really YUMMMY!!  The sushi chef even gave me and my boyfriend complimentary SAKE BOMBS!! woot.   and again. TRY THE GESO!!!

When I miss home & since this is closer to me I come here to get my hawaiian fix. Poki is expensive but worth it. They also have all you can eat sushi side all I can say is broke the mouth (deliciously yummy)

I absolutely love Island Sushi for their garlic chicken, fried noodles, spam katsu musubi (it's so.... ono! Katsu breading around the spam!), creme puffs, malasadas, and the list goes on and on and on. I moved away from Hawaii 6 years ago so this is a great place to eat in between my trips back home.   I would come here more often if I didn't live on the opposite side of town. :) I normally just order to go but I've been here once for AYCE and that was pretty good. They also added the option to order online too! It's great because you can specify whether or not you want mac salad, all rice, etc. Then you can specify the time you want the pick up and you can also pay online. So easy!  All I have to say now is, get over here and try it. Even if you are not from Hawaii, you will love the food! Don't be afraid to try anything and everything!   Island Sushi - Thank you for always providing great food and excellent customer service!

They have malassadas! Since Hawaii, having the best malassadas ever, we have looked for them and Island's S&G is pretty much the only.place that has them anywhere close to the islands! Anytime we come to Vegas we come here! We had all you can eat lunch and it was so good, fresh great price and really good service. Plus with AYCE you get 2 desserts and they are delicious! Brownies taste homemade!

This place is delightful. Great selection of All You Can Eat Sushi, great service, and for those random friends/family who you have to bring that don't enjoy fish plenty of great teriyaki and other options for them to indulge in. Looking for a great place to go, come here!
Something that they should really work on is the customer service. Yes they are friendly however in my opinion they're slow for the size of the restaurant. Sushi is good but will never beat SAKANA.
Amazing service, fresh food, really unique items. This is my first time here and definitely not my last! Loving his spot!

This place is GOOD. The customer service is amazing and the people are so friendly. Now lets talk about the amazing food! The garlic chicken and chicken katsu is ono!!! Best I've ever had. Had the sushi today for the first time and it was so fresh and delicious too! My friend had the sushi burrito and was doing the happy dance while eating it. I will be going back and trying other things as well, I have never been disappointed with anything. P.S their banana lumpia makes you feel all warm and fuzzy inside. Thank you ISG!! Alooohaaaa.

This review is for AYCE sushi only! We absolutely LOVE this place. Started coming here last year after moving in the area and have been completely happy with it ever since. The sushi is always fresh and chefs and staff are always super sweet. It can get pretty packed around dinner time and on weekends, but the wait is never long.  Surf & Turf and Big Island are some of our favorite rolls, but the entire menu from miso soup to nigiri is delish. Finish dinner with hot fresh malassada and you're set!  This place never disappoints!

We had a large party of 40 people while we were in town for a basketball tournament.  We made sure to make reservations as this place is such a hidden gem and books up quickly.  The restaurant is a little small  We are from LA and Island Sushi and Grill is one of the BEST hawaiian/sushi places we've been to hands down.  Add in an AYCE option and you can't lose!!  The staff is so helpful and accommodating giving off the classic island hospitality.  We can only imagine how chaotic it was for the staff to cater our party, with all the al la carte and all you can eat options, but they did it with ease.  The food was delicious and well prepared and came out in a timely matter.  Our whole team was so impressed with the selection and quality of the food.  We've been here several times and are always impressed and pleased with the food, drinks, and service.

AYCE Sushi!   I am usually super duper disappointed with the AYCE sushi places bc they tend to limit the menu to certain items and they're usually items that I do not like... NOT HERE! Liked it all! They had my favs and usuals, scallop roll, poke, and garlic tuna. Poke was good and they give a nice size amount for one serving, garlic tuna had too much ginger and the scallops were cooked, not what I'm used to but they were all pretty tasty. The dessert was pretty good on the AYCE too. I think it was called the Island Special, basically ice cream and fruit. Simple but refreshing!   The quality of the sushi was good, service was good and the restrooms were clean but c'mon, put some hand soap in the bathroom! They had a sink and paper towels but no soap, what in the heck?! Sorry, had to knock a star off for that, I'm a level 4 germ-a-phobe so it was real bothersome that I had to use my hand sanitizer rather than use what's supposed to be available to you by health department standards.   One other thing that I was pretty disappointed with what that this place is called Island Sushi and a majority of the people that come in to eat here get AYCE sushi but-- they didn't include the malasadas in the AYCE Menu. Not a big deal but I would've rather have had them... Been awhile since I've had them :(  Word to the wise... You have to decide whether or not you want AYCE right away, they're sticklers for it. My sister-in-law ordered edamame and then decided that she wanted AYCE after the order had been put in and and they said that they had to charge her for it because they "can't" change it out.

Great place for poke, especially their spicy ahi "cube" bowl. Their items are fresh and reminds me of being back in Hawaii. Their staff is friendly, too. They also have some baked goods to satisfy your sweet tooth.
Pokè !!! The best poke in town hands down. I used to go to poke place on Craig, but this one is by far so much better !!!!! Pokè bowl is to die for.

I came here again a few weeks ago, and was a little disappointed the food didn't live up to my memory.  The first time I came, this WAS THE BEST SUSHI ROLLS I ever had.  Now, it's really good, but the rolls didn't pop.  The sushi didn't seem as fresh and vigorous as before, and the presentation was also a little bit underwhelming.  Still, very good sushi and I would eat here again if in the area;  Probably won't make a 200 mile detour trip like I did this last time though.

Great sushi quality! I hate that they don't take reservations (only because I drive from Summerlin). I give them 3 stars because their service is mediocre. They have a larger selection of apps and side and treats, also a bakery so you can grab some fresh malasadas before you go choices between pandan, chocolate, or vanilla. Ono!!
Love it here but I miss the option to get Poke Express too. It was the best of both worlds! Just miss that counter... Butter Mochi is good here too.

When I want a quick spicy tuna bowl fix, i go to island sushi. I went during lunch hour so the tables were full and people were in line to pick up their food orders. It took 10 minutes to order our food and another 15 minutes to get the food. The spicy tuna bowl tasted great, I just wished it looked like a bowl. The food wasn't presentable as I hoped it would be. I also wished they had more help because this place gets packed and it needs more seating arrangements.

Two words when ordering on the Grill side, GARLIC CHICKEN! It's the closest thing to the Mitsuken restaurant in Hawaii, and boy let me tell you that is some bomb ass Garlic Chicken.  Everything else on the menu is A-OK, and so is the poke.  It isn't anything to rave about, but I do make do since I can't have it fresh like home.    On the sushi side, it's bueno! I think it's just me, but I love how the rice is.  It isn't too sticky or moist, it's just right.  Also, a keynote when ordering get the deep fried gesu.  OMG! It's amazing, especially with their mayo sauce.  It just makes everything taste better! I tend to think that the sashimi tastes better on sushi, so if you're craving raw fish.  Go for their sushi, it tastes a heck of a lot better.   Being from the Island, I say go here if you're craving the island food. It does live up to par, I just wish the poke came right from the ocean. Vegas needs a beach, so we can get a fish fresh!

Had AYCE sushi at the restaurant this time-- soo ono! Great staff, a bit slow when it gets too busy, but over all, there are so many items that you can order from-- and the food is so fresh! Only thing though, only 90 mins. max at the table and then one dessert per customer.  Good selection of desserts- tempura ice cream, mango mochi ice cream, green tea ice cream and 808 sundae (strawberries and tempura bananas with ice cream and chocolate).  I think that you can get the coco puffs or malasada too even!

My family love Island sushi grill. We come here once a week. We love the Poke Express. We love the sushi. They have something for everyone.   I would recommend any of the following: Poke AYCE Sushi  Garlic chicken Roast Pork with gravy Bento box Chicken eggplant Malasadas

Super disappointed with their cake. Chantilly cake has been my favorite cake for a long time and when I took a bite of the first piece of the cake I was disgusted. It tasted like the cake has been sitting their for 3 days. Hard and not moist at all. The frostings texture didn't even look like frosting. What a waste of $4.50.

I don't know how I have not reviewed this place, I eat here more often then I should for my waistline. This review is for their grill side since I have not gone to their sushi spot in years so can't judge it. The grill side has a small amount of seating,  but it's set up more for takeout while the sushi side is more of a restaurant.   I do recall the sushi side had half off happy hour prices on certain days,  so I recommend investigating that before you go for that specifically.   So back to the grill... First of all this place is the best place to get poke.  Super fresh, great selection of flavors,  and although I have only ordered by the pound, I saw they now also hopped onto the poke bowl and burrito band wagon.    Their mac salad is possibly my favorite of all the Hawaiian restaurants in town,  and their garlic chicken is fried perfectly, so juicy, while packing a level of flavor that makes me happy dance when I devour it.  One item you can't miss is their malasadas,  it is a Portuguese donut that became popular and adopted in Hawaiian cuisine.   Fluffy round donuts rolled in sugar, and I always get mine filled with custard.   Their vanilla custard is so perfect and creamy.  It's honestly my favorite donut in the valley.  I have tried the haupia filling, but I found it a bit bland, and had a slightly off taste.   Overall this is the most solid Hawaiian restaurant I have been to,  and I find myself craving it often. Even when I go visit Hawaii I find myself preferring items here, so they are legit,  and I am so glad I live by them.

Not sure on where to start. Had ayce on 10/14/14. Haven't been here in a while because I've gone to other places, and now I remembered why I stopped coming in the first place. 1) no customer service? I will not put our first server on blast but our second server made up for it, she was ok. 2) we were seated aprox 20mins before a party that came in and ordered waaay before them and guess what, their sushi came out 15mins before ours. Pls tell me what's wrong with this picture? Probably because I don't have the scooops with the peeps at island sushi. 3) they weren't even busy when we went but service was slow and unacceptable. 4) I have notice their quality in their tuna and it's something I don't recommend.   Overall, unless you know the people at ISG, great! You'll have better service than the people that don't know anyone there but still tries to give them the business they do not deserve. I guess I'll never come back, not even to their grill side. Oh wells....
We live coming here. The food is usually always good and makes me feel close to home.  I love their oxtail soup and wontonmin... You can't go wrong with the poke either...
Very good especially if you get there during happy hour alot of the menu items are 1/2 price off not bad at all

In a word........Incredible! I have enjoyed sushi and Hawaiian specialties all over the world and at what were advertised as the best spots in each local. However................I was blown away at Island Sushi Sunday Brunch. For $20.95,  its all you can eat and can choose from special offerings of the day as well as from a few pages of sashimi, rolls, tempura, and a whole host of apps. Service was exceptional and personal. Atmosphere was light and upbeat, feeling like a locals secret treasure. I had one fried roll of crab and other ingredients that was the BEST Sushi roll I have ever had in my entire life. I cant wait to go back. The bar has been reset.

Located on the Eastside. Known for the all you can eat sushi, and the all you can drink add on. This place isn't bad, it's no "I love Sushi" but then again, what is? But not bad for a quick casual stop in. The rolls were imaginative. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

One of the better sushi experiences I've had in a while. We stopped in on a whim and sat at the sushi bar. They had a happy hour 1/2 off sushi special that my girlfriend enjoyed and I did AYCE. Wayne was making our sushi and it was lightning fast. Loved the service we got. The rolls were also really, really good. They just seemed of better quality and lighter than what I am used to back home. The AYCE menu is vast with many options. Great experience and very affordable.

This has been one of my favorite all you can eat sushi places, but I was disappointed when I went in a few days ago and was able to order half rolls until it is my last roll? In all my years of AYCE, I'm not sure when this rule came about. Other than that, the food is great. They do seem to be understaffed at times though. It's typically busy but never seems to be enough servers. Connected to the sushi restaurant is a bakery where they have Hawaiian food and desserts which all look amazing.

Mmmm. Mmmmm. Mmmmmm. Love the baked sushi dishes. Baked lasagna.... a must try :) There are two sides to the restaurant. Island Grill & Island Sushi. Island Grill is a more of a sit down, let's eat quick or take it to go, section. They serve hamburgers, bbq/grilled food, noodles, etc. They also have kimchee rice! I fell in love at first site :) It was delicious (for you kimchee lovers). It separates into the Island Sushi room. A nice sit down, let's drink a glass of wine or a bottle of beer, area. There are 2 Tv's which usually has sports on (for you sports lovers) and a small bar where you can watch the chefs make sushi. If you are on a sushi fix, I recommend purchasing the "all you can eat" sushi menu. It is worth the price you pay! Noise level can get loud when there's a big sports event on TV.

Excellent AYCE (All you can eat) Value and prompt, friendly service. Fresh sushi is based on the volume you can push and how you can rotate your stock, and this place packs 'em in. For $25 (dinner AYCE includes more choices) it's no wonder.  I'm a purist. I don't do crazy rolls in which have gone the 2nd-day fish, drowned in eel sauce. Just the basics. For a place which specializes in rolls, i was pleased with the result. And I'm a fussy guy.  --uni nigiri. limit one. --ikura. fresh and good. --ika nigiri. soft, fresh. nice! --salmon skin hand roll. great fresh veggies. --hamachi kama. nicely seasoned, fresh. moist inside. WIN! --tako-uni. yeah, it's not really octopus, it's raw squid with extra crispy stuff. i love this dish. not for the unwashed. strong, dark and almost fermented, like a good natto. --seaweed wraps are fresh, dry, crispy, and great flavor. WIN!  #seaweed salad. something in there that shouldn't be. and it was not fresh.  servers are super friendly, responsive to all the obsessed AYCE gluttons. two sushi chefs keep that food MOVING to the 50-seats. (personal note: Kojisan@Hanajapanese, you would have been impressed!)  AYCE comes with rules, don't you know? ! all food ordered must be consumed (that includes rice) $1 penalty for uneaten nigiri. ! no take away. ! some items are one-per-person-per-visit ! your dining feast must end 90 minutes after you begin.

The sushi was very flavorful. They had very tasty sauces for each roll. The poki is excellent and can be purchased by the pound for take out. On Mondays they have half price regular and special rolls. This will be our Monday sushi place for sure

My bf and I found this place on yelp and fell in love with it in August.  We just went back on Monday and took advantage of the AYCE. Our waitress was super friendly and nice; actually, all the waitresses were awesome.  I love the service and the food.  Our favorites are: Island Roll, Dragon Roll, Tuna Belly, Ahi Poke, Octopus Kim Chi. We ate more than $150 worth, but only paid the awesome price of $25/person.    We ate so much, we passed out in the car.  That didn't stop us from having the same sushi craving the next day.  Love Island Sushi!!!  We'll be sure to make it a ritual to come here every time we're in Vegas.

The best sushi place...service and food is great!! I ordered the Kona, big island,and Salmon lover with cucumber, crab salad! They serve poke too!! Japanese and Hawaiian s a good combo! This place is at the top of my list!!

Needed my "fix" for some local grindz while in Vegas and chose Island Sushi & Grill because of the favorable ratings on Yelp.  Drove 16 miles (32 roundtrip) from DTLV out to ISG just to satisfy my yearning.  For the most part I wasn't disappointed, but I wasn't "overly" impressed.    It's a relatively clean place, but reminiscent of a local hole-in-the-wall diner back in the 808 - similar seats, stools, tables and floors.  Dine-in customers are still provided their meals in takeout containers, so that was a bit of a surprise. Typical local style, riiight?  Luckily the transplanted "Hawaiian" community hankering for island flavors are probably keeping this place open and in business.    I had the regular loco moco and my cousin had the poke chirashi. I love the fact that they make their own hamburger patties as the flavor was very good. The gravy was not generic and a nice change from what one might get at L&L. The mac salad was actually potato/mac, which anyone from the 808 would notice off the bat, so that was a nice distinction.    The poke bowl my cousin had was excellent. But, for the amount of poke provided it was priced maybe $2 more than it should have been.  It was good poke, no doubt...buuut, maybe a slightly bigger bowl for that price. This is why I won't eat at Tanioka's or Yama's Fish Market back on Oahu...  So why not 5 stars? Aside from the ambience (SO retro-local), it was the service we received...  Sorry.  Maybe because I'm in the service industry, but the staff - who look like kids of transplanted islanders - could perhaps meet/greet customers in a more friendlier tone and be a smidge more attentively as well.  It was taking a while for my plate, so I went back to the register and lo and behold, 3 workers chichatting in the kitchen about something with my order just sitting there. When one of them noticed me, he asked my name (???). WOW, how genius...we were the only ones in there - aside for some private party in the adjoining room.   Anyways, aside from service and price, this is a good place for local Hawaiians needing their 808 food fix.  Try it and enjoy...
Great happy hour! Half off all sushi Monday Tuesday Wednesday all day! Mowie wowie roll Is a must! My favorite out of the ones I tried.
Long wait to get served, sooo slowww... we decided to leave because none of them even greeted or asked if we were ready to order or not or even give us a water... not good!

one of my friends told me to eat here ... glad i made that stop and every day for 2 days till i left . the hawaiian food is on point . but the poke OMG the poke is amazing and im from hawaii i didnt know u could make as many different varities of poke .... i tried all of them .. every time i visit vegas im hitting this spot up

We have been coming here for about 7 years and had poor service for the second time in a row.  We do enjoy the food and we did have a large party but our experience went down even further when we spoke with the owner to let him know about our experience.  He could have cared.less that half of the table was served while the other half waited 45 min to get their food.  He just wanted to argue with us why it wasn't an issue.  Yes he is a small business owner, yes it was busy, no the customer doesn't get an I'm sorry you weren't happy from anyone.   Despite being the only sushi place we would visit for years we have decided to go elsewhere from now on.  Great.food is only half of the formula.  You need happy customers too.
Anytime im in Vegas this is a must stop. All you can eat or by the roll you cant go wrong. Top quality and decent prices. Great place!

The food here was DELICIOUS but the service from Krislyn was TERRIBLE and left a bad aftertaste in our mouths, hence the 3-star rating.   We ordered 2 bentos and spam musubis and they came out hot and fresh for our appetites. The cashier or server KRISLYN rudely slammed our food and forks on our table like she didn't care and she lacked manners. I'm easy to please and usually let things slide but the way she treated my partner and I actually bothered me. I'm not sure if she was having a bad day or if she was too busy but she should know better than to slam customers' meals on the table and she also didn't explain which order is which that I had to go up and ask another server which bento had mochiko chicken and which had garlic chicken. No one there seemed welcoming AT ALL.  I'm more likely to return since I loved the food but I really DON'T want to experience a repeat of that shitty service. The ALOHA spirit here during this one visit was nonexistent. First impressions are LASTING impressions so I'll take a deep breath and kind of expect bad service here again even though I love the food.

I've been here twice so far and both times were okay, I probably would come back here with some friends but not my first choice to frequent. I did all you can eat both times during lunch  and there's an hour time period. Service: 0 out of 10 The service was horrible, to the point where I kinda just wanted to up and leave. We ordered our food and after 20 minutes there was still no food. I gave them some leeway as we ordered a lot of dishes and it was kinda busy. Around the 30 minute mark our food came out but by that point we were already kind of annoyed. I spied at the corner of my eye that a table that got there after I did had gotten their food on the spot and that annoyed me even more. After we had finished our food there we wanted to order again but waving down to staff to give our ticket too was impossible. By this point a lot of the other tables had left and there weren't that many people anymore which left me confused as to why they couldn't see my hand waving a piece of paper in front of their faces. They also missed some of our orders and we left rushed and disappointed. Food: 7 out of 10 The food was the saving grace of the day. The crunch roll was amazing to the point where we ordered four and devoured them all. The candy cane roll was also good and kinda sweet which is a plus for me. Everything else was so-so.

The best place for hawaiian food in Vegas!! They are always consistent with the flavors! You can also get your poke fix here too!! The roast pork and garlic chicken combo will satisfy your sweet and savory cravings!!

Sushi was awesome. Staff was really nice and fast. We got three speciality rolls, (dragon roll, black widow, and the California deep fried roll) drinks, and strawberry mochi for 30 dollars. Monday through Wednesday is half off sushi. Will definitely be back.

I've had this place bookmarked for a few weeks now and decided to try it yesterday. My friend just got back in town and we wanted to catch up over sushi and sake. I Love Sushi (also on Eastern) is our usual go to but I suggested to be adventurous and try somewhere new!  When you first walk in I believe you're in Poke Express, a separate quick service restaurant inside Island Sushi. There is a place to order to the left and casual seating straight ahead. To the right is an entrance that opens up to Island Sushi which is a pretty small restaurant. We waited to be seated and the host said it would be about 30 min for a table. We decided to get started on sake at the bar and was seated at a table shortly after.   We weren't starving so we ordered a la carte rather than AYCE. I had the spicy garlic edamame, tuna poke, and a spicy tuna hand roll. The tuna wasn't very fresh in either of my tuna entrees. Hand roll was pretty tasteless, so I doused it in soy sauce/wasabi. The tuna poke was highly disappointing!! It wasn't flavorful and the texture of the tuna honestly felt like it sat out for a few hours. Some pieces were dry and chewier than the norm. The tuna was on a bed of seaweed salad, which was also dry. SO dry that when I tried to gather some seaweed salad with my chopsticks, I picked up ALL of the seaweed salad in an large chunk instead.   The spicy garlic edamame wasn't bad, but didn't taste extraordinary enough to make me want to come back to this place...  No complaints with the service, however, the dishes I tried here weren't memorable or enjoyable. Doubtful I'll return.

It is off the beaten path but well worth a visit.  Especially between 3 and 5 pm because of the 50% off rolls happy hour deal.  The variety of rolls to choose from is quite large.  We ordered five rolls, including two types of soft-shell crab rolls.  And $2 sake bombs.  What more can you ask from a sushi joint?  One star off because the 50% off deal does not apply to nigiri.  Oh well.

I don't know where to begin.  In the past month and a half, I've come to realize I've come back to this place 4 times. The food is delicious and amazingly priced. That's something that is hard to get around. But one thing that has always stuck with me in importance above everything else is customer service.   I'm not easy to deal with sometimes. Not because I have an attitude, but because I can be an annoyingly picky eater. For that reason, it is easy to see frustration and eye rolling in a situation where someone would have to press a couple extra buttons to modify an order in a job they don't exactly enjoy.  I can tell at least for a Kapua, Chase, and Gino, that this is not only a job they enjoy, but an atmosphere that has already made me feel welcome like family. They have already remembered me by name, they have went out of their way to make recommendations, check on myself and the friends I have brought with me, and have yet to make any visit any less than fantastic. The three of them have been an invaluable asset to the restauraunt and  instrumental factors regarding my three returns, and all the returns after this review that are to come.  Thank you for the fantastic food and fantastic service!
Great food and the best malasadas in town and they make good poke to order with a great selection

Decided to come for lunch and pick up. My order was 33$ and I was skeptical why it was so much. I got to my car and my order was wrong. I do not eat meat and specifically ordered a vegetable roll and they gave me shrimp roll. Went back inside and re ordered. Left again in my car driving away when I checked again. Wrong again!!! I had to drive back come back inside as they gave me a slight attitude. As if i shouldn't be mad I've spent an hour here trading my food and haven't ate today.  I also ordered chicken katsu for my nephew which they were going to let me keep the old katsu that has been sitting for an hour already. Lastly someone came up to me saying that I bit into one of the wrong orders. Seriously furious. This place sucks and the management sucks do not come !

Sushi is OK, the only reason my wife and I have got food from them was cause they delivered. Last night we tried to order delivery, THEY NO LONGER DELIVER. so we probably won't ever have there food again.

I enjoy coming here when I'm in Vegas. The food is always good and they definitely use fresh ingredients. I'm a sucker for sushi, and the fact that this place has an all-you-can-eat choice makes it more awesome. One of my favorite things to get, surprisingly, is the California roll. I don't know why. I just really like the way they make it. My other favorite thing to order is the salmon skin roll. Nice and crispy salmon skin with veggies in a sushi roll. Of course if you would rather order sushi without stuffing yourself with the sushi rolls, you can order things like ikura, scallop mayo, ika, unagi, and ahi. Service hasn't always been the best, but the servers are super busy, so you just need to be patient. This place definitely has the Hawaiian feels, so that's another reason I like coming here. I really wish Island Sushi was on Oahu.

I've only been here twice, the first time for their poke. The second time for their oxtail soup.  The poke was amazing! I got the furikake, garlic, and spicy avocado. It's about 15-16 a pound for poke but definitely worth it! The slice of haupia cake was pretty good, maybe just a bit overpriced. I probably wouldn't get that again.  I personally wouldn't recommend the oxtail soup. I asked the girl and she said that they just heat it up when ordered. I paid about 12.50 and I got 3 good pieces of meat/bone. I'm not sure if it was because it wasn't fresh, but I don't think the flavor of the broth was too great.  Other than that, I can't wait to come back and try their other dishes and even their sushi. I will definitely be back for more poke! :)

my friends took me here. i believe they found it here on yelp. the location is great cause it like 10 min from my apt on gv pkwy.  there are so many great things about this place i really cant get enough of it. i go about 2 times a month maybe more. the all you can eat is a great deal cause i love to put some rolls away. it is great priced too.  i usually start out with an ahi poke and some gezo. then the rolls start coming. from the chey to the island to the black widow. i don't believe i have ever had a roll i didn't like.  the fish is very FRESH. the rolls are very nicely put together and displayed. all the appetizers are great.  the other thing about the place is the staff ROCK. they are all super friendly. they are on the ball. they get your drinks regularly without asking. they are quick with anything you need yet are nice enough for a lil chit chat at the table. every one is super friendly, and keep the place clean.  so lets review-  fish fresh? YES  friendly amazing staff? YES  clean place? YES  nicely decorated? YES  would i go back? YES, many times  should you go? YES

So ono!!!  We are in town for the annual Ironman race and we always have a hard time finding something healthy to eat (and not just salads). A local friend recommended this place so we went here for dinner. I like that there are two sides to this place: the take-out/express and the sit-down restaurant.   We opted to sit down and were greeted with friendly and fast service as well as an extensive menu for fish and non-fish eaters. The AYCE option seem popular, but my husband choose the ahi avocado poke bowl (yum!!!) and I choose the teriyaki chicken combo, which is only $11 and comes with miso soup, a salad, edaname, chicken, rice, and dessert!!! And that dessert option is no joke! Tempura ice cream, green tea ice cream, mochi, sundae... I choose the creme brulée. Everything tasted great and the prices are reasonable. Definitely come back in the future.

For someone that does not like raw fish or anything too authentic like my husband (he's a regular sushi eater!) Island sushi is amazing! My husband can enjoy the "authentic" sushi while I enjoy they're amazing shrimp and garlic chicken! Definitely give them a try even if your not into sushi. They have other amazing things to offer & I love them for that! Oh and they're desserts are so so yummy

The food was so good. The server was excellent. And everything was quick yet fresh. The only thing that took a little while is the bbq chicken but it still tasted very good! We came in for happy hour on a Saturday night and got our food within 5 mins of ordering! Will be back!

We were dining March 21. Terry I love your food! It's amazing! The service is just really bad In a market flooded with sushi restaurants.    We still want to go but drive by and decided to go elsewhere in eastern due to the bad service.  I read other reviews and I am not the only one with the same opinion about the service.

A local recommended this place to us for AYCE sushi.  My husband and I were craving japanese food, so we said why not.    The service was great.  They adapted to our screaming child who refused to go to sleep.  They have a 90 min. time limit on the AYCE part, which sucks.  But I can see why they do that since the place is pretty small.    Their ahi poke was yummy.  My hubby couldn't stop eating it!  I ate more than him and our other guy friend.  I ordered the tempura ice cream for dessert.  The batter didn't taste that great, but it was a nice treat.
Went there for out second time. Great service, smiles, and delish sake. We went during happy our and got too much food for two people and dessert.  Only 25$! You'll leave happy and full here!

Malasadas are Ono, garlic chicken and mochiko chicken are good! Love the island special roll. Service sucked when we went. They had a short Filipino girl that served us and we seem to get her every time we go. We're always friendly and respectful but she always seems to give stink attitude. I wish she'd check the attitude at the door because it ruins our night--and we always come and bring friends to experience the food!

My dad's side of the family is from Hawaii, REAL Hawaiian blood.... & I have been coming here for years as my go to spot for fresh HAWAIIAN style poke by the pound! My favorites are the tako (octopus) limu, & the salmon poke (i usually just ask for it with onion, green onion / Hawaiian Style) try Pairing ur poke with the Taro chips they sell too! THEY HAVE THE BEST MALASADAS hands down, even better than the islandS. So, with all that said... aside from the POKE side,I'm posting this review because of the experience i had last night on the other side at ISLAND SUSHI in the actual all you can eat sushi spot. Our server's name was "MAC"...I've been in the hospitality industry for years & i must say my bf and i were impressed with his service. He was super cool, and kind, also suggestive & attentive. He was knowledgeable about the menu & i like how he'd suggest items when we didn't know what to order anymore! My family and I made sure we took care of him & tipped him more than appropriately. Everything we ate was so delicious & fresh, & the presentation was better than most AYCE places. This business/restaurant is the closest you'll get to REAL island flavor, I promise you.

Absolutely love this place!!!! Took my bestie here for her birthday the other weekend everything was great accept the fact the servers need to better communicate with other servers. Ordered a sushi roll from one of the servers walking by and waited a bit then another server came to take the same order we were initially for them finally getting the sushi and seen they had did a double order because of lack of communication. But other then that this is AlwAys my to go for sushi/Hawaiian food

This place is awesome....they have all you can eat and the freshest sushi we have found on this side of town.  They are always busy and a great place to visit.  Always friendly and glad to be of service....a must visit place.

Let me start off by saying that we order food from this place religiously. I would say minimum twice a week. We like the food, obviously.   The thing that started to bother me was every time we grab our pick up order, they ALWAYS forget things. Whether it's our somen salad dressing or Mac salad. Or they mess up our order. And we don't notice it til we open everything up when we get home. We usually brush it off and don't mind.  But today when my boyfriend grabbed our food, our combo hamburger meal came with a drink. My boyfriend didn't know. And I told him when he came home that we should've gotten a small drink. And we laughed at the sign that was stuck on the bag. We were like, really? It said they aren't responsible for the orders once the food leaves the restaurant.  Being that we are regulars at this establishment, and that they are ALWAYS FORGETTING things for our order. This was a slap in the face.   Why don't you guys just check the orders better. It's obvious this is a common mistake and that's why they put this note on all the food orders.   Unreal

3.5 Stars. Great food that comes with oblivious service. I really want to give it four stars, but missing and unfinished rolls can't justify it. Las Vegas is dubbed an honorary island due to "Local Kine" diaspora/migration to the desert, and as a result, we get lots of Hawaiian eateries in the valley. Yay! I personally do not like macaroni salad, deep-fried rolls, any roll that contains cream cheese, and sweet sauces. All these preferences go against many Americanized sushi and Hawaiian food protocol. Take my review with a grain of salt.   Their poke is delicious (at $10/lbs for takeout). Me and spicy food are like kindred spirits. I recommend the Lava Lover and Spicy Mexican. The standard Rainbow roll is tasty as well. The all-you-can-eat is a good deal, as long as you can grub until you burst. I love how the rolls aren't stuffed with rice like other places, but I don't like how many of the rolls are doused with this sweet sauce (miso? eel? ponzu? not sure) which was not pleasant and weird. Now only if they didn't forget my rolls, I would highly recommend it.

How much do I love this place?  Let me count the ways:  the wait staff and manager are VERY friendly, the sushi is always fresh and DELICIOUS, the all you can drink house sake, the competitive pricing, the hawaiian dishes, the takeout nextdoor, etc etc.  The list goes on!

What's not to love about this place?!  It's located away from all the busyness that is the Las Vegas Strip, it's decently priced, the fish is quality grade, and the AYCE menu is huge.  Ever since trying this joint out a couple years back, every trip to Vegas is not complete until we have a dinner at Island Sushi!
